lyGMUOChi5R-pvOXIcYQbQ.text: Pro: Good decent food.  My server was great and attentive although he had his hands full with so many tables.  I left my bag and had to go back for it, and the GM had it up front for me to pick up. Con: It's overpriced, but so is everything in Vegas.  Everything was going good until I had flipped the plate to show "stop Forrest Stop" to get my check slip.  The waitress supervisor, I'm assuming, came with another server and gave me an attitude of why I showed the sign and what I wanted.  I smiled and said, "check please."  My server gave me the check and so did the other one.  I gave my server 19% tip for good work, but a real ding for the rude supervisor.

gUksbeiK6GOCwM4zz0vmUA.text: By far my worst dining experience in Vegas.  All the decor was great, but the service was not.  The food was bland and greasy.  I felt heavy and tired walking out of the restaurant.

I5RSf07sxU2Hha6v5H762w.text: Went to Bubba Gump on a Saturday night. It wasn't as busy as I had expected it to be. We used to always go to the one in Hawaii and I was craving their Hush Puppies (which btw is to die for). I've always loved Bubba Gump. It's cool how this entire restaurant is based off of the movie Forest Gump.   Anyways, the food selection didn't seem like there was as much as the menu in Hawaii. We mainly came for the Seafood Harvest but unfortunately it wasn't on their menu.   We ordered the Calamari for appetizers, Run Across America Sampler (as a meal), and the Trio for our entree. All three tasted pretty good and were up to our expectations on taste.   The service was mediocre. Nothing exceptional but not bad either. Our waitress was nice for the most part. There were a few times that it was hard for us to get her attention, let alone any otter waiter/waitresses attention, but we'll give them a pass since there were 3 birthdays while we were dining there.   Overall, I'd go back again. I wouldn't NOT recommend this place because it definitely hits the spot if you're looking for seafood on the strip with a very minimal to no waiting line.

-barLqqD0YGyX1Bpf1kUfA.text: This is my 3rd visit to a Bubba Gump, and my 1st visit to the Vegas location.  First of all, kudos to the servers. They were certainly on point! Everyone helped out each other and were very professional. Thank you for our awesome customer service!  The restaurant is located on the top floor of where the Miracle Mile shops are. Very easy to get to and accessible from the strip.   Our table of 8 (gratuity already included) placed different orders, but I made out with the cup of gumbo and the Stuffed Shrimp (stuffed with crab). My gumbo was OK. I haven't had a gumbo as good as the gumbo from NOLA unfortunately.   My shrimp entree ($20) was soooo rich and buttery. WOW, such great flavor! I also tried my Dad's jambalaya and it was spicy! Drink lots of beer!!! I also tried the coconut shrimp, which I enjoyed as well. I had a tempura shrimp and I didn't care for it. There was a weird taste that accompanied it.   The drinks/cocktails are expensive so expect to pay an arm and a leg for them! I had a Corona and that went well with our savory entrees. We were all so stuffed for dessert.   Fun place to catch a meal. I love all the Forrest Gump memorabilia!

taifap9CO4IU4X-93vrvIg.text: Over priced and food was average.  I ordered the special which had broiled tilapia, grilled shrimp (Cajun), and shrimpy mac and cheese.  The mac and cheese was ok but they could have kept the bread crumbs.  My daughter got the crab legs which was probably the best meal at the table.  My mom and friend got the fried shrimp and fish and they said it was just ok.  Well the bright side is that I can now say we tried it.  Will not return.

tNn8_K1x7idQZd1bGzKLxQ.text: Came here after a friend in our party raved about a few things on the menu. And honestly, for what it is, Bubba Gump Shrimp is a pretty awesome place.  Started with the Hush Puppies, which were amazing (and came with a terrific dip); then did the Po Boy with Shrimp. Definitely not bad - the bread was a bit tough and the Mayo didn't quite stand-up to the other ingredients, but overall was still pretty good.  Also had a few Margaritas in the process.  Great service, clean environment, and awesome patio.

4JiUXA37iWxhy01IVtP0hA.text: I've been to a lot of Bubba Gumps but I would have to say, this location was my favorite!!!   We first wanted to sit outside on patio  and let me tell you... the view of the strip at night was so breath taking. Before we could order, it got a little windy and asked if we can go inside.   Our server was GREAT. She sat us inside and it was way bigger than the other bubba Gumps I've been too. This location is great for big parties.   Our food tasted fresh and very yummy! I can't wait to go back!   O-yeah and since I came in to celebrate my birthday, the whole staff surprised me with free ice cream and sang happy birthday.  I love this place!!!

nfAYKc_FXVvWkH7ZfcFD1g.text: I've tried and tried but I just don't know when I am going to learn my lesson to just stay away from chain seafood restaurants. Bubba Gumps is great for Forrest Gump memorabilia but not so great for the food.   The portions are small and very overpriced. I have been to numerous Bubba Gumps and they are all the same. No happy hour specials, no food specials, just an overall average dining experience.   I would not recommend Bubba Gumps if you are looking for good seafood, I would recommend it if you are looking to purchase Forrest Gump memorabilia.   I really really wanted to like this place which is why I have given it so many chances. But afyer going back 3 or 4 times it is safe to say three stars is being nice!   My recommendation is to find a real seafood place by the actual sea!

Udbbo7hHbKnF8LsH_8Y0xQ.text: First time here and I already love it! I had an appetizer called the shrimp net catch and got half Cajun seasoning and half of their own special seasoning. It was fun and delicious to peel the shrimp. However, the Cajun flavor lacked the spiciness of other Cajun seasonings I have previously tried. I also got a linguine pasta with capers which added a lot of flavor, topped with shrimp. Though it was a bit oily, I would definitely recommend it. Seafood wasn't my favorite, but this place made me love it! Would definitely come back!

DywSWfKzdGjMHnRgLVtSWA.text: Get the shrimp basket! It is a bit pricey ~$21 but I think you get a good selection of shrimps that they offer. It comes with coconut shrimp, tempura shrimp, cooked cold shrimp, regular fried shrimp, and some French fries. Also, my favorite sauce is the pineapple sweet and sour sauce! Try to ask for more sauce because I felt that you need more.   I also got the shrimp gumbo for ~$6. It was really spicy and had barely any shrimp. I honestly don't recommend it because it was spicy and hot.   The place is also on the second floor because the first floor is their gift shop.   Overall, I feel that most of their food was pricey for shrimp but if you want to taste good cooked shrimp the. Go here! Also, the gift shop is a good souvenir place for tourists!

knmyxQQieI-M8w0GebA_LQ.text: The place was empty when we arrived at 11am. The waitress seemed dull and unhappy to be there until the time to pay came around. Maybe she was having a bad morning? She explained to flip the sign over when we needed something. My friend said "why wouldn't she just casually check in every once in a while, instead of needing the sign?" Good point. We did not see the waitress in the quiet restaurant until the sign flipped for a refill. My friends all LOVED the food! I had the fried chicken breast with mashed potatoes and corn on the cob. The breading was crispy and the chicken was juicy, although no flavor or seasoning to it. I dipped mine in the gravy from potatoes to give it something. The potatoes were great and portion size was huge. It came with 2 breasts stacked. I split the meal with a friend, and glad I did when we saw it arrive with 2! Fun atmosphere, but I felt like the Chicago location's wait staff were more fun and friendly.

ZFrO1TqCPzEqN44UZtomZg.text: The food here is pretty typical fried American food. It was exactly what we needed: filling and delicious. The service was a tad slow, and it didn't seem like there were a lot of people dining, but we weren't moving very quickly after a crazy Friday night out. My po'boy wasn't the most memorable of the foods I ate while in Vegas, but it was tasty and I was sad that I couldn't finish it all. One of my companions got a recovery burger and fries and she basically moaned the whole time, so I think it worked. My other companion got a shrimp and rice dish and I think she probably won best dish on the table.   It was a nice experience going to such a touristy-chain and just enjoying ourselves. But, if I could rate the view, this would be a solid 5. It was so awesome to be looking over the city and getting some fresh air fairly early in the day before the blistering heat took over. I'd probably come back here just for that.

The shrimp is the best I've ever had and they make it many different creative ways. You might think it's just a seafood place, but you're wrong.   A fun family atmosphere for a casual price. They have surprise trivia mixed in and the staff is fun. Awesome vacation stop for a family or couple.

mIo-R_5SStaVvOh1YPZSWQ.text: Me and my girlfriend ate here on the second night of our vacation, and we both had a really good time!  As big Forrest Gump fans we both loved the was the restaurant was decorated, especially for my girlfriend who had never been to a Bubba Gump before.  We both enjoyed our meals, and despite it being the busy dinner time our meals arrived in no time at all.  Portions were plenty, and both of us struggled to fit it all in.  Hardly a bad problem to have.  All in all we both had a very good dining experience; from the food, staff, and atmosphere.  A quick photo at the Forrest Gump bench and the experience is complete!  Highly recommended, whether you like shrimp or not.

cBUGiVxoc0tiuun4cbQyhQ.text: My momma always said, "Life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get."  Well, no... actually Forrest Gump said that. MY momma always said, "For God's sake, Ryan, why can't you put down that Nintendo controller and play outside with the rest of the NORMAL kids? And what the hell are you wearing all that TINFOIL on your head for?"  No, Forrest Gump was the one who talked about chocolates, and Bubba always talked about shrimp, hence, we now have the chain of the Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. restaurants. They're all over in touristy spots, and the Seestur raves about the one in Anaheim in Gardenwalk. She even sports the sweatshirt proudly. This from a girl who would practically retch if she even got near seafood.  So boy, howdy, was I excited to see that there was going to be a Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. on the Las Vegas Strip. So excited, that I didn't even care it was located mere steps from the horrifying (to me) Goretorium. I was going to brave the danger and go to Bubba Gump, and if one of the evil scary monsters from Goretorium and/or one of the sleazy porno-card giver-outers on the corner of Harmon and the Strip came after me, well, by God I would buy fresh boxers from the Bubba Gump store.  If life is like a box of chocolates, I should have tried poking the bottom of the candies before coming here. I got stuck with that one everyone else dodges. You know, the one with the pink cream-ish center that's supposedly cherry or raspberry but tastes more like Pepto Bismol.  Las Vegans hardly need a reason to celebrate but we find them anyway, and as I had just been unceremoniously and hurriedly booted out the door by my former employer, ironically who stood across the street from Harmon Corner and rhymed with "Bosmopolitan," I decided to have a little "New Beginnings/I Got Fired" dinner at Bubba Gump's.  Figuring I was the last one there (as I usually am) and not wanting a demon to jump out of the Goretorium and eat my soul, I asked one of the store clerks, "So... I'm in the store... but where's the restaurant?" She smiled and directed me up the stairs toward the back of the store. A sign or something would have been nice.  I headed up the stairs, where I was actually first, gathered the party, and we were seated. They explained the license plates on the table that say "Run, Forrest, Run!" and "Stop, Forrest, Stop!" which I thought was a cute touch.  The crew was stellar. Our main waitress was super bubbly and thrilled when she heard we were all locals (like, apparently they had not been frequenting the place... what a shock no locals on the Strip). She was very attentive to our needs, to the point where we never really needed our "Run/Stop" plates on our table. She even regaled us with ghost stories in nearby mining towns. So despite whatever else I say in this review, the staff was great and should be commended.  And with that being said... well...   We started with a round of drinks. Since it was my firing party, I was ready for something nice and strong, so I went with Bubba's Blue Hawaiian: vodka, rum, gin, Blue Curacao, pineapple juice and Sierra Mist, yes, please, come to DADDY! The menu says $8.99, but don't be fooled! That doesn't include your collectible Bubba Gump glass, so you're more looking at $13. You have to specifically ask to NOT get the collectible glass, whereas I think it should be the other way around. But the drink was pretty good. Not quite an AMF, so it won't belt you on your ass, but not a totally tame drink either.  Dinner came around, and I have to say I was gravely disappointed with my dinner.  I got the Shrimper's Heaven, which along with french fries came with Fried Shrimp, "Chilly Shrimp," Coconut Shrimp, and Shrimp Tempura, along with three sauces: Asian, cocktail, and a Cajun sauce that reminded me more of orange marmalade.  I started with the "Chilly Shrimp," which I thought was just going to be cold shrimp like you might find in a shrimp cocktail. No, in fact, that is wrong. "Chilly Shrimp" is Bubba Gump's version of "Peel-n-Eat Shrimp," which means the shrimp is cooked inside its shell. Yes, shrimp have shells, and shrimp have legs, which took that portion of the dinner from "tasty seafood morsel" to "creature that used to be alive, probably leaving behind a family he supported and a shrimp company job that will have to do some PR work to explain his disappearance and he was probably named Charles." I can't eat things that could probably be named Charles. So there's a quarter of the dinner shot down.  The rest was tolerable. The coconut shrimp and fried shrimp were kind of dry, but the shrimp tempura was fine.  What wasn't fine was the bill: for JUST that and the drink, after gratuity I was paying $55 BY MYSELF. People, I just got fired! Just because I was paid out my vacation pay doesn't mean I need to be spending it all on dinner! I'll stick with Lazy Joe's for some good, affordable shrimp from now on.  I guess stupid really is as stupid does.

0ojXEfAsy8LCS03YwFn9jg.text: Enjoyed my Delicious meal! We had the accidental mahi mahi fish and shrimp and seafood feast! Food was well prepared and staff was friendly. For a Sat. Night the restaurant was not busy like other Vegas restaurants.

IDckALsH_kbMGjzjbZfaKw.text: Nice to see this restaurant make its way to Vegas. I have never been to one so I ventured in here during lunch over the weekend. As expected, since it is located on the second/third floor of Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile Shops, the location gets great foot traffic from people on the strip or those coming from the bridge from the Cosmopolitan or Crystals/Aria. The retail store has all sorts of neat shirts, accessories and souvenirs and you have to go up the stairs to access the restaurant section. My eye caught the Stupid is as Stupid Does Shirt!  Since I was on a lunch break I did not take long and went to the bar.   The only TVs I saw were at the bar and I did not see any in the regular dining area so I for now, I do not believe this is a good spot to try to catch any game; only come for the fish and shrimp dining!  I asked the bartender's recommendation and went with a cup of Mama Blues Shrimp Gumbo. He explained the gumbo as having worchestire sauce in it with a little kick and I like that sauce in my marinades so I was sold.  Surely enough, there was a little spice but   The main course I ordered was the accidental fish/shrimp. This was a broiled mahi mahi with jasmine rice, grilled shrimp that came with a side of lemon butter with roma tomatoes. I've had freshly caught mahi mahi in Hawaii so I have a high standard when it comes to this fish. The one they served came very close but not quite that standard. It was a generous portion and came with some shrimp which I thought could have been bigger.   The price of the meal was kind of high as well but that's what's expected from restaurants on the Vegas strip. This was a great experience and hopefully I'll buddy up with one of the staff there to come back in and get a discounted hookup. lol.

Ge2163AaxmmdeF_pUC_m7Q.text: OMG....THE worst ever. I came here because we went once  to the one inMaui Hawaii , I had the teriyaki burger best ever. Now we live in Las Vegas and I wanted to re-live the Maui experience. ....Well so said No teriyaki burger on menu NO shakes either. So I get the ribs with maui maui shrimp..So big and delicious on menu...actually very small dinner and as I write this I am waiting  for my dinner because ribs were Ice cold...wife had shrimp app just ok, and a root beer float they made special...she had to put my root beer in it cause it taste awfull....and son had pizza he's happy.....still no meal for me....wait..wait...wait...

0Hj_pKfCyA1Pw3jhc4izhg.text: This is more about their corporate side of things... First of all, they don't follow through with what they say. They had called me but I wasn't able to take their call since I was in the shower but they said they would call back in 30 mins... It's now been a week! So I see that this particular corporation doesn't care about what customers really think as long their pockets and wallets stay full. Anyone that knows me knows that the cost of food isn't an issue but more of the quality/quantity of what I'm paying for and in this case I received neither. If I'm going to pay $20+ for a "feast" I expect to get what I pay for. I'm sure they could really care less whether I ever go back to anyone of their establishments since I'm only one person but I won't take one step on their sidewalk. Thanks for your "professionalism" Bubba Gump Shrimp...

DBnPMNHGYOgPy8MLBj-62g.text: Went with a group of people last night before closing. I am four months pregnant and asked for a well done burger as I have to eat throughly cooked meat. My burger was burnt to the point that it was inedible. Didn't want to make a fuss so I didn't eat it. Waiter charged me for extras I didn't purchase. Hesitated to fix. Ended up double charging my credit card. Let him know and he became upset and started to sigh. Didn't tip him for his rude service. Checked my balance again, a third charge has come up. Very dismal, horrible service. First time and last time I will eat here.

The presentation of the dishes had us salivating, but the food was just not it. It lacked flavor and freshness.   I personally love the movie "Forrest Gump", so I was really excited to try out this restaurant. But, the food fell way below my expectations. I don't know if it was just an off day for the chefs, but all the dishes were mediocre.   The restaurant is located on the second floor. You have to go up through the Bubba Gump merchandise store on the first floor to get to the restaurant. There wasn't much of a wait. We went on a Saturday evening.

p49hvSqF6nTmqiVDiVkiog.text: I'm giving this place a two because the food did not taste freshly made. The shrimp tasted bland and was extra greasy. My fries were not fresh. The pasta that my friend had was extra dry even with the extra sauce. The only thing good was the fried lobster tail . I will not be returning to this restaurant .

FjvNuVrr8k2RdeFSzG8FGg.text: Absolute terrible service. Friends food was cold and my chips tasted like they were fried in old grease. Server clearly did not want to serve us. I had to wave him down for a refill. Very disappointed.

YeBMuK2YhBYDz-8LrPqS4A.text: Food was excellent, service was not. We ordered a basket of fries with our dinner which was not delivered. When we told our server and the gentleman who brought our food neither one apologized, just said "It never came out"? They both were fairly rude, and never said thank you. We held the door for another server, and again didn't get a thank you. Service is everything to me, I won't be back.

-kXh9tfM6ylQ6v-jBKwkJg.text: Good service and great food, my first time going there was very enjoyable and the shrimp was delicious.

xLz3P8ZIhuz39ajwZDUKZw.text: I'm familiar with Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., particularly their Makati branch. The decorations and designs are pretty much the same sans the UNLV memorabilia near the bar. Walk past the Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood until you reach the staircase at the intersection (next to the Cosmopolitan if you're on the other side); you will see the BG entrance at the top.  Watermelon Lemonade ($10): Easy, breezy, lemoneezy. The drinks are currently being served in light-up glasses that you can take home with you. I couldn't really taste the watermelon, as it was more tangy and lemony, but it was good. I'd probably order a strawberry lemonade next time, though.  Hush Puppies ($10.29): Chunks of shrimp, fish, and corn mixed, battered, and deep fried served with their house remoulade on the side. Each hush puppy was bite sized and quite flavorful with or without the sauce.  Cup of Gumbo ($5.99): I found the gumbo to be pretty flavorful; you can taste the andouille sausage, shrimp, green onions, and spices all blended together. It isn't too thick, but it was definitely not watery either.   Shrimper's Heaven ($22.99): This was my choice, and I found it to be pretty good. You get four types of shrimp--tempura, golden, coconut, and grilled--with fries in each basket and three sauces--Tangy Asian, Cajun Marmalade, and Zesty Cocktail. Of all the types of shrimp, the grilled one was my least favorite; it is flavorless even with the sauces. Speaking of sauces, the Tangy Asian flavor doesn't stick to the shrimp.   We also ordered a bowl of Clam Chowder ($7.99), Bourbon Street Mahi Mahi ($20.49), Captain's Fish and Chips ($16.99), and Strawberry Lemonade ($5.99/ea and $0.99/refill). I did not try the Mahi Mahi, but it was said to be flavorful. The fish and chips were good--the fish was nice and flaky--but at its price, the serving is too small. As for the clam chowder, it was nothing special; it's not bland, but more of a "light" chowder. I forgot her name, but the waitress that was in charge of my group's table was awesome; service was fantastic.

JdnjxQZKGvahXbrSTSR7vA.text: Ummm half empty restaurant and we walk in with a party of five asking to eat appetizers and drink. They said sorry the patio is only for people who eat food. As the saying goes, "stupid is as stupid does". Happy 50th birthday to me. Just not at this place.  We ended up at another patio and dropped about $250. They welcomed us with open arms.

gqrEeb0p-BXTGHce2P9EEw.text: Let me preface this by saying  I DON'T LIKE SEAFOOD. I wish i was so enamored with it that I could destroy a bucket of shrimp and be happy about it, but I cain't.   I just cain't.  Okay -- now that that's done, I can confidently tell you that the solid 3 stars is only based on the service. The food left a bit to be desired. WIth all of the seafood buffet opportunities, I think that this BG cannot afford mediocrity.   We were greeted on the first floor by the hostess, who ushered us into the store and up the stairs. There was a short wait, then we were seated. I can imagine this place when it's busy, and I definitely do NOT want to be waiting on the stairs, my man.   Our waitress was entertaining and gregarious. She was also very attentive to our table and got us whatever we needed, which was nice.   My friend had the fish and chips. The chips were good. Not many places can ruin fries - no worries there. But the "fish?" Boo. WAAAAAAAAAAAY too much breading, she could barely find the meat!  Fun fact: you tell the waitstaff that you need help by flipping over the license plate signs to the RED side. This lets your waiter know that you are ready for service or you have a concern/question. They'll tell you that, " you're in the drivers' seat."   I see what they did there.   I got the burger. It was really good, but nothing spectacular. It kept well, but I was not too happy about the price tag. I believe there was only one option for a burger, so I was sour that I felt overcharged to add cheese to the burger.   And what is a burger without cheese? WHAT. IS IT?  The outside seating looked pretty appealing, but it was definitely chilly considering the temperature had dipped down into the 50s. and for the desert during midday, that was a little too CRISPin Glover for me.   If you know you're about to get the chili's rate seafood experience, then you will not be dissapointed. As my friend pointed out, she would have liked more fish with her breading. From what I saw her pick off, it was an accurate assessment of the FISHuation.   ...that kind of worked.

xKyu4sukdoeDS9xs2ptF8Q.text: I worked at the Bubba Gump in Kailua Kona, HI; so I have been in love ever since and was Extremely happy they opened one in Las Vegas, NV. So my husband and I went for dinner on Friday evening.   Location:  Is perfect if you ask me, the outside balcony seating that over looks the strip is great. They have the same Forrest Gump memorabilia everywhere. Only thing I didn't like was the entrance to (well all the people), you get to the front where there is a booth and the hostess radios how many (fine) they direct you through the gift shop up the stair (OK) there is a guy that tells you to enjoy your meal at the bottom of the stairs (nice) then you get to the top of the stairs where a person then tells you to follow the yellow smiley faces to another set of hostess. (at that point too much) which from there you are finally seated. I think they should have the booth out front and then one at the top of the stairs.   Food & Service: Our server was amazing and very nice, while we waited they did the traditional trivia of the movie Forrest Gump. The food we got the Crab Stuffed Mushrooms for an appetizer, they were good but the pan was hotter than the inside of my crab. It was tasty but could have been better, next time we'll get something different. I got the Jambalaya (which the server tells me its the spiciest thing on the menu) of course I'm like that's fine (thinking everyone has their own version of spicy) it was spicy but it wasn't too hot where I couldn't eat it; YUMMY! I wanted the Gumbo but didn't see it on the menu and over heard another waitress say they didn't have it. My husband got the Accidental Fish and Shrimp (the fish is Mahi Mahi) it was delicious as well, the fish was cooked perfectly. We ended up splitting each others dishes (half and half) that's how good both were.

MAm3tMZqsoKRMXdaxp512Q.text: This was my first time eating at Bubba Gump and I'm sure it will be my last. I am not a picky eater but my boyfriend and I developed the worst case of upset stomach after eating here. The location is good and the service is wonderful...  BUT the food  just did not sit well with us.   We ordered the dip for an appetizer. It was okay, not super hot as it should have been. I ordered the shrimp poboy for an entree which was delicious. My boyfriend ordered the grilled chicken sandwich. Again, we are not food snobs and this was the first place we ate in the day. I'm gonna assume it was the dip that did us in. I really would love to give this place more stars. The waitresses are really good and attentive. But based on the vomiting and upset stomach my boyfriend and I both experienced after eating here I just can't. If you eat here maybe just stay away from the dip!

T-W60RBjRL8jB_FA1GC4Lw.text: Stopped here while on the strip because they had seating outside with a view of the strip! The view was nice. The food was delicious and very prompt! 6ySdvM-bjZSE9OL7ao7Mrg.text: If you like fried seafood and Forrest Gump Trivia then this place is for you. We ordered a seafood platter, which included fried shrimp, fish, fries, calamari and different sauces.  My gf opted to order grilled shrimp entree. The food was ok, nothing to write home about. The shrimp seemed frozen and the fish had no flavor. The batter used for the fried food was ok. The French fries were bit stale too.   I did score some good points on the Forrest Gump trivia. Overall it's an ok restaurant, given the choices for restaurants on the strip, I'd skip this one.

syYR9zycmrzDQXoXgYhkgg.text: This place was just okay. We had a coupon for free appetizer and that's the only reason we went. We didn't have a choice of what appetizer we wanted and had to get the spinach dip which was the worst spinach dip I've ever had. My husband had the seafood feast and I had the shrimper's heaven. We spent about  $40 which was way too much considering the quality of the food and subpar service  The portions were decent but I probably won't go back.

Op4KEch_X7IEnCZCjOqufA.text: I took a trip to Las Vegas,  for a few days,  and let me say this.  If you do not have a Bubba Gump's near you,  then this a must stop!!!!   Let me start off by saying their drinks are A1!  I mean I can not complain at all.  I ordered a Peach Colada which I believe is off the seasonal  menu,  one item that seemed like a shrimp ceviche,  for me dinner I order a shrimper's heaven,  and a sampler dessert.  I really wanted to try some of the best of everything.  Now I must admit this dinner did cost a bit more than what I was expecting to spend but was it worth it absolutely.   Now my waitress was definitely fun,  we had a few laughs,  We never went without anything.  I will definitely eat here anytime I am on a trip due to the fact we don't have one here in Dallas.

x8B60PBLpYRYxOhRThMMOA.text: I had a great experience at this restaurant. The hostess gave us a warm welcome and we were seated almost immediately. We were seated outside at first for the view of the strip. However, it was a little too humid so we asked to move inside and was moved immediately.   The server was very friendly and attentive, she came to our table in less than two minutes after we sat. She gave us time to place our orders and was very thorough in Describing what to expect from the dishes.   Our food was served in a timely manner, however in between our food being served the waitress made sure we were comfortable. Our food was exactly as she described. I ordered the shrimp and chicken jambalaya, it was awesome! If you like spicy food I definitely recommend. My mom ordered a shrimp dish that she enjoyed. However my sister ordered the lobster salad; the lobster was overcooked. The manager immediately took it off the bill when he learned that she was not satisfied with her food.  Overall I had a great experience here. Nice family restaurant while in Vegas, I never fail to be amazed by the Forrest Gump memorabilia!

UAScpQb-BsgiemQu0qAm2g.text: This is my favorite theme restaurant everywhere- been to the Oahu (the most visited one), Maui, Anaheim, and San Francisco locations, and finally here! I was wondering when one of these would come to town- what took so long?! I'm a Landry Select Club member, so I can easily rack up more points for rewards (spend $250, get $25 in card credit).   This one is located next to the Miracle Mile Shops, so here are your options: park at Valet at Todai or park at the Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile Shops parking garage- enter the shopping center but exit out of the Todai side, and take the escalators or in our case, the elevator- we're parents now, so we're pushing a stroller. From here, a host will direct you. You will go through the store, into the elevator and up to the 3rd floor. From here, the host will seat you. It wasn't that busy, for lunch on a saturday, but then again, it's still new.   New, clean, featuring memorabilia from the movie, seems a little smaller compared to the other locations, but the ambiance feature is this one is overlooking the popular Strip. There were some patrons outside, but it was too cold for us, plus, our two-month old baby. There were some tables  with chairs and booths (the booth was too small for us- we had a stroller). I can't comment on the bathrooms since I didn't leave the table.   On to the food, the "Run Across America Sampler"- hush puppies, artichoke dip and chips, spicy chicken, fried shrimp, and peel 'n eat shrimp, is our absolute favorite. The price was $15.99, slightly higher than the last time but maybe the prices have gone up since then (last year- Oahu). This one never disappoints- we always split it. My husband really loves the hush puppies, it's his favorite. Mine is probably the chicken. I got the strawberry speckled lemonade at $5.99- refills are 99 cents. (Similar to Red Robin's lemonade.) The Ice Cream Caramel Spice Cake was phenomenal! This was $8.99, but well worth it. We've had the other ones in the past-  the bread pudding, strawberry shortcake, and the cookie sundae, but this one is specific to Las Vegas- it's new. I'm pretty sure we are getting this dessert again. It seems like a seasonal flavor combination, but really, you could have this all-year round. The server was really nice, and the service was pretty good, too. We got to ask the server questions about the movie. The manager stopped by to see how we were doing. He even changed out my wobbly chair.   My husband thinks that this takes away from when we go out of town, because we always include this place in our must-haves/must-eats, but I really like that it is finally here, where we live. I hope that this place does well. Las Vegas and certain restaurants do not always mesh (except mexican restaurants seem to pop up when space opens up). And I intend on getting a shirt at some point, even though I live here. We were pretty stuffed and needed to walk around the mall to get a little more comfortable.

-6I5fDcDZa-FI_1Z9wVOUw.text: This place is funny. Went here with some friends for the first time, and let me tell you, the stop and go signs on each table is fun to use. We were seated in like 2 minutes during lunch time. They were a little under staffed that day so we had like 3-4 waiters. No biggy. Pricing was reasonable. We ordered our food with no problem and it arrived in a average time period. Everybody was satisfied with the tasty food. It's a little above average seafood. I say this because clearly I've been to a few top seafood restaurants where the seafood is absolutely and freshly define. But I'll come here before I go to Red Lobster.

751QfBRspDWlpSWJ2vd57g.text: Ok Ok, at first I was bummed about going to a "chain" restaurant in Vegas but I was wrong, it was pretty darn awesome!  I'm a tourist, I bought the Las Vegas Bubba Gump glass my drink came in, it came with a plastic cocktail shaker too!  Ok, onto the food  Fries were Awesome, with the sauces. The Calamari lil soggy. Shrimp Gumbo, Yum! Seafood Paella, Wow! Delicious! PACKED with seafood and packed quite a punch! Spicy! But not too spicy so you can't taste, but pretty close, Mmm! Loved it!  And that drink everyone talked about - Great! Bit sweet but that's to be expected, it's a fruity frozen cocktail. I don't know if I'd run back here given all the other choices in Vegas on and off strip, but i would definitely not be disappointed if this was the chosen dinner venue again.

jR3LUkrRpNv4-G4qUd_60Q.text: If you like Forest Gump, then i would recommend you stopping at Bubba Gump. They have good food and trivia durning your meal. Im sure there is better seafood in vegas but since i have been to other location we decide to stop! Even if you don't like seafood, this is a place to stop because they do a phenomenal job on seasoning.  They also have good Specialty Alcoholic drink with a souvenir cup.

Qtz8SoHXuXrRfwZvjnGjSg.text: Had this restaurant bookmarked for some time now so we finally tried it for dinner last night.  Location - great view, but horrible to get to.  It is quite a far walk no matter where you are coming from.  You can either park in the garage in Miracle Mile shops, park across the street at Harley Davidson cafe (for a small price), or park at the Cosmopolitan and walk across the bridge.  The views, if you are sitting outdoors, is awesome!  The location is overlooking right in the middle of Harmon and LV blvd. which has the views of City Center and The Cosmopolitan.  Restaurant - Forrest Gump themed.  If you are a fan of the movie, you will appreciate the memorabilia all over the walls.  First floor is the retail area, Second floor is the actual restaurant.  Food - Overly priced small portions type of meals (what one should expect of a strip restaurant).  My boyfriend ordered 2 of what our server recommended which was the Georgia Sweet Tea (alcoholic drink) and the Shrimp New Orleans.  I ordered Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp.  I loved the sweet tea drink (again, it was a steep price for a small drink).  I didn't care for the sauce on the Shrimp New Orleans dish (even though the server raved about it).  All that matters is my boyfriend liked it.  The Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp dish was nothing out of the ordinary.  It was shrimp, sausage, mashed potatoes which shoestring chips on top.  I probably could have made this myself if I made the effort to.  Staff - friendly and attentive, but then again the restaurant wasn't that busy yet.  We did get a free glass at the end of our meal.  I didn't really catch the reason why, but I think it's because of the drink we ordered.  Honestly, I don't know if I can recommend this place mainly because of the price.  But if you are like me who has to try it just to say you tried it, live the experience..!

GCgDEO_l50kvfntitsaxFg.text: I'm not normally a big fan of chains, but I have to admit that I liked this restaurant. The hushpuppies are my favorite item because they have seafood in them. I had the Shrimp New Orleans which was very tasty with the perfect amount of seasoning and tasty sauce. zmW4865rcus0Pe5i1BeTXw.text: I ate here last night with my family and had a fantastic dining experience!  First off, there are a lot of stairs up to the restaurant (we didn't know at first that we could've taken the escalator from outside). So without hesitation, one of the waiters met us at the Bubba Gumps gift shop and led us to the employee elevator then escorting us past the kitchen (kinda cool to see) to our table. L2JvU91PI1_043liMzA3Ug.text: i am such a HUGE fan of forrest gump! it's one of my all time favorite movies! :]  so this was my first time eating at a bubba gump and i've got to say, i fell in love with the theme. it was so interesting! there were so many signs and there were pictures and newspapers. there were also these adorable little signs that said run forrest run, and stop forrest stop!  the prices are were high but i thought it was fun. my friends and i were sat at such a bright room, and it was spacious and white! i think it was meant to resemble forrest's home since it seemed like it was back in the day. it was decorated with plates and pictures which i thought was extremely cool!  the waitresses were the nicest people i've ever met. they came every time, just to check up on us, which means, drinks all day every day!  anyways, loved the place and i'll come back next time when i go back to vegas!

_XSxrgSp9erSRSwpY7uOqg.text: Bubba Gump Shrimp has arrived in Vegas! Last Saturday, I arrived on the Strip to dine in Bubba Gump.        I have been to Bubba Gump Shrimp as a tourist in New Orleans and Chicago. I had been waiting for the grand opening of their Las Vegas vacation. Last Saturday the wait was over.      Bubba Gump Shrimp is located in the new mall that opened up on the northeast corner of Las Vegas Boulevard at Harmon Avenue in the shadow of Planet Hollywood. It is a second level tenant with pedestrian traffic from  two strip pedestrian overpasses. Currently it is easy to find because a lady is advertising it to passersby. At the entrance is the menu. I appreciate it when restaurants have the menu at the entrance. I prefer to have an idea of what I want to order before I step inside a restaurant. Once we decided what to order,entered through the edge of the Bubba Gump Shrimp Gift Shop. The woman greeter nicely directed us upstairs. Once upstairs, we were directed to stand on a cue of circles in a waiting area of the restaurant proper. If you have waited to ride on Disney Land's Star Tour's ride, this is a similar arrangement. Inside the restaurant, there is a spectacular view of the Cosmopolitan. When the weather is nice, the balcony seats overlooking the Cosmopolitan is a prime dining spot. The weather was cool and we sat in the general Forest Gump themed dining area.     If you have never been to Bubba Gump Shrimp, they have a neat gimmick. On the table is a sign that you flip. If you want service, I believe you set it to "Stop Forest" and if you don't need service, I believe you set it to "Run Forest Run."     If I was in vacation state of mind, I would of spent $21.99 on the Shrimper's Heaven. I was in a budget state of mind. Bubba Gump Shrimp is a reasonable option if you are on a budget on the Strip. I ordered the Shrimp Po' Boy sandwich with fries and bottomless Coke. After a tip, the dinner came to $22. Not bad!     I have a minor complaint, which is the waitress up selling a restaurant card. When the waitress sat next to us, my instinct was that she was not a die hard Forest Gump fan that wanted to share with the world that Forest Gump played football and that he was from Alabama. When I am eating out, I do not care if Forest Gump was wearing no sneakers in a scene or that football was a sport he played. I want to relax! By the time I am eating I have passed enough people in the hotels trying to sell me time shares. Fast forward to when we were walking out, they were advertising sales at the gift shop. In other respects, the waitresses were friendly and served with an urgency.     Most likely I will return to Bubba Gump. If I am in a tourist state of mind, I will relive my past vacations with Bubba Gump's Shrimper's Heaven.

ugopKjBIyetsSYk8sHYJsA.text: Glad they finally have one in Vegas!  So when you get to the hostess, they ask you "So what did Jenny tell forest to do? RUN FOREST RUN!" I thought they were going to make us run to our table..So that was uncomfortable, not expecting pop trivia. So after we get seated they explain the stop and go sign to us. Love it, because EVERYONE stops to help, not just waiting on your server..  So server comes back with food and before we get to eat, we have to answer 3 more questions about the movie.. I was a bit annoyed because if you don't know the answer you kinda feel stupid.. even with trick questions like "What was the name of Forest's dog?" He didn't have one..  I think next time, I am going to lie and say I never seen the movie.. Less questions. I am such a party pooper I know.   Food is what I come for, which is always good. I walked out like I just ate a buffet, which only was the Shrimp mac and cheese lol.

EiOzoZpuPRLKlRJ7fmso7A.text: Went there on a Saturday @ 11:30 a.m or so. So it was good I beat the crowds.  The first thing I noticed was the smell and look of a new building, thats always a plus. They have plenty of space there and the design worked with the location hovering over the strip. The interior stayed True to the theme of the restaurant.  We had a great waitress, I forgot her name but it was evident she enjoyed her job and was truly happy to work there.   The gumbo, EXCELLENT. Even the waitress said "Bet you wish you ordered the large". LOL. I had the cup. Beautiful arrangement and quite a bit of sausage and fish. I destroyed it in about 5 minutes. I recommend anyone reading this to try it.   Had the seafood feast, The fish and shrimp, very tasty. Light and with flavor and not that heavy grease aftertaste as you would have in some places. Seasoned just right. Now some would say that it didn't have enough seasoning to the batter but I think it is just enough to where you don't overwhelm the taste of the actual fish and shrimp.  Try it. I would recommend trying every incarnation of shrimp they serve. I have my sites set on the Shrimpers feast next..  Cloe slaw- cut fresh as you order it, not drenched in mayo. +5  Only thing the jury is out on, and probably because of my own tastes...the hush puppies. I like the more flavorful ones,like at Long John Silvers...if you try both you'll know what I mean. But not work deducting a star, When your main course is good, who cares about the side piece.   My biggest endorsement is that Gumbo, TRY it....You wont be disappointing. Well done Bubba!

qTku3fPBRIb0aG-L3bQiOg.text: Food - 3.5 stars...I had the shrimp boat (or whatever it was called).  Basically 4 different shrimps with fries.  All of them were pretty good (not great).  Wife had the Bourbon fish and shrimp.  Again pretty good but not great.  My daughter had the shrimp mac and cheese.  That was very good (and rich).  We shared a decent not great dessert. Of the 4 different ones (SF, Anaheim, Monterrey) I have been to this was the worst.  Service - 2 stars.  Only because we had to flag someone down after we got seated at our table for 20+ minutes.  I believe she was the manager walking around on duty (not sure).  She was apologetic and friendly.  Service got a little better but still had long periods of waiting (like ordering dessert).   Price - 3 stars. It was fair enough for the Strip.  Most meals are $18-$23 a plate.   Ambiance - 4 stars.  We got seated at our request on the patio and had a great view of the strip.  It was a chilly night but the heaters were working just fine.    Now if you guys can just work on better service.

HsFO8B8q1Ud1Vtxpce2_QQ.text: I have heard so much about Bubba Gump and vowed that I will one day visit this establishment. And that day was a month ago at the location on The Las Vegas Strip.   First obvious observation was the wait time to be even acknowledged or greeted by someone . . . ANYONE! Willing to at the very least say "Hi or Hello!" Once that was out of the way, it took a few more minutes to find a clean/ready table/booth to be seated.   Remember this was my FIRST visit to Bubba Gump ever! The food FINALLY arrived and it looked delicious, so I did the only thing left to do and that was to start eating. For someone who dine out often, there's NOTHING special about the food served at this restaurant. The seafood plate was my LEAST favorite! and after about 2 bites of the Fish I stop eating it. For a moment I thought I was eating Vinegar because that's all I could taste. I did my best to try and get a faint taste of the fish but it was NO where to be found because the fish was drowned in vinegar. If that was not bad enough, on my 2nd spoonful of rice and fish and chewing I bite onto something hard that caused a friction in my mouth and brought goosebumps to my skin. Just take a look at the pic you will see a BLACK particle and that was what I found served in the food that I bite into. Needless to say, I was DONE with this food and eating. Brought it to the attention of the Host who showed NO Empathy or any signs that she cared about my experience even though from the very start of our interaction I brought that to her attention. What happened next was my server who came over and I pointed out that BLACK stuff to her and told her I'm ready for my check but I don't want this food NO more. She apologized and asked if I wanted something else. The next person who came to my booth was the manager who apologized as well and asked if I wanted to order something else to which I replied NO! This is my FIRST time here and I don't look forward to returning any time soon!  Believe me when I say even you can make a better Gumbo on your own at home. The Gumbo served here is average! I don't recommend this place!

2qB9wOKCG49pmShP0aJsMw.text: Nice staff and good service. Food was decent, chowder a bit gritty though... Gonna pay Vegas prices but that's the case with anyplace to eat on the strip. $99 bill before tip for 3 people.

mheejxCt7YNW5AZzbAhZrA.text: If you are craving seafood in Vegas, you will not be disappointed at Bubba Gump Shrimp. Even in the middle of a desert, the atmosphere makes you feel like you are near a body of water with the typical seafood decorations - hardwood floor, wooden walls, rustic decorations, big windows, and mismatched seats. There are a lot of positive vibes with the friendly staff and delicious food.   I first had the jambalaya, which had chicken, shrimp, andouille sausage, bell pepper, onions, rice, green onions, tomatoes, and a decently spicy sauce. The jambalaya was a savory dish, full of flavor and filled with tender meat.   I also had the shrimp scampi, which had shrimp (of course), capers, and linguine (duh). This dish was rich and zesty with the lemon garlic butter that covers it. The shrimp was tender and good in size. It also went very well with the garlic bread that came on the side. You definitely cannot go wrong with the shrimp scampi here.   Additionally, I like how you can flip a sign indicating whether you need a waiter or you would like to be left alone. The sign worked well in the beginning, but towards the end of my dinner, it did not seem to do any good with getting help when needed. Maybe this was a one time deal, but it was still disappointing. Now, the server did apologize when my table received the check; so, I am appreciative of that.   Overall, a spectacular atmosphere with tasty food.

e2VcJAvKtIIvv5C9P7Psuw.text: If I could leave zero stars I would, Firstly visited this resturant tonight for hubs Birthday celebration and the experience was horrible, The appetizer with shrimp and mac was so so, but once mine and my husbands order came his ribs were inedible they had been boiled and were very chewy and couldn't be bitten into, and as im eating the fries with my order I dipped into ketchup and i was about to eat it, there was hair on it, i was disgusted. I spoke with my waiter and told him what was going on he spoke with the manager who was VERY RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL,  so I pretty much GOT ROBBED  and had to pay for food I was unable to eat. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE TERRIBLE. They need to work on training they employees on CUSTOMER SERVICE,  because without customers your business would NOT exist.

4JrdsYLHwoBeI49MOy7xMw.text: Been to this place twice in one day, only because Krystian was a great waiter, and my water had the lemon I asked for.. other than that it was an okay experience.  The peel and eat shrimp had the smaller shrimp size, that sucked.... the garlic sauce sucked, it had this sweet sort of sugary taste to it, and the Cajun sauce was weird too, I can't really explain it, however it was not the old bay type of taste I expected. The shrimp PoBoy was more bread and sauce than shrimp and bread. Basic.... honestly the good thing that I liked about this spot other than my water with lemon had to be the fries that came with the PoBoy and the garlic bread that my waiter asked me if I wanted and me saying "yes", not knowing I was going to actually have to pay for it. But welcome to Vegas people! Lol, oh and 3 stars are for the price, if my shrimp was bigger with better sauce it would've been 4 stars....

t0Lp4IkfPd1BaP3EjVDg0Q.text: Went there for dinner and while service was okay, try food wasn't up to par.  You'd have thought it being a national chain they would have their act together.  One of my kids said that the best thing about the restaurant was the water they brought out.

SeiTzuOYh9VOy15c04lBdA.text: Went here on a very nice day so we decided to sit outside. The patio view of the strip is awesome. What bothered me a little was how sticky the table was and the food was okay. I had the appetizer sampler that came with chips and dip (hardly ate it), buffalo chicken bites (alright), peel and eat shrimp (very bland), and fried shrimp which could of used a little more seasoning. My boyfriend had the lieutenant Dan's shrimp and that had well seasoned grilled shrimp. Overall, okay. Better shrimp at Red Lobster.

u_MGGaQHpuHzK5aPNjBXmQ.text: This place has a whole lot of really cool movie memorabilia decked out all over the walls inside from the film and to be fair it was pretty cool to see that stuff.  We decided to share a few appies and got some peel and eat shrimp and some other spicy shrimp dish. The food was just OK considering the fairly inflated prices. It wasn't any better than anything one might find at Red Lobster, and given that RL is the Walmart of seafood establishments it wasn't that great. I enjoy good seafood, the like of which one might find at The Fisherman's Restaurant on the Pier in Seattle, or Captain John's Seafood Buffet in Kitty Hawk NC on the Outer Banks. I had a margarita with a baby Corona dumped into it which was decent.  I think if you are into film nostalgia, for THAT one film, and like shrimp go for it. Just don't expect to come away raving about your out of body seafood experience.

AeP-pBZKdexj_tt_Ivo7fw.text: First timer. Great Food! Got a bucket of shrimp that was delicious! Very noisy. Ordered a rum and coke from the bar and it was basically a cup full of ice. A little pricey. I was considering giving this place 3 stars but the shrimp was sooo damn good.

kj9aiiuY5Pkp1vhUhA-Qxg.text: The food was good and our server was too funny. Great attitude and even played Bubba Gump trivia with us. Kind of pricey for a $$ place but we will go back some day.

udXNN_geceM8NGp_5ZhcrA.text: Super disappointed and annoyed with Bubba's!!!! First off, I had to send 2 drinks back because the soft drink was just nasty, and my mixed drink was watered down and had no taste at all!! I ordered Bubba's After The Storm "bucket Of Boat Trash", and let me tell you, I should have put it in the trash because it was garbage!!! Why were there 2 COLD snow crab legs sitting on top of my hot shrimp, fish, and fries!?!?! The taste was not good! I'll be honest, I ate maybe half of it because we ended up paying almost $100 (including the tip) for 2 meals, 2 beers, and a soft drink!  I don't mind paying for some good food, but this... NOT!! Where are the annoyed emojis when you need them?! Ugghhh!! Oh, I had a Caesar salad too, it was OK. I can't even remember what my husband ordered... a bucket with steamed shrimp, corn, potatoes, and other veggies, but he said it was tasteless! Also a side of coconut shrimp, that was actually pretty good. The ONLY reason I gave this place 3 stars is because the of that shrimp and staff was very friendly and our waitress was awesome..thanks guys! Sadly, I left this place and still hours later pissed about the money we paid for what we got! UGGGGHH!!

xLv1UP-xalVuRGLDQCDcMQ.text: The first night we were in Las Vegas,  my husband and I had dinner here.  Food was reasonably priced. There is outdoor or indoor seating.  I had the Shrimp stuffed with crabmeat and my husband had Shrimp Scampi.  Both were excellent and reasonably priced. Servings were very filling. It was also nice to be able to sit outside and be able to have a view of Las Vegas Strip.

EF58xhenEwzebCu5rQbxig.text: I recently went to the Bubba Gumps restaurant on the Las Vegas Strip near Planet Hollywood and the Shops.  It was great!  We loved our waitress who was very attentive!  It is pretty cool that they have license plates on the table (red and green) side.  This will either bring the nearest Waitress/Waiter to your table or not.  Our regular Waitress still stopped by but that was more for immediate service.  Our waitress also quizzed us about the movie Forest Gump which was pretty cool!  I would definitely go back!  I had the Shrimp Mac and Cheese and it definitely didn't disappoint!

People that sat down after us were helped before we walked out. Sucks because it was a place we were looking forward to eat at but because of this, we don't plan on returning.

3LIkC3a33wNCvRw-zGbZVw.text: Alright drinks, good food & awesome bartender! Never been here before so wanted to try something new in Vegas. Menu has alot of options. jbqLGkji9QRENG6aJzp9IA.text: Bubba Gumps is one of my favorite seafood restaurants in Vegas if I want something on the strip with friends.  I love, LOVE, love shrimp and can't get enough of it here.    The casual environment is great for a lunch spot and I've even came here just for apps and drinks.  In addition to seafood, they have a great variety of salads, deserts, and awesome style baby back ribs.    My favorite is just the traditional margarita and they will even hand-shake it right at your seat. Bonus :)

TdO1aSnMUkyzoj88pyuOsA.text: I had higher expectations but it wasn't that bad. If you're looking for something affordable that's along the lines of an Applebee's or TGIF's then this is the place, especially in it's prime location in planet Hollywood. The view is great. And the servers are enthusiastically perky.   Clam chowder: not the usual creamy version but more of a thin stew. It was okay but just wasn't expected.  Forrest's Seafood Feast: A good amount as a sampler. Fries are decent, fish and chips were overly battered, fried shrimp was okay but the hush pups were good. Not the usual corn breaded hush puppies.

qRTzsRrTvr3Ubst2NmIsFw.text: I've experienced Bubba Gumps once before coming to this one. When I heard Planet Hollywood was opening one I couldn't contain myself. The first thing you have when you enter is a souvenir shop which makes sense since there are a ton of tourists wandering the streets. you have to go upstairs to go to the actual restaurant. The walls are covered in Forest Gump memorabilia which makes it dangerous as you're walking up the stairs if you can't multi task.  Once we made it to the top the host asked whether we wanted to be seated inside, outside or at the bar. We chose outside and glad we did the view is AWESOME! Fast forward to ordering our food; our waiter was very helpful with explaining anything we had questions about and even offered suggestions. Most of the best tasting drinks come with a souvenir cup.   We ordered a bucket of shrimp, half Cajun half garlic & butter, they dumped it out on a giant platter so you can grub away. Be careful though it can get messy. We also ordered lobster stuffed shrimp on top of jasmine rice. It was very oily but when something is smothered in butter what can you expect. It mixed well with the rice. Couldn't finish everything so we took a to go box and our souvenir cups all for $75. A bit expensive but i'm sure it would have been cheaper without the cups. Overall great service, food and great time.

CWiqOPAMFCnYguMNT8DWHA.text: No, no, no. I know Bubba Gump's is a tourist trap but we were in a rush, so we settled on Bubba Gump's. Big mistake. Our server was nice enough and explained that the "STOP FORREST STOP" and "RUN FORREST RUN" signs were used to call over the wait staff when service was needed. OK, gimmicky and kind of cute. We never ended up using them, though. I went for the Shrimp Scampi and my husband got the jambalaya. Our food came out within 10-15 minutes, pretty quick. My husband liked his jambalaya but also commented halfway through eating it that it got old pretty fast. As for my scampi, it was very lemony which is not my preference for this dish, but it was fine. What was NOT fine was the fact that the shrimp was most definitely overcooked. Ugh. You'd think a seafood restaurant could saute shrimp and not overdo it. Not only that, but I felt the overall portions were pretty small for what you were paying.  To make things worse (considering I was in a hurry to leave the restaurant), the computers went down after our server took our card. I think we were waiting 20-30 minutes for that to pass before she was able to swipe the card. Bah!

gBd_qNCBwGqXbSC6UFFVQg.text: We had no problem with the food or the service, the drink menu made it difficult for the server, I just wanted a draft beer, but there were no prices on the menu, the beer menu had the prices with the souvenir glass included with the beer, when I asked about the price without the take home souvenir, I was told if you want the 16 oz, take off $6.00, if you want the bigger beer take off $4.00 from the listed prices, why not make it easier and just have those prices on the menu. And a message to our server, it is not necessary to crouch down when taking our order, I worked in the industry and I am not a fan of that practice, you were not 7ft tall and we were not little people, just saying

SbQ1XyQLLsGV8uMy_Nvbqw.text: I was so excited to see a Bubba Gump Shrimp Co restaurant open its doors here in Las Vegas. I've been to the one in Long Beach, Monterey and San Francisco so finally I got to check this one off the list.  Lots of walking to get here-it's located inside the Planet Hollywood Hotel & Casino near the shops with an outdoor patio as an option for dining. Not convenient for locals who have to park and walkkkkkkkkkk.  We were seated right away and our waitress was very cheery and service was great.  I love using the signs at the table so you can easily flag a server down when you flip the sign over to STOP.  We had three servers stop at once-so service was perfect.  A nice kids menu offered favorites like pizza, hamburgers, macaroni and cheese and of course shrimp.  We started off with a refreshing margarita which my only complaint was the small glass that it was served in.  It took a while to get the drink at a perfect cold temperature.  I ordered a variety of shrimp...boiled, coconut and panko fried.  It came with a few different sauces (cocktail, sweet and sour, teriyaki).  Shrimp was cooked perfect and it was a yummy comfort food indulgence.  The shrimp macaroni and cheese was also on item we ordered and it had a nice smoky flavor.  Really good!  The hubby ordered the tilapia and it was served with creamy mashed potatoes and spinach.  Overall I don't think I'll be running back just because of the convenience factor.  Off the strip the elevators and escalators were both not working so if you're on crutches or a cast, or just getting over a foot injury like I am it doesn't really make it easy to get to.

I split the Shrimper's Heaven and Bubba's After the Storm Bucket of Boat Trash with someone.  The food was cooked well but not very well seasoned.  It was ok.  I also tasted the potato cakes which were average.  The Lt. Dan's Pomegranate Punch was tasty though.  Average seafood.  Nothing outstanding.

n_TXQ1-YsdyjbL9v6i1vBQ.text: I wish I could give zero stars!!  This place sucks... I've eaten in the Orlando and New Orleans restaurants and loved it! This place sucked, bad food , worse service and the inability to bus a table and let us sit in the location we wanted to sit! Don't waste your time in this location!

3rT5oC4iB69X5qtxilSNtQ.text: My boyfriend has had Bubba Gump in California before & wanted me to try it. I was not disappointed! We were greeted and seated right away. We ate on the balcony/patio overlooking the strip, which made for a lovely view. They had heat lamps on to keep the guests warm outside. Our server, Jon, was friendly, attentive, and quick (without making you feel rushed). I ordered a pineapple margarita and my partner ordered the frozen mango margarita. They were delicious. For entrees, I had the shrimp po boy, which had a ton of shrimp & a generous portion of fries. My boyfriend ordered the shrimp scampi, which was served with a piece of garlic bread & smelled heavenly. I wish we had room for dessert! At the end of the meal, our server told us that we get a free gift because we ordered a frozen margarita. We went downstairs to the merchandise area of the restaurant and were given a Bubba Gump shaker. Awesome! If you love seafood & great service, come to Bubba Gump's!

lQ2Zo9CWa3-X_DW5A3Ohzw.text: This place just has too much of a hype due to Forrest Gump, but the food doesn't exceed the expectations. We came here a week ago for a family dinner, the service was great! Don't get me wrong, our server was wonderful. Although, my sister had other feelings when asked for a high chair & they never came to give it. But, once I asked for it, I received it immediately. The food was very tasteless, had no flavor. The calamari we ordered, seem to have more breading & peppers than calamari itself. The portions are very small to what you expect. I ordered the boil with the garlic (Since my daughter is only 2 & I couldn't get the Cajun) & it was so bland. Luckily, my sister ordered the Cajun and just like the garlic one, it lack seasoning. I ordered a watermelon margarita and I didn't even taste any alcohol at all! (Which sucks, because the amount of $ you pay. You would expect at least a little buzz). We received souvenir cups with our drinks and when we went to the gift shop, the ladies before us cashing out exchanged their cups. We didn't know about this! Because our cups looked beat up, but the gift shop associate exchanged them for us and she said that our server was supposed to mention to us that we can get new ones at the shop. This restaurant is just a hype, I was very disappointed.

zAV4C7TAjD-VqgmPix0v8Q.text: Good food and service. Very dependable although missed the trivia questions by server.

cPPN0KEo27GARf8Y1mAecw.text: The owner emailed and the Manager called me.  Hopefully things will get better.  It has potential, i believe customer service is everything.

7Cnsh4MCT6-St4YfCsJMXg.text: The patio was so nice on a beautiful day! The service was great as were the drinks! They will have a couple on special each day. We just had a snack of shrimp (half cajun, half regular (I think soaked in beer)  DELICIOUS and not too busy for a late lunch. Everything was clean, even the washroom. Ya, it is a chain but an interesting one, I recommend it. You will know what amazing shrimp cookery smells like as you climb the stairs to the bar area!

uuulxF_TwVPhIOFLJHhf6g.text: We loved coming here when we used to live in HI. Just that Bubba Gump vibe and decor, open air, looking towards the Pacific ocean, and the smell of.food being prepared as Tradewinds brush through.  Crap, we aren't in HI. This location lacked, alot. Our server was lousy, unattentive, and you could see him by their register thingy playing as if it's social hour. The Bubba Gump we once loved and wished we had out here, had arrived, minus the Bubba Gump.vibe we are acquainted with.   My husband always gets the Shrimp New Orleans. I'll usually order a Caesar salad (surprise surprise), their salmon, or their ribs. I will say I have always loved their Caesar salad. Their Caesar dressing and croutons have always been on point, so I can't critique that.  I feel like their ribs for $24 is not even worthed. It isn't even that great. It's good, just not 24 bucks good. On this particular evening I ordered salmon. Can we say, dry! DRY! Look, I am those weirdos who actually can bare through dry food, love my steak charred and well-done...chewy? No problem. If I accidentally overcook my salmon at home, I can bare with it. BUT when a restaurant serves you a dry fish at 20 bucks....grrrr.   It isn't a bad place to try. Maybe it's a hit or miss. But I just think they are way too steep for what you are getting. Also, the service we received was pretty lousy. I can seperate lousy service and good food or vice versa. On this night, wholly cow. I mean, from the long anticipated wait just to get our name called, to the walk uo the stairs just to stand in another line to get seated...It just all sucked.  Our waiter got no tip whatsoever and I seriously regretted going there with the whole brood.  Oh, forgot to mention..the husband enjoyed his dish (surprise surprise).   I came in with a stroller and had no problems. Just the part where we had to carry the stroller up the stairs. I could've swore I seen an elevator, so it would have been customer service friendly if someone mentioned it. However, my husband and I like to move quick...so carrying that bad boy up the stairs toddler strapped in was the only option even if there were other options.  Definitely kid and stroller friendly! I won't HIGHLY recommend it. There are other GREAT restaurants in the area to spend your money where you will receive better service and a well-worthed meal. But, I don't like my isolated experience to deter other from trying it out.   However, because of the service we received that night, quality of food, the price...only way I'd come back to THIS Bubba Gump is if someone gave me a gift certificate...only then will I give it another shot and only hope to up its ratings.

ozCGwFuYvQ8geT9wf1cGiQ.text: Came here last week for dinner. Came in through downstairs where we were greeted and the staff radioed upstairs to expect us. Was seated promptly and given instructions about the Forrest Gump licence plate signs for service. Cool touch I must add. More restaurants should implement something similar imho.  Flipped the sign to Stop Forrest Stop when ready to order and a server was with us within a minute. Ordered the Shrimper's Net Catch with half garlic and half Cajun. I personally preferred the garlic. I thought the Cajun was too saucy, but thankfully it wasn't too spicy.   Also had Forrest's Surf and Turf as my main. It comes with a 9oz tenderloin, shrimp, mashed potatoes, and onions. It was food a plenty for me. The shrimps were my favourite in this meal. The meal wasn't 5 star spectacular, but it was a solid 4 in terms of taste and value.  Service is definitely top notch here with a casual atmosphere. Servers are prompt and kept us up to date with the orders. To top it off, depending on what beverage you order, you can also take home a glass or shaker! Overall the food was 4 out of 5, but the service definitely bumps it up for the extra star! Definitely recommended if you want a decent meal in a casual setting with great service!
