I do feel like this place is a bit overpriced for what you get and there are plenty of other options around. However, if you want shrimp, they have plenty of it. Just don't expect to be "wow'd".

SFPDf64iMMKY1Dfu5TfMGg.text: I had the worst experience ever at this place!!!!! Service was horrible and the food was not great to make up for it either. I heard soooooo much about bubba gump shrimp and was always really excited to try it, and finally a group of friends and I did. Sadly the server we had was AWFUL!!!!!!!!! I had never in my life seen anyone hate his "life/job" more than our server, he was talking to us like we were "annoying him" for just being there it was ridicules. He would cut us off in the middle of ordering, and talk to the other waiters around him, and when we asked for recommendations he just simply told us "that it all depends on what you like" in the tone of voice saying (just pick darn it!).  The food was not great and the portions were SMALLER than expected but the service did not help, it made us just want to get out of there, without even getting a dessert (this pretty much never happens in my book so its serious! lol)  and when we finally got the bill he asked us to pick up everything off the table put it in the plates and pick it up and hand it to him, (if you ask me, he pretty much made us clear our own table for him! lol and we tipped him after! haha) overall horrible experience but gave for conversation at dinner and after! lol

AHcdLUp5FmYEZ64EABcixw.text: One of the best Movie themed restaurants I have ever visited.. The whole place is warm and welcoming.. The waitresses and staff are attentive and friendly.. We went for a quick lunch and the order was quick too! We ordered Cajun shrimp and Jambalaya.. Two awesomely awesome dishes! I would live to visit again! Kudos!

YuVOPttJ1BBFwqr9zs0oOg.text: Outstanding, friendly and fast service. My wife and I had the Cajun shrimp appetizer. For dinner we had the shrimp pasta with capers. It was outstanding. We ate every bite. We also had a few beers.  Our server even offered us to go cups for our beer. Gotta love Vegas.

xnvcEea94E7z8oA2latsYQ.text: Really good service and, well, it's Vegas so everyone's in a pretty good mood.  Wasn't crazy about the food but it's what they advertised.  Fair is fair.

1_V1fCrXXO2lidnVfN5ITQ.text: We were at Bubba Gump on July 3, 2014.  I thought it was pricey.  I think I paid $17 for a Creole shrimp dish but it was yummy!!  The service was excellent  and they were very nice.  If I go back to Vegas I would go there again.

Xlqn123I2BDUDWxQVHCZgQ.text: We had such a great time. Kristin was a fantastic server and the food was on point. I might have to come here every time I'm in Vegas. Better than the hotel restaurants!

6RykpTP1eljbvIVEEZACkg.text: Ordered the  shrimp scampi and Stuffed shrimp. The shrimp in both dishes were over cooked and the crab was in indiscernible. The service wasn't any better. We ordered an appetizer which was good, but the salad came right after and then main course so the table was filled. We needed water but could not get waiter attention because too busy flirting. Will not go to another Bubba Gump.

GNA4zq_g_04sQQ5qjRR0Xg.text: Thank you for giving me and my wife a nice time out in town. I have nothing bad to say. The food was good and sitting on the balcony watching people get crazy in Las Vegas was awesome. Thank you.

4cYdSzo40Eog-HNAH491Hw.text: Randomly came in for dinner and couldn't be happier! The food was great and my server "meshell" was great! Really funny girl and was always making sure we were ok. Coming back soon

NYA306EiwCmEMJbs3lftzg.text: One of the best bubba Gump places! Fast and warm service, attentive servers..-:) food is great and I always love their Forest Gump themed interior...amazing!

MZrkiuSnKlm6-yPwTCUKhA.text: I hate to give a bad review but there is simply nothing much to brag about I've tried this location 3 times and only came back for the second and third time hoping that it would get better but it just doesnt do anything for you right, the food isn't very well seasoned the only  only thing that's worth even bragging about is the strawberry shortcake everything else is just plain humdrum nothing special doesn't leap out at you it has a name & catchy touristy gimmicks but other than that it's not worth the price

2MrEmgTcLYP-m89Yn4bQdA.text: The food is bland, overpriced, and bad service (although our server was sweet) everyone else was rude. I ordered a chicken caesar salad, my husband ordered the shrimp scampi. I didn't taste his food after he said it tasted like the smell of Raid. The chicken in my salad was so bland I had to pour a bunch of salt in it. Not to mention it took them forever to bring out our food.

46M8KtTtzKg0eWudnboiDQ.text: Me and my daughter went last night and the food was ok the service was different but what got me was they charged for drink refills !! Really?? It's not like its a cheap place to eat let's just say I won't be going back anytime soon maybe never

HQSSklKmsqRzCzW_xDOHZA.text: First time eating at this franchise.  In town on vacation and friends recommended. I can see why they wanted us to stop. If you love shrimp this is the place to go. So many options to choose from that it is hard to nail it down.  We were able to sit outside and enjoy the Vegas Strip. The drinks are a little spendy but unique and you get to keep the souvenir glass. The waiter was friendly and even offered trivia questions about the Forest Gump movie. Would gladly stop at another location.

yA6T9KnJqMDu4L61n8S4iA.text: This is the worst meal I've ever had at a restaurant and it cost a small fortune. We went for my son's birthday because we love shrimp and we love Forrest Gump and have always wanted to try it here. The fried shrimp tasted funny. I ate one and didn't like it at all but figured I'm paying for it. So I tried to eat a second one but gave up, so they were wasted. We ordered dessert because I was so disappointed with the meal I figured at least the cookie sundae would be nice. Nope. The cookie was completely over baked and super dried out. Everywhere else I've had one serves it kind of gooey and delicious but this one was awful. What a let down to have bad shrimp at a shrimp place!  Also, the "garlic bread" didn't taste much like garlic. More like buttered bread. You'd think when the waitress took away my plate & saw all the shrimp still on it, she would have asked if something was wrong but she didn't. So I told her the shrimp wasn't good and she just said sorry and walked off. Didn't offer to do anything to satisfy us or correct the situation. I will NEVER go back. $65 down the drain.  (Also having some serious intestinal issues today. Gee, I wonder if that has anything to do with bad shrimp???)

ZpNK0LOaIMBhn8RTs4avqg.text: I really wanted to try this place because I love shrimp and I loved the movie.  When you walk it, it's just the gift shop. You have to walk up a couple of flights of stairs to get to the restaurant.  Here's what I liked about this place. The ambience. Great service and helpful staff. We got seated on the patio which had a great view of the Strip. Really cool idea to have signs on your table to let staff know when you need them: Run Forrest Run or Stop Forrest Stop. The waiter asked us trivia about Forrest Gump, which kinda stumped us. Here's what I didn't like about this place: The Food.  It sucked. We ordered the Frizzled Onion Rings for an appetizer.  Frizzled is right; the breading came off easily, it was just skinny onions. We both ordered Forrest's Seafood Feast, which were told it was the most popular. It consists of Fried Shrimp, Fish and Chips with their special hushpuppies. The shrimp was average at best. The "fish" was awful. Very thin strips of heavily breaded fish.  I've had better fish sticks.  The hushpuppies were ok, they had corn inside, but they were small. Considering the price of this menu, the food does not reflect it. The only thing that prevented me from giving one star was the "experience". If you are a Forrest Gump fanatic, you'll love this place. Maybe just stick to drinks though.

DLCt4Cq5IpUOZWQdfTjVJw.text: This was not a great experience. The service was solid, but nothing special. The food was lacking. The jambalaya was worse than cheesecake factory. The salads did not have fresh ingredients. Also. Lt. Dan's sausage dish was small. Nothing was really filling.

xK2JFfc1ETgXvaqgGT3vVw.text: Everyone was sooo friendly. From the gentleman at the front door who answered all our questions, to the employees we met on our way up.  We were sat right away and our server was awesome and provided us with great service, I just wish I remembered his name.  The food was excellent as well. Between four of us we had a little bit of everything, shrimp scampi pasta, mahi mahi, BBQ ribs with fries and a burger.  All was delicious.  If I am ever in town again, I will definitely be back.

H3pI3nKAJj8A3E3M9gY4bw.text: I have been to Bubba gumps all over and love their food. I wanted a Caesar salad but my hotel only had one for  20+ so I ordered to go at Bubba gump. I called the order in for a shrimp caesar and was told 10 minutes. By time I got there it was ready and it looked delish.. I got back to my hotel and crushed lol. I was surprised their salad was that good. The dressing was so good and the croutons seemed house made which is good. The shrimp were grilled and seasoned perfectly. I didn't get to take a pic but if you love Caesar dressing that isn't on the mayo side you'll love this.

I85EUHMS8AHzJ_lvCALxTQ.text: I was in the mood for seafood since I got to Vegas. Also I've always wanted to eat here .   We ordered a fried calamari appetizer and it was soo greasy !! The basket it was served in literally had a pool of oil in the bottom of it . I did enjoy the fried peppers that came with the calamari.  We ordered both the grilled and fried trio. Both were good .

BeBHOdPum8uPff5C1MloFg.text: Very disappointing visit! We are local and don't often go to the strip. We ventured in tonight to our favorite place for seafood. It was delicious last time we visited which was our first time. The waitress was also great then! This time was a drastic difference!! We were seated after we climbed the stairs bc the elevator was broken. No biggie... we took our seats on the patio. I asked the hostess to let our server know we were going to wash our hands. Upon returning to the table another family was seated there as well as at the table next to it so I flagged down the next server I could find and he said just sit up there wherever you like. Uhh ok. We walked over to choose from the few tables he was referring to but every single one was dirty with dishes. I went to the front and the hostess said she would have someone come clean it off. That happened and we took our seats. Another few minutes pass and no menus. I go back to the front and get some from the hostess. Wait another 5 and still no one came to take our drink order. I go to the hostess again and just ask for a manager at this point. She arrives and gets us water but by then the mood was already sour. The lil artichoke dip on the house didn't help at all. Throughout the rest of the evening the service was subpar and even the food wasn't as tasty. I think we'll stick to food off the strip where they know how to treat ya!

3cq2OVIO_rG1surSRxkIYg.text: Came here to try the place for the first time.  I was disappointed in myself that I didn't get the reference to Forrest Gump right away...  I gave this place a 4 star because the food was amazing.  Each of the shrimp had a different texture.  Out of all the dishes though, the Jambalya was the best dish.  I like the amount of shrimp they provide as well.  I would have given the place a 5 star if not for the service.  The service was amazing before the food came, but as soon as food was on our table, we were just ignored.  We even tried to make sure to have the sign to indicate we needed service.  F.Y.I. They have a sign that indicates to "any" worker that you need service.  Our server said any worker will come and assist us, but in the end it was only that one server who kept coming.  I don't know why they say that any person will come and help when they clearly won't.  We had 2 or 3 workers not even turn an eye towards our table even when we needed help.  The only real downfall of this experience.

2oLJdjU4tVD6iu5P1qYbzQ.text: This location has a great view of the strip! When dining out on the patio, we actually encountered a sand storm, but we were quickly retrieved inside seamlessly. Great food!

7AP7gA9HWEOnJ7k-b7ycfw.text: Visited Bubba Gump's yesterday on a whim while looking for a place to eat lunch , and I must say I'm glad that I did. I ordered the Forrest seafood sampler and my boyfriend ordered the Boat trash with Maine lobster. Both entrees where great and reasonably priced, will most definitely be returning before leaving.

uSA2AsK2UthAYGTdhGRMbw.text: We arrived around 9pm. Not a huge line and we got a table quick. We decided to sit outside- best decision ever! It was a wonderful night and we could see the whole Strip lit up. I ordered something off the seasonal menu. Essentially it was 4 different formats of shrimp (bacon wrapped, grilled, crab stuffed and sauteed), jasmine rice, spinach and grape tomatoes. Portions are important to talk about, it was good (dare I say even a bit more than you should eat in one seating lol) My favorite was the bacon wrapped by far. If you love crab then the stuffed ones would make you happy since they really do have the crab taste (have had those in other places and the taste of crab has been weaker). The rice was not as loose as I like but it wasnt bland nor too salty. Both of my other friends ordered a sampler of 4 different formats of shrimp (3 fried and 1 grilled). They came with fries. They liked the Coconut ones best by far.  The restaurant has a lot of cool Forrest Gump memorabilia and spots to take pictures. All three of us were happy campers.

HxtNmfVy3H1WjDMti8fW8Q.text: Went there yesterday the food is fabulous and the service was great. The best part was the memorabilia about the movie Forest Gump. It was featured every where in the restaurant.

zxEMoIE0H9AUJtFvakF6SA.text: Been to Bubba Gumps in new york and las vegas.  It was a quiet night when we were there mid week.  Server was friendly and played trivia with us about the movie.  Food was good and plenty.  nothing stood out to us about this visit.

8XWNHJNGGY5YTiM-Gsg5dQ.text: Let me just start off by saying, if i could rate higher i would.  We were visiting for a mini holiday and I took my kids who enjoy a good meal also.  There was no wait time and so glad of that.  My son indicated out of 10 he would rate 11.  Service was awesome and staff was very attentive.  Drinks and food did not disappoint. Ended up going with the shrimp new orleans and finish every bite.  Would definitely suggest you stopping in if your in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zE3yNHmrQh75WUyGCzxtRg.text: Came here for a nice dinner, it was the first time dinning at a Bubba Gump Shrimp restaurant for both me and my boyfriend!  We ordered drinks, him a beer and I the titos vodka melon drink. My titos melon drink was perfect, not too sweet and not too bitter from the sour mix!  I then ordered the new orleans shrimp plate and he picked the mahi mahi and shrimp. We substituted the rice for mashed potatoes! First my new orleans shrimp plate was soo delicious. It came in a butter gravy sauce that complimented the grilled shrimp and my mashed potatoes so well. My boyfriend enjoyed his plate as well! The service was good! Everyone was attentive. We had the server, surpervisor and the manager checking on us making sure we had everything we wanted. Would deff recommend! The vibe of the restaurant was really relaxing and fun.

BoWa8LtXw_dn3Echu7B5Dw.text: n January 2, 2018, around 10 PM, I ordered  one shrimper's heaven.  I was charged TWICE , When I spoke to the manager, he  told me that  he was not able to refund me my "money" since I paid CASH so he gave me his business card and told me to call the corporate office. When  I called  them , they didn't assisted me. I called the manager back and he said that he was not working  that day! Well I told him , I spoke to a white guy and Introduced  himself as Matt who told me again that he was not there that day so I told him the person that I spoke introduced himself as Matt and provided me a business card  again well he said the same thing, he was not able to refund me my money OMG I am so disappointed about their customer service !!!!!  My complain is already on Consumer Affairs

AEHruopAgBM9rMWMwjetZA.text: I love shrimp,  so when my husband suggested Bubba Gump, I was surprised.  We decided to make a u-turn on the Vegas strip and get SOME SHRIMP....   As you walk in your in a novelty store with lots of Forrest Gump paraphernalia.  It's like being on a movie set. This is fun.....   You walk upstairs and their are more items all on the wall, hanging from the celling.... this is so cool.  As we are seated on the table, their are questions and answers about the movie.  I wanna play...  Our waiter was a bubble guy named Charles. He appeared with a warm smile and  trivia questions. I don't think I'm ready. LoL...  First questions, nope I didn't know the answer let's just say I needed to see Forrest Gump again...  Now it's time for lunch... I ordered the filet in a garlic butter sauce. Wow....delicious! I was truly surprised that I enjoyed it that much.    Dessert was banana bread.... HELL NO.... dont do it! It was watery and mushy.  Listen not everything is worth the money this is one banana bread I wouldn't order again, ever.   The waiter was so nice he removed the banana bread from our bill, so I decided to make his tip worth it.    All in all its a fun place to walk down Forrest Gump memory lane. I would give this place another shot.....

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UMGX1r-vIX8-q7yt60EgKA.text: This past saturday we celebrated my daughters birthday  at this location we had a blast plus great food  service was great will definitely come back again!!! Thank you for making her birthday  special great views also !!!

ObBkBIPgReH_aYQ-unOmwg.text: This was probably the worst seafood I have ever had. I got the accidental fish plate and the shrimp were overcooked to the point of they were hard as a rock. The flounder was very plain over plain white rice not jasmine rice. Then there was a lemon butter sauce that had so much lemon that is the only thing you  could taste when taking a bite with a little bit of the sauce on it. We had one person get the fish and chips and the fish was super greasy and the fries were cold.  We also got the shrimp mac and cheese which was fine but the pasta was mini size and the cheese sauce was runny. The only good thing about this meal was the $10 margarita. The bill for three people was $100 and the food was not even close to good or worth that amount of money.

bGcXVEP4_P50l5vkpTX90g.text: Let me say this first....I loooooove the movie Forrest Gump.  I could NOT wait to try Bubba Gump Shrimp....  Hard swallow (drinks water)....  BUT....this place...NO ma'am!!!!  Customer service is horrible, food is not southern, my group felt we were treated different (I will use that word), AND to top it all off, there is no mention of BUBBA!!!!  Well, as I stated, I am a fan....I went to see memorabilia and that I did.  There was "Forrest" memorabilia everywhere, from downstairs to upstairs.  The decor was nice, hence my one star.  I can say that part of the experience was nice.  However, as we looked in the store downstairs, on the walls, upstairs in the restaurant, we noticed there were lots of mention of Forrest, his extended family, Jenny, LT. Dan but no Bubba Gump.  I didn't see his extended family nor pictures of him.  Definitely left us ALL confused, but we climbed the stairs to the restaurant.  Now, to the Restaurant.  When we were seated, we opted for the patio, but as we sat there for 30 minutes with no drinks and watched others being served, it was decided that was a bad decision.  We moved ourselves to the inside.  It was comfy in both spaces.  We just wanted fresh air and scenery.  The patio offers a nice view of the strip.  Great for people watching while you wait on your food.  BUT....inside we were met with annoyance and poor customer interaction.  I opted for the fish sandwich,  as a look on yelp offered some nice looking fish.  I am southern, so my expectations were high.  When the food arrived, I must say, I was looking very sad. I probably should have ordered shrimp since it's in the name.  The sandwich was Cod.  I am not a fan of Cod, I expected something else.  It was thick cut Cod with heavy coating, more than needed in my opinion.  But, it was bland coating so it was just useless.  The fish wasn't seasoned either, so blah!!!  I won't speak on the rest of the food since I only "tasted" the sandwich.  There was enough food on the strip that I didn't need to eat something I didn't find great.  The plated food was a bit warm rather than hot so the group sent back a few items.  This didn't turn out well.  As new items were ordered and we were still charged for items sent back.  Well, that definitely made for frustration on  both sides.  When a manager was asked for, 30 minutes later, no manager.  We agreed to just pay and leave.  Never Ever again.....  Not worth the hassle.  Please change the name.  Bubba is no where in the building....

27uMMx1a_pzdrOlkMPR6iA.text: Got the Cajun shrimp appetizer that was hella bland. No amount of salt, lime, pepper, etc. made it taste any better. Asked my server for forks that were never brought to us. The crab stuffed shrimp was ok at best. Hate leaving bad reviews but I wouldn't come back here again. Also, the host Rose was the most unwelcoming person in the place! Too bad this place is not as good as the movie. Their frozen margarita tasted like a slushy! You're better of getting a Fat Tuesday any where else.

A+ atmosphere and food. And u get free buba gump  Souvenir glasses

__j--6IIg3hQANOGJsbMOw.text: Here we are just over a year later.  Even better than the first.  The cajun peel and eat are the best around.

Gmj1ZVgvjdGO7DQNgtchRQ.text: We had a lovely family meal here whilst in Vegas, everyone enjoyed their meals especially the jumbalia there wasn't a mouthful left!! The service was very very good, I wish I could remember her name because she was very friendly and really looked after us.  All in all a great experience!

aOt22I4di84Yvoc_wefgZw.text: This restaurant was awesome! The host gave us a seat right away. Our waiter Colin was very talkative and informative about the menu. He got us our drinks and appetizers very fast. I got the strawberry frozen lemonade and it tasted great especially knowing I could keep the light up cup! I also ordered the shrimp scampi and it was delicious.   This was a great place to come with the family. It was very quiet compared to other restaurants on the strip. Overalls great food, friendly waiters and great atmosphere!  Definitely recommend coming here with your family!

Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The shrimp scampi

VVPdjwIwPnnHU2Ac6fkdlg.text: Our visit didn't start out well.  We waited in Landry's VIP line only to be told to move to the regular line by Patrick.  After move lines i noticed someone else in the VIP line and they were seated immediately.  I asked Patrick what the VIP line was for?  He said it was for members.  Once i showed Patrick my member # he thought nothing of it.  If it wasn't for Frankie, our awesome waiter, i would have given this place 1 star.  The food was delicious but Patrick ruined it for us.  We will not eat here again.

K2FSdRLmMlsWXsxU6qRNGw.text: I feel robbed. Everyone had a decent experience.   Tuesday night with my stepson and boyfriend in July for dinner. We were seated in 10 minutes which wasn't bad. It was inside even though we asked for outside, since we wanted the great view. Then our waitress started off strong getting our order & answering menu questions. Then we never saw her again!! Thank god for the stop and go sign or we would have just sat there. I ordered a drink and had to remind them twice to bring it. And never got it. The food wasn't that great and over priced for the small portions, which is typical of the strip. No trivia which I was looking forward to since my stepson just saw the movie.   I am a local and my boyfriend works on the strip and we both will never recommend this place to anyone.

9BJOU1EfTkhtpDSO2xISHw.text: Good service, horrible food. Fried chicken had NO flavor, gravey not good, and corn came out with silk all over it.  Spinach dip was good.  Not worth the money!

Vc4lsgy2bqcMjM8BTVx4fg.text: Bubba's is a decent place to go with decent, Vegas priced fish and burgers.  If you haven't been to one of these chains before, it's worth the visit. They're known not so much for their food but for their Forest Gump themed decor. Every inch of the walls, down to a separate room in the joint wallpapered to look like one in his famous house. They've got a license plate system on the tables, a blue Run Forest run plate for when you and yours are doing fine and a red Stop Forest Stop plate for when you need a napkin or a drink. Any waiter nearby will be there to help.  They've got a big menu that encompasses many different items that are sure to satisfy any picky eaters needs. There are a few Forest-themed drinks, but, being in Vegas it's really not much.  I've been to a few different Gumps in my days and the food is always pretty good. This place was no different. I devoured most of the hearty helping of fish and chips in front of me. Our waiter was friendly, joking with us and quizzing us on our Forest Gump knowledge.  This location is nice too, right off the walkway across from The Cosmopolitan. There's also a terrace to sit outside if it's not as chilly as it was when we were there.   This is a nice family place to eat on the Strip with the slightly over priced grub you'll find all over Vegas. Yum.

07AKXwTDcPKPl4kVh7QUtQ.text: Good service but the fish and shrimp were a little over cooked. The sauces tasted great though!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The grilled seafood trio...

HEN9MUAbqvFZ9fh-Iz-60A.text: Nothing spectacular at all.....  First after being seated for about 20 minutes we were finally greeted by our server who had walked past us several times already. We were then advised if we needed her assistance we needed to have the sign on red. Okay... How were we supposed to know. The food IMHO was okay but a bit expensive for what you get on your plate... The tea and fountain drinks were horrible as well....

4vPjq4Qjze-HGT_bleUV3g.text: I wanted to try Bubba Gump's to see what the hype was all about. It's not hype! The food was amazing. I had the "I'm stuffed" shrimp. Hands down the best seafood dish I've had in a while. I would definitely recommend if you're looking for an affordable seafood restaurant in the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;I&#39;m stuffed&#34; shrimp

C4cGz0RUp0YBgp7gc0AZ7g.text: I was first introduced to this restaurant back in 2005 in Cali. Glad they finally made their way to Vegas. Bubba Gump Shrimp Co is located ON THE STRIP. Tourist central. Nothing wrong witth that. But just be warned of the strip traffic especially if you go during peak hours.  Everytime I go to Bubba Gump, I ALWAYS...and I repeat, ALWAYS get the SAME appetizer and the SAME entree.  For the appetizer I get the Cajun Shrimp. Let me tell you, THAT stuff is delicious!!!!!! The spices, the dipping oil, the garlic bread that comes with it....ohhh man. Excuse my TMI but it's like an orgasm in the mouth!!!!!!!  For my entree, I get the Shrimp Scampi pasta. The sauce is light yet flavorful. The bowl is big enough for me to have leftovers for the next day.  Welcome to Vegas, Bubba Gump!

9MtzExMPM7Xq8us4eYBp2A.text: Our waitress was AMAZING. Her name was  KEISHA. She got us drinks quickly and the food was amazing. No wait at all and she even quizzed us about Forest Gump the movie. Awesome service from all the staff. Great atmosphere and decent prices for the amount of food you get. Definitly recommend.

XKWqgCJStzCuNdJpDdHpiw.text: My family and I decided to try this place as "Forrest Gump" is one of our favorite movie.  We went there for dinner and although they were slightly busy, we were seated immediately.  Our waiter, Terry, gave us the menu and took our drink order right away.  We ordered the calamari and shrimp appetizers first.  The calamari was really good but the portion was not that much, the shrimp, however was of decent size.  We didn't wait long and our main entrees arrived.  The food was really great.  The staff were friendly and the place clean.  A lot of Forrest Gump memorabilia hung on the walls.  Terry was great, our empty plates were cleared immediately and he'd ask if everything was okay.  When we were all done eating,  we played a trivia about the movie, of course we answered all the questions correctly. Our overall experience at the restaurant is A+++.  We went to the gift shop afterwards and purchased some souvenirs .  The young lady who helped us was great and friendly as well. We will definitely eat at this place again and would recommend it to friends and family.

v7zblUgLqHN8ojJyNI5BDg.text: If 0 stars would be available that's what I would give. This place had the worst service ever! We arrived late night and the place was empty. Our server took our order and never came back in to check on us. After 45 mins we decided to ask about our meal and they told us it was normal to wait a while. Shortly after our waitress comes to our table and states she doesn't know what happened to our order so she's going to place it again and asks what we're having. She didn't empathize or say she was sorry. We literally stood up. On the way out I saw another employee and asked to speak to their boss and she stated she wasn't sure where the manager was at. Do not recommend this place if you're looking to feel welcomed and appreciated as a customer.

RO05S5wVBNo0IUVkr7ZBjA.text: The shrimp here was average. I went with a healthier option on the menu and did not get my shrimp fried, I got the kabobs. There was nothing special about the dish BUT the shrimp were cooked properly. I would go back here and try something different. Also great decor from Forest Gump!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Kabobs

y8fZqc_GaFwGrrGnbKW_Xw.text: I just have to say that I have been a big Bubba Gump Shrimp Co fan since the restaurant first started in Monterey, CA.  I have been to locations all over the country, including Hawaii and I have only had one tiny food complaint once in all of those visits  I am so glad they finally have a Las Vegas, NV location and right on the strip is perfect!  I wrote Bubba Gump on their corporate website once a year for five + years begging them to come to Las Vegas....right after they do, I move away LOL!  I guess I better get letter writing again to get them to come to the North West ;)  I just LOVE LOVE everything about the restaurant!!  The food is always great!  The only problem I had this time is that I ordered too much food!!  I will be back over and over!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Run Across America....it&#39;s an appetizer but it also makes a great dinner :)

ucMoC4_-_m00Q7cRUXB_Vg.text: Stopped in for lunch today. Tried the Shrimp New Orleans dish. The food was very tasty, but it was our server, Keisha, that made the experience a step above great. She was very patient with us while we were trying to decide what to order for our drinks and entrees. She made some suggestions that were really helpful. Keisha, keep up the good work ! In the words of the Terminator,  I'LL BE BACK !!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp New Orleans

L2N-bKG1MlhclKGLCxRMtQ.text: Love Bubba Gump Shrimp, however the location on Las Vegas Blvd needs a great deal of work. Waiters and waitresses have almost no personality. Went there for our Christmas Eve dinner and almost every guest had their coats on. It was absolutely freezing in there. When we were done with our meal, I looked at the thermostat which read 68 degrees. Our party asked if the heat could be turned up and nothing was done. Our meals were cold before we were even half way done. Needless to say, our exit could not have been quicker. Bottom line, if you want a great Bubba Gump experience, you need to go to the California venues but if you prefer to stay in Vegas, be sure to where your long underwear and parka.

Obc33gMSkuYXbDX2EcFVYg.text: We had dinner here last night while visiting las Vegas and the food and atmosphere were great! Drinks were amazingly tasty and the food was nice and hot! I do want to point out the friendliness of the staff... we were automatically greeted at the door. We were seated within minutes.. our waiter was very friendly..the food came quick.. and I also witnessed a server bringing drinks to a nearby table and a red slushy drink spilled and got on the customers white shirt. And it all happened in front of what I assumed was a manager. That manager did not hesitate to walk that customer to the gift shop and get him a free t-shirt...i thought that was pretty amazing!! 2 thumbs up Bubba Gumps

TxnaMrhqVOuJtKPPsm0ZVA.text: I was fooled to think that this place is just for tourists. I was so wrong! If my German cousin wasn't visiting Vegas with me I'd never step into a Bubba Gump. But man I missed out!  The restaurant is very themed and staff is friendly. Now their food - definitely exceeded my expectations!  Of course we have scampi - one of the best scampi dish I've tried in my life. And I've been to 12 counties in the world including Italy.  Jenny's Catch - the tilapia melts in your mouth! The butter sauce is so (fat) but good! With some spinach and mashed potato to top it off.  Gumbo - the only thing I didn't like at this dinner. Strangely this is one of their customer-favorites. Just isn't for me I guess.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yvZGhdymJ2jA88t5V4fSGA.text: Decided to try them and was a big let down. Ordered the Shrimper's Net Catch made with the secret cajun spice recipe for the app and the Dumb Luck Coconut Shrimp as the main. The main came out long before the app and it was a bland soggy mess. The coconut shrimp was ok and definitely not live up to the Bubba Gump reputation! My wife had the Old Fashion New England Clam Chowder and salad. She didn't even finish the clam chowder because it was so bland and not tasty at all. Got a 10% discount because of the snafu of getting the main before the app, but we will definitely not be coming back to this location. May give another location an opportunity for redemption in the future.

sJjzeEfC2sKjMkWHtYOSDg.text: I loved the theme of this restaurant, as a big fan of the movie Forest Gump I marveled when I walked in and felt I was on the boat they used to capture all those shrimps.   The service at this restaurant was great and everything we tried at this restaurant was of great quality.   I'm a big fan of sea food and if you are too ten definitely try this restaurant and get their halibut. We will definitely go back to this place. They all so have a fried combo basket with shrimp and fries which was amazing. As always I added the pics, so try this place and enjoy the fresh sea food, you won't be disappointed.  Also it's not extremely pricey as some of the joint in Vegas can be.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried sea food and fries basket
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2Jz1XVkpnPL-FcTCp2i3lg.text: I love Bubba Gump's! I'm originally from California so when I saw that they were opening a location here in Las Vegas, I was stoked. I finally visited over the weekend and my first visit to this location was great! At first we sat down at a table in the inside but we had been walking around prior to coming in so we felt too warm, we asked if we could be moved outside and without any hesitation, they said yes! The view is gorgeous from outside! All our food was delicious, I got Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp, it was seasoned just right! On the plus, I got a free Shaker with my drink purchase! I highly recommend them, our server was very attentive and everyone was friendly as well.

4SFd6Q-ltS118MEE0YUJzQ.text: This restaurant is not open until 1am on Friday as shown here.  The manager said the kitchen closes at 12, so if you are looking for a late night place to eat, go elsewhere.  I told the employees at the front about it being advertised on the web site as being open until 1am and they said "We have a web site?"  Stupid is as stupid does!!!

oeftPDBiDyRnF2gN0rTOuQ.text: Came here late night after the McGregor and Diaz fight (3/5/16) with my husband. We were starving and it was our first time being on the Strip in Vegas. We love sea food so we decided to try Bubba Gumps. I ordered the Shrimpers Net Catch getting half Cajun and half garlic spice with a side of fries. I wasn't a fan of the Cajun spice but loved the Garlic spice. My husband and I LOVED the fries. He ordered the Shimp Macaroni and didn't like it. He also order Clam chowder and loved it. The service was awesome. We came back the next day (3/6/16) with our inlaws and kids and had our last meal in Vegas at Bubba Gumps then headed back on the road to SoCal. My daughter at all her pasta, some of my shrimp and everyone loved their food. Service was awesome as well.

39_vuCVUOG0BW0Xz02EQmw.text: Tried to order a 22oz beer, but was informed to buy and drink their beer we had to pay $14.99 so we could take home a sovereign glass from the Bubba Gump restaurant that is required to buy! No option, you are literally required to buy a glass! Really? Who wants their glasses, certainly not me!!! Not only was their beer too much money, we were informed we didn't need to take home the glass, but we were paying for it. We got to rent a glass to drink for over priced beer! You have lost our business locally (Madeira Beach) and this review will hopefully keep from others from being fleeced by your company! Shame on you for taking advantage...no wonder why your restaurant was so empty!!! Try Tambo Indian food, just up the road! Excellent good and service. You don't have to buy their glasses!

qqpXLKeBBzlt-N4bQfECNw.text: Food was excellent I got the crab stuffed shrimp.  Bar tenders were more than helpful, friendly, and personable.  The strawberry lemonade thing I got was outstanding.  It was a tad pricey, but not that bad.  Bar booths were missing seats which looked really tacky. Nice souvenir shop down stairs.

wHEwQtIivVIr_dU9nsXPuA.text: So let me just start off by saying that we love Bubba Gumps. We've gone to different locations and have had great experiences every time...except for this one. The restaurant wasn't very crowded. There was no wait, but we got seated in the very back room all by ourselves. Felt a little out of place and ignored. That was strike one.   Strike two was when we ordered. I wanted a dish that came with tilapia and just wanted a different fish like salmon or mahi mahi. Most places would say "sure no problem" but our waitress said "nope. We can't do that." Imagine my shock when a restaurant can't do a simple switch like that. It took several tries of me asking her to please go double check with the chef before she finally went to ask. She came back and what do you know..."oh okay we can switch that for you". It's just very irritating when a restaurant makes it seem like a hassle to do something simple for a paying customer.   After that whole incident I had asked for a comment card...and guess what. They don't have any. Of course they don't have any. So that's why I'm writing this here.  All in all food wasn't anything special and service sucked. Our food was cold when it came out and they just dropped it off without a word. There are so many options on the strip and you can find something a lot better! Needless to say I will not be returning or recommending this location to anyone.

8q2Ww1AoCFyWZVnS3AkMqQ.text: I happened to find this place on its opening night in Vegas. The staff are exceptionally friendly, from the host at the front door to the bartender and other waitstaff. Felt right at home for this Mississippi-born girl. I ordered a bowl of the gumbo and was greeted by a wide bowl with two perfect mounds of rice surrounded by delicious sausage and shrimp gumbo. Spicy, but not too much for me. I also had a Delta Sunset margarita, which has a bit of a raspberry taste. Tasty! The drink is mixed right in front of you if you sit at the bar. There's great decor from old license plates, film stills from the movie Forrest Gump, and other reminders of Southern culture. Also, a gift shop on the lower level with elevator access to the restaurant for those who cannot walk up the stairs. Smiles all around!

ZpftFgRdCc75AwJx_kX-ug.text: Good food! I was visiting Las Vegas with my husband. We went to the place for shrimp. I barely eat shrimp outside, because normally the restaurants don't peel the shrimp shit out......I know the shit is a line on the shrimp back.....when I order their shrimp,surprised me, they cleaned them so well. I was happy about this point! The food is really tasty, the service was good! I would like to recommend this place to my friend;)

2O7cFdLMSDbCoFbrjCvuvw.text: I had a great time here.  I took my dad here and it was a lot of fun and the food was excellent too.  The key is to this place, get drunk and eat!

3p5kgwBlM0zp5xtHHoL95g.text: Went here once with the family. The food is really good and we love the atmosphere. It can be busy sometimes. Also the waiters are really cool. They even quiz you questions from the movie which is really neat. It was a hard place to find though we got lost and had to ask people how to get there. Also the meals aren't cheap. My meal and my wifes meal were $20 each. Not bad but not a place we'd go to more than once a year.

9aV8QGhcjj343COyMnmUZg.text: We went here to sit on the balcony over looking the strip. It has a great view!  The food is ok.. The hush puppies are the best I've had. Bubba Gumps is a fun experience but way over priced..We split an appetizer, meal, dessert and 2 beers for $75! It was worth it for the view. I wouldn't go there if you're on a tight budget.

Y8yrcOEBpyrcq0Skako82g.text: I've been to a number of Bubba Gump restaurants because my husband is a huge fan of the place for some reason.  I find the food to be pretty consistent no matter which restaurant we go to.  This is the first time we visited the one in Vegas.  I'm the one who spotted it and pointed it out to my husband.  He said he wouldn't have noticed it had I not pointed it out.  I mentally kicked myself for being observant after eating here.  The food was pretty standard Bubba fare - the best ever popcorn shrimp was still pretty good, the fish and chips still average.  My issue with this location is the service.  Our waitress came to our table all of twice - once to take our order, once to bring the bill.  At every other Bubba's I've been to the servers have been really friendly and they always come and quiz you on Forrest Gump trivia while you're waiting for your food.  I don't know if this is just something they don't do at this particular Bubba Gump location or if we just had a really lousy server but I don't imagine I'll be dining at Bubba Gump in Vegas again when there are so many other good places to eat.

K8S01LUHoUJsLUNS2lYQkA.text: This place is a joke. The food sucks. My server was very nice but I felt very sorry for her because she said 90% of the servers only get 1 shift a week. Seems like very bad business practice. Bubba gump Las Vegas does not care about customers or employees!!! If your employees are happy your customers are happy!!! I will never eat at Bubba Gump Las Vegas again.

XORhHqzUkxI64JOf_HEXpA.text: Overall the food was really good, I was impressed with the food, even though it was pricey. But your in Vegas you have got to eat good food and that costs $$$. Waitress was friendly.

hUtcLZtPEsNI38RKWqwZUQ.text: Get the spicy jambalaya! And shrimp Mac and Cheese! Melt in your mouth delish!

8Osf5H-LTLknINGjalyXlA.text: I love seafood but I'm usually not a fan of chained restaurants.  This place was good. I had the shrimp scampi.  It was a big portion so I saved some for breakfast.  We also had some type of soup with shrimp, very delicious also.

Xjfu2PMr6ycaJVJk25yFvA.text: We went there with a party of 7 on our recent Vegas trip and were seated right away (it was a weekday). The service was really good. Our waiter played fun trivia games with us and the overall atmosphere for my "Forrest Gump" loving family was fantastic. We loved all of the little details that made the restaurant so nostalgic to the movie, including the "run forrest run"/"stop forrest stop" license plates on the table to use to get the waiter's attention. Perhaps it is a tourist attraction but overall we loved the place, loved the food, and enjoyed the service.

kxhF033qwQcP5unBV_K7_g.text: Bubba gumps based on the movie Forest Gump, later the waiter quizzed me on how many Dr Peppers Forest drank, he said 15, theres also a Dr Pepper sign on the restaurant wall, prior to all that I asked for a Dr Pepper, waiter said they "dont have Dr Pepper"...  WHAT THE??  ...no Mr Pibb either...

aCTe-CpPVU9xjgg63acU-g.text: We were shown to our table and after about 15 minutes without being waited on at all (and asking a nearby employee if they could find us our waiter or bring some water) we left.

ZQ4nwibtGv8wWllprrsT3A.text: Great view overlooking the strip way overpriced got two non alcoholic drinks a shrimp cocktail and a side Caesar salad and the bill was $37

MRGu-HvNLlr6uKwPPNq0-w.text: Friendly service. Fresh salads. Reasonably priced also. The pear berry salad had awesome raspberry dressing and the coconut shrimp are really good.

dxupFbTeEdliIWi6iUbb3w.text: Best hush puppies I've ever had. High price for the food but the atmosphere is fun and the entire staff was very friendly. Had a large group 10+ and they got us in less that 10 min on a Friday afternoon.  Like that they treated the kids like a fun addition to the group rather than ignoring them and only speaking to the adults.

5hPDqAif2fCPNiSAKu9QgA.text: I've been to this particular restaurant a few times and i always seat by the patio, the view is really really beautiful specially at night. I always order the BLT shrimp salad! OMG its soooo yummy!

0fE6NLGkawzahHm2trJPhA.text: My first time ever eating at Bubba Gump and I was impressed. Our Server Eva was fantastic, very friendly and very informative. She was an angel.  I had the fish and chips it was the best fish and chips I have had in a long long time.  Very happy will definitely recommend Bubba Gumps to others.

JPRT8qJQ2cMNcVnta4T7Vg.text: I have been to many Bubba gump locations and always had good time, but this one is really bad. Will never come back again. Rude servers, cold food and dirty everything..

5tfVnyxAXNM95UCB-sUoxg.text: This place is disgusting! I ordered one of their most popular dishes (shrimp New Orleans)  gross! It had a taste of dirt! I took my family here for their first time in Vegas and honestly I think there are much better places at a  fraction of the price! I was so disappointed and I wasn't the one paying a nearly $200 Bill.

QnARdDgxTXIBRfEWDsUI5Q.text: I wish I could review the food but since we could not get anyone to wait on us ( not even water ) I cannot. I will say that when I told the hostess others had been visited by their wait staff two and three times since we were seated she was unable to get anyone to take our table. I think we were in the middle the wait staff squabble and we were the recipients. Can we give a restaurant a negative number?

L4DSyi3qBYIb4Ax3ktupRA.text: Came here on August 11, 2014 for dinner with my family. I've been to their location in San Francisco, so it isn't like I'm new to the place.  Pros of the night: -Our waiter (I believe is name was Andrew?) was very enthusiastic, when he came by and didn't seem like many other waters who literally look like they hate their job. -The food was very good.  Cons of the night: -The garlic bread was said to be out ASAP, but it came literally 3 minutes before our entrees came out. Mind you we had already been waiting for about 20 minutes. -I did not know that at this location you had to pay for drink refills. My first cup strawberry lemonade had an average amount of ice in it, so I was not complaining, but my second cup but literally a whole cup of ice. Why I had to pay $.99 for that, I don't know. -The sign "Stop, Forrest, Stop" is supposed to bring a waiter over quickly, but my sign was out for about 5 minutes before a waiter came, even though we were right next to their payment machine.

t6KyCAjhWROfoQW1HQIRhQ.text: Loved this place.  Had dinner here before a show we were seeing at the Aria (which is right across the street).  They do NOT take reservations, do call ahead seating, etc., so I was slightly concerned about getting a table, but since we were willing to sit inside (the outside deck is very popular), we got a table after waiting in line about 10 minutes, so not bad at all for a Vegas night.  Drinks were awesome, service was very good and quick and the food was very tasty.  Was really glad to see a Bubba's in Vegas, and I highly recommend.

U7ZnHlcHca5IYZUSQerHtg.text: Usually love Bubba Gumps but NOT this location. We were there on 3/5. We sat for 15 minutes in a restaurant that was not even half full (1:30pm). Not a single person came by to even offer water or take drink orders let alone take our meal order. Others were seated and waited upon. They literally walked around us to the other tables. It was as though we were invisible. After 15 min we asked for the mgr, told him what happened and left. Spoiled it for us to ever go to another Bubba Gumps.   Even 1 star is too generous but have to rate it something to get it published.

V688umuKvk4fwzO--Kc9LQ.text: I will never come here again. Six people at dinner and not ONE person liked their food!!! Save your money and go someplace different!

t1y6vpnw3NEHraQzdecidA.text: My server....Tammy...she was awesome sauce!!!  Her demeanor was pleasant.  She had good recommendations.  The girl who sat us down was nice too.  She made suggestions and I tried it...(I can't remember the dish) but it was good & I was pleased.  I wanted shrimp and that's what I got.  It wasn't busy.  We were seated immediately.  I am pleased w/ my visit.  The manager was funny and kind and when I visit Vegas I'll be back!  I bought stuff from the gift shop downstairs...the tall chocolate guy downstairs....very pleasant as well....I'd buy sweatshirts from him any time...  Bad part - the nasty little greeter outside who was picking her nose and face when we came up and offered us a place to eat??  It made me nervous to go inside...and she needs to put that ponytail up in a net too!!

O3iaydWEhdKVZknTQoZ84A.text: My first time here! The portions were decent, not overly priced but nothing special. A tad salty for my taste but filling.

-1F32k-j0ZKUvOqZl_LLOw.text: Atmosphere is casual and laid back. The drinks are awesome. I had the New Orleans shrimp-slight metallic taste Andy rice was a bit dry. Also had the hush puppies--not traditional style hush puppies and slightly undercooked. My boyfriend had the jambalaya-it was great. Had the dessert sampler. None of them were up to par. My main detractor was that they wouldn't seat us until our entire party arrived-even though we were ordering drinks and appetizers. I still give them 3 stars for the atmosphere and drinks. But food left a little to be desired. Oh and the sun was in my eyes the entire time.

cAC_r8xtxFI91j4tc6C72g.text: This Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. was fantastic. It was pretty expensive (as expected on The Strip), but besides that everything was cooked beautifully and service was top top notch. Tried Bubba's "Bucket of Boat Trash" and also shared the shrimp appetizer. Would highly recommend! Vegas has practically every restaurant you can think of so you never know where to go, but this is a good option.

Qa1zGLkxFXB_cmUxcb_TjQ.text: I spent and wasted 238.00 dollars on nasty food...jambalaya was hot and couldn't even taste flavoring...shrimp were over cooked rice was hard...kids pizza was not cook thoroughly and my husband ordered a burger medium rare...it look totally raw/pink....very upset about this Las Vegas Strip location.....would not recommend...and the service was not superb! It was mediocre!...

mAoMsRW3nqJXDRjl3IGOhQ.text: I was so excited to finally try Bubba Gumps finally. We ordered two appetizers. They were terrible. The spinach dip should say that it is mostly onions. It was awful. And the hush puppies weren't hot enough and they were just okay. We had the bucket of shrimp and fish. It was okay, but nothing to write home about and it won't bring us back. Our water was great and doing his best.

dhLJVRCGvdlfUB21f1Puiw.text: Ok this place is ok, just ok. The food is fine and the servers are very friendly. So here is what happened, the last tin=me I was there, there was a table of people clearly from their corporate office. All the staff were falling all over each other to wait on them hand and foot. The problem was that it was at the expense of the paying customers! (Yes I know all about the Stop Forest Thing) know let me be clear, I put the blame on the corporate people for fostering a culture where the staff felt they had to act like that. If the corporate people were there to check out the restaurant they should have lifted their heads out of their plates for 2 seconds and view the sight of all of the servers at their table and nowhere else. So stop there if you must but if you see a large table full of people with the entire wait staff around them: Run Forest Run! Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

67aMt9qHBiD5XP8txaI0Ew.text: Had to send the food back because it was cold, however the manager was extremely helpful.  The Forrest Gump trivia was funny, so brush up on your Forrest Gump trivia.  I didn't realize I know so much about the movie.

7SL7BG8-1AL_RRE-O7JHuQ.text: The food was good the service not really, why use a system with plates when the employes don't care at all, I switch to red plate and after over 10 minutes some show off to take care, draft beer in plastic glass no bueno

j9wAkRe6XcY5ahYJlf1Yhw.text: Alabama Steam Pot - this is unbelievably delicious and fresh, thanks. And the spot is of course really good and fun both for adult companies and families. Will return for sure. And of course: Patrick - good job man, decent service.

M0hjPC32QIkel0IXvRwNng.text: This was my first time ever to this restaurant. The food was okay. I had the Shrimp Po Boy sandwich. I wasn't to keen on the fact the sandwich came with mayo (which I had withheld) and I couldn't replace that with a different sauce. The bread was kind of thick, which I didn't care too much for. I asked the server if I could just get popcorn shrimp with fries and he dryly replied "no". The drinks are good, but for $14 you would make out like a bandit at the Rock Bar or Evening Call size wise. The server never said his name, which was the first step to informing me the service wouldn't be superior or close to it. I saw him sitting in a booth with two of his other female customers as cozy as ever. Yeah, no bueno. If I try this place again, they'll have to drag me there.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp po boy

Hy9n4rFE6aqkGp7wKJRh9w.text: I've been to Gatlinburg and New Orleans but had Bubba Gump in Vegas. It was ok. I thought the decor was very well done and the Run and Stop signs work really well.   The food wasn't anything spectacular, but my boyfriend's food was better than my choice. Process are decent and service was good. Our waitress came over and gave us some Forrest Gump trivia questions, which we got all right. I thought we were going to win something though, lol.    I wouldn't make any special trips back to BG, but I wouldn't oppose to going of anyone wanted to try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lt. Dan&#39;s Drunken Shrimp
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Net Catch... garlic flavor
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table

eKMmzEUwWRLihkqOxsSreg.text: After watching Forrest Gump and loving the movie, I had to try bubba gumps shrimping co. When I saw it on the strip I HAD to go there. This place is the bomb! Their shrimp shack pasta is my favorite dish; it has tangy, buttery sauce over a bed of penne, tomatoes, and shrimp. The workers also play Forrest Gump trivia with you. It's quite amusing! If you get all the questions right, you get some sort of prize. When I went to the one in San Francisco, they gave us free parking.  I live in Seattle, I wish I could take this place back home with me. It's a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp shack pasta

CiO8bsX0FxFgOqOdmpmRJQ.text: I went here Sunday afternoon. The decor was nice. I love the pics and movie phrases and a lot of other stuff. The food presentation was nice. My friend ordered the gumbo which she enjoyed. Also the peel and eat shrimp. Which she didn't like. I tasted one and let me tell u it was bland. I am a Cajun/creole sauce fanatic and this was not. Bubba is turning over in his grave. I had the spinach artichoke and shrimp dip which was awful and bland. I took a few bites and they happily took it off my bill. I also had the shrimp skewers that were beautiful but bland. Service was outstanding. Hostess very nice and welcoming and waiter was very attentive. I live in L.A. and go to the one on the Santa Monica Pier. The food is better there

GCjsefo4WL5yWNsn3kDnEA.text: The atmosphere, the food, and the service was excellent. Everything I could have ever wanted in a themed restaurant.

twsoud3BTQRFSa5Rm0i3gw.text: Every times I visit a new city I make it my business to eat at a Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. Every experience is usually pleasant and having me desiring my next experience. Well my visit to Bubba Gump in Las Vegas in April was the worst that I've experienced. Normally, their warm hospitable experience is consistent nationwide. Well this experience started with being set and not being greeted by our server for 15 mins. Upon experiencing it to our serve Matthew, he said "owww, I didn't know." We decided to talk to a manager and all the manager Bud said was, "let's see if we can speed it up." It took an additional 30 min for my food to arrive to the table, after being told by a support staff that my food had been dropped on the floor. When my food finally arrives it's cold and I'm left to deal with it. I boxed my food up to take back to my room. I felt that there would be no help if I requested a manager, so I simply sucked it up and took my cold food back to the room. I would not recommend eating at this location. Not the True experience that I have come to expect from a company that I love.

2z95tQaCDaqgVq5IWSPkcA.text: The flavor and variety of the shrimp are excellent. It was served hot and fresh. The hostess was very friendly.  The waitress was not patient. It was our first visit, so we had a couple questions about the menu. She was irritated by this. If the restaurant was busy, I would completely understand. But, we were only one of five tables in the whole restaurant at the time.

xWdDzFonOhvnqmFiaQLPLQ.text: Perfect view on the patio, located near Planet Hollywood.  Had a signature drink that was  good and came with a souvenir shaker. Shared appetizers and especially loved  the "Run Forest " on the table.

vw8lqtvDTAtZ7mQqVJcr-Q.text: Horrible.  Walked in. Greeter dropped menu and said 'here you go' coldly. Then we sat at the table for more than 15 minutes without even a drink order or a hello. 11:15am visit and it was dead there - probably 5 patrons. 6 workers were hanging out at the hostess stand when we walked out, enjoying themselves.  No one even noticed we were slowly walking out.

iC-aaxPteQsQFwKE4U45jQ.text: On my most recent trip here, the food was good and the same as usual, but it was the service and management that really pissed us off and now I don't know if we will ever return...at least to this location.   Our server was alright. There was a couple times where we couldn't find her but I'm thinking they were just understaffed that evening; it was during the holidays after all. When we were done with our meal, she seemed a little pushy on getting us to buy desserts even when we told her we were way too full and just wanted the check. She asked us to think about it and she'd come back. What the heck? Why can't you just bring the check? It seemed like she wanted us to give a definite answer of no before she was willing to print the check. Strike one.  When we finally received the check, we attempted to pay with an e-gift card that had $100 loaded on it and our meal was $91 including tax. When she brought the receipt for us to sign, she told us that we couldn't tip with the gift card and that we still had $8 or $9 remaining on the card, awesome...where's the gift card, could we have it back? The server refused and told us it was policy to keep our printed gift cards whether or not there was a remaining balance. WHAT? How does that even make sense? I will never be able to use the remaining balance then! We asked her to make a copy for us but she refused and told us to simply re-print one when we got home...problem is how do you do that when it was a gift and I already deleted the original e-mail?! No other business I've frequented has ever asked to keep a gift card, remaining balance or not without asking first if I wanted it back. She told me this is what her manager told her to do, which didn't really help the situation. I considered not leaving a tip since I just lost 9 bucks but ended up leaving a decent one and decided to take it up with management at a later date since it wasn't her fault and she was just doing what she was instructed to do.  I e-mailed the company about a week later and complained about my remaining balance that was lost because I was unable to get my gift card back and 2 days later received a phone call from one of the managers of the Vegas location. She stated that it was company policy to do this and the server indeed followed protocol. I was really angry and got in a heated argument with the manager about the policy since it doesn't really protect them from anything, while making it super inconvenient for customers and discourages them from buying and using gift cards. It wasn't the 9 bucks that I cared about, but the principle of what was going on that seemed fraudulent to me. I got nowhere with management and she continued to tell me that it was corporate policy. Ok, I guess I'll have to contact them to get more info then.  Then we contacted corporate customer service and was told that this was NOT corporate/company policy in any way, shape or form and that the store was mistaken and they weren't sure why. They ended up sending us a new link to re-print our gift card with the remaining balance and informed us that we would be receiving a phone call apology from the General Manager once they contacted him about the situation.  All in all, Bubba Gump Las Vegas is run by liars and they did nothing but inconvenience my family and then lie to me about it to back up their side of the story. It will take a lot for me to come back here in the furture, if I ever do. Just thinking about it gets me fired up and angry. I really hope they go out of business some day when this all catches up to them!  UPDATE (2/12/14): Well, it's been over a month and still haven't heard from the General Manager of Bubba Gump or received the apology I was promised. Worst customer service of any restaurant chain I've been to! Would never recommend this place to anyone

Lzgf6ugkNxjIC3J9vArLuw.text: Being in Vegas most of us carry around a big slushie drink (mine from Fat Tuesdays) & most restaurants knowing this willingly accommodate you bringing your drinks into their establishment so you can enjoy a meal. They realize you can't pound back a yard long alcoholic drink so quickly. Well upon entering this restaurant I was told I needed to finish my 3/4 full drink or I couldn't enter. I haven't had this problem with any restaurant on the vegas strip. I'm sorry I won't order your $6 drink but would rather order your $25 entree. Will never return to any of their restaurants due to the way this was handled. I was told to finish my drink before they closed in an hour & would be served then. Well my drunk self would probably not want to eat at that point. Off to La Salsa Cantina we went in Planet Hollywood where we received amazing service!

lKbF6HmEO18HvtJAVIposg.text: I love the story behind Bubba Gump, I mean who does not like Forest Gump?! Along with atmosphere the bartender was phenomenal! y6siLOBGYEKTWLrpUjwxuw.text: The girls had to eat here just to say they did, it was on the bucket list of places to eat , I really love the location and the atmosphere , the adults ate at the steak house the girls wanted bubba gumps , but overall the experience was great

5HvNyS_ESfk9gNdflKkgoQ.text: Great location in the strip. Very nice food and drink menu. Fantastic dinner for both taste and size. They have a patio with a nice strip view. Well worth the wait and beats the heck out of a buffet      Wait staff was friendly, knowledgable  and  attentive. I would go back.

SM7x189ZilcUorjKJGHYWA.text: I remembered trying Bubba Gump Shrimp in San Fran and it was amazing. Of course it has been years so I just assumed that they would keep up with their hospitality?  First things, first....this place is hard to get to. If I was a tourist not staying at Planet Hollywood I would have given up the search. However, that also means that you will most likely to park in the PH garage (which luckily it's free for now on Sept 2018). You have to walk through Planet Hollywood most likely easier to go to the left when you first walk into Miracle Mile (part of PH) and keep walking until you exit the building. The tricky part is then finding the escalators or in my case an elevator to take you upstairs since I had a stroller. We ended up walking to the very end and took the elevator up. We were confused about which way to go but we ended up going through these doors into more shops and saw the Bubba Gump Sign. We then took another elevator to the dining room as we had entered the gift shop first.   My party was already seated but ordering was a whole ordeal of waiting. Once we ordered, food came out about 20-25 minutes later. The kid's cheese pizza looked awful, but french fries were doable. I decided to order the "I'm stuffed" Shrimp. This place is not the best place to come to if you are on a diet as everything has tons of calories. I was disappointed to find shells in my food because there was supposedly crab in it. It was hard eating something that had hard crunchy bits in it so I was done halfway through. After they brought out our food though, we didn't have a single server stop by asking how it was or if we needed anything. We were a big party too of 10. I had to hunt someone down for a box after waiting about 20 minutes.   Service stunk and the food was mediocre. I expected more but I should have realized that most of my fellow Yelpers reviews were unfortunately correct.

GGdeC6_hSZJ9Q6eQ_1NNWg.text: I love the concept of Bubba Gump restaurants! I mean who has not watch the Forrest Gump movie yet?  They are a franchise restaurant, but they are fun to go! especially for Birthdays and important dates.   The Restaurant: All the Bubba Gumps have lots of pictures and decoration from the movie. They have a gift shop where people can buy merchandise of all kinds. The restaurant area has lot of seats and tables. All the tables have a metal plate sign with two signs: "Stop Forrest stop" (RED), or "Run Forrest run" (BLUE). If you need your waiter you put the sign in red, and the will stop and take care of you.  The Food & Drinks: Bubba Gump offers seafood with a southern touch. During my last visit, my party of 2 and I ordered some drinks before our meal. We all got the frozen margaritas with a Grand Marnier floater. I got the "Frozen watermelon margarita" and I think it lacked flavor. It was too icy and did not look like the picture in the cocktail menu. My party got the regular frozen margarita and they had better luck with the flavor. For dinner I got "Jenny's Catch" grilled fish on top of mashed potatoes, spinach and lobster sauce. I always get this dish but this time it was a little too soupy. I don't know if its because it was Summer time in Las Vegas or what but it was not that great. I also felt I needed more mashed potatoes.  My favorite part however was great as always! Bubba Gump has the most amazing "Key Lime Pie" its made from scratch and I love the zing and tart it has. I love it!  The Service: The service was a little slow during my last visit, I don't think they were that busy, so I don't know why it took so long. I like the staff is friendly and enthusiast. They do Trivia questions about them movie and is fun and interactive. Overall, I give this specific location a 3.5 stars. They need to improve some stuff but I still think is a good option and a fun experience where you don't have to spend a bunch of money.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key Lime Pie
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key Lime Pie, a little melty because of Summer weather
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya Shrimp

ibxBQY6TXSJd8eGfAwXeIQ.text: I think the key to having a good experience here is to visit in between lunch and dinner rush. My husband and I were getting overheated walking on the strip and decided we needed a quick bite. I let him pick, so in to Bubba Gump Shrimp we went. It was in the late afternoon, but still before the dinner rush, so that meant we were seated right away.  Service was a bit slow but very friendly, and our waitress kept our big water glasses filled and we chugged to rehydrate ourselves. We got the shrimp mac and cheese which came out piping hot, but was WAY too salty. And the breadcrumbs seemed a bit stale and gummy, and kind of just stuck in our teeth. The shrimp were really tender though, so that part was good. We also got the Shrimp New Orleans to share. The shrimp were actually cooked and seasoned perfectly! The sauce was really salty, but the rice helped calm that down.  Overall it was a good experience, but nothing over the top outstanding. The waitress giving us a little Forrest Gump quiz at the end was a fun touch. I'm not sure if Bubba Gump would be my first choice, but if someone else wanted to go I'd definitely be up for trying more of the menu!

HG4J3U9JlpKXZA2wJ1li2Q.text: First time at this location. The view form out table was great. We sat outside because the weather was nice. The sun was down and the breeze was great. I ordered calamari for an appetizer. It was okay. Never enough and too small and to many veggies in it. I had the Bubba Gump Feast. It was okay as well nothing to brag about. My son had the coconut shrimp. He said it was okay, so I tried a piece of shrimp to check it out. It was dry and bland. The waiter was a nice guy and checked on up often so that was a good thing.  My over all experience here was okay. Nothing to write home about. It's Vegas!?!

w2E17wGWlh2D6j_ajSzUPw.text: Had a decent lunch here with some friends who live in town. I have stayed at or around PH for many years but have never thought about dining at Bubba Gump's. My friend's daughter loves this place so we made some time to meet the last time I was in Las Vegas. It is located upstairs in the area above the Strip close to the Miracle Mile Shop entrance near Harmon Ave. You cant miss it. It actually occupies 2 floors. The gift shop is downstairs. The dining room and bar are upstairs. It's a good sized space upstairs, surprisingly.   I ordered the Mama Blue's Southern Charmed Fried Shrimp ($18.99) It came with fries, cole slaw and 2 dippin sauces (cocktail and ranch). The food wasnt bad. The shrimp was tasty and the batter was great. The fries were good and the cole slaw was just not what I like. The shrimp with the cocktail dippin sauce was good. I had pre-conceived expectations of bad food with themed restaurants such as Bubba Gump and I was glad to have been wrong. The food was good. The service was a little slow. Our server wasnt too enthusiastic or informative. It's ok... But I couldnt rate the experience any higher than I did. 3 stars.  Nearest parking is valet or self park at Miracle Mile Shops or the same at Planet Hollywood. Put your license plate at the table to Run Forrest Run if no table service is needed. Our server didnt tell us that until halfway through the meal... No wonderrrr....

T4hS4uLr8Z5_76tcvyLEYQ.text: This is a solid franchise joint - bit of everything to satisfy a large array preferences.  Family friendly and kids meal served on cute paper boat.  Shrimp gumbo was delicious- was suppose to split and share but ended up eating it all and had to order another to go.  Chicken Cesar salad and Pear and berry salad were also on point.  Kids got to take home sparkly light up cup that their drink came with.  Service was good and right on the strip with balcony outside sitting (too hot in June so we opted to sit indoor).

IGjs6fMexKC_eG1QdtRg9w.text: Craving seafood and we decided to stop in here .. I'd been before so I know it's a chain but this visit the food wasn't great..   Service was great.. they explained the run & stop signs on the table and the one time we used it a server stopped right away to answer our question ..   We got our drinks right away and our orders came out pretty quickly..   My food looked really good .. small serving size but that cheese sauce on the bourbon Mah mahi dryed up and resembled cheez whiz (no bueno) the crispy fried chips were cold those were definitely sitting out and added to the plate as a decoration.. shrimp was good (I could've eaten a plate of those and been happy!)  My bf ordered Jennys catch with lobster butter sauce .. that sauce with potatoes was delicious!   Overall service was a great.. but food was a miss on this visit.

S9PoqiEvuLYCgCnxfypA-A.text: You can't go wrong here.  This place is great.  The food is great and so is the service.  Decor is designed around the movie Forest Gump.  Great for families.

c9wMmf9y9b_esB16ZidAVw.text: This restaurant was so amazing. I had the shrimp gumbo. It was so tasty. The restaurant itself reminds you of the Forest Gump movie. There were little sayings on the table from the movie. The family section looked like Forest Gump house from the movie. I really enjoyed the decor . I will definitely visit again.

Half of the shrimp they gave me was some veggie fried thing. They gave me extra shrimp to make up for it, but then they over charged me for the hush puppies. Meh. I wouldn't eat here again.

naSD30tSqXn5DApjYExS8w.text: We are Bubba Gump junkies and visit in every city that has one. Today is the Net Catch and Jambalaya  for the main entree. Spicy for sure. Gotta get the Georgia Peach Tea and a Tennessee, too. They are in a cool glass to go home with you.

b04-BfI48wEuiJldB1puUQ.text: I never saw Forrest Gump so this place was sorta lost on me.  I've seen it in Orlando and New York but never ventured until this las Las Vegas trip.  The restaurant is peppered with movie paraphernalia and the waiters engage customers with Forrest Gump trivia, it was fun and the answers were all around you.    Ordered shrimp macaroni & cheese - very salty, probably the breadcrumbs. The pasta was cheesy and shrimp spicy.    The grilled fish and vegetables was tasty and the fried fish, shrimp and seafood/shrimp hush puppies were crispy and good.    Watermelon lemonade was refreshing.  Received Bubba Gump souvenir glasses from gift shop - added treat.

jLNdOXA9mY_o9WUnfz63MA.text: We were walking down the strip on our way to a concert. We were hungry and it was a busy Saturday night. Everywhere in a casino was packed with a big wait. We were headed to the MGM when we passed Bubba Gump. My hubby had never been to one and it had been years since I had visited so we decided to give it a shot. We were seated right away and were happy to order some drinks and water-it was 109 outside so we had to hydrate lol.  Matthew our server was excellent! We order the blue coronarita and the bubba's blue Hawaiian drinks. Both were tasty. We had calamari for an appetizer which was decent but not the best I've had. For dinner I had the coconut shrimp and broccoli which was very good and the hubby had the shrimps heaven which came with 4 different types of shrimp-scampi, fried, coconut and tempura and fried. All was really good. All that food and 4 drinks for $114. Good value lots of food and great service. What a nice surprise!!

QEEtGXswTM7qBkLQmHKuzA.text: Closest parking is in Planet Hollywood. Too bad you have to walk all the way through Miracle Mile and then around the outside of PH and up the stairs, since the elevator was down, to get to it. There is a Walgreens close by that may let you park there, but I was not able to confirm that. I had the grilled seafood trio. My friend had the shrimp combo with grilled shrimp, tempura and coconut shrimp. Our server was very nice and attentive and had some funny trivia to ask. I don't like how they ask you to buy their gift card for all the other bubba gump's in the US. It seems like they have to go through their whole sales pitch before leaving. I would prefer if they said "Hey check out this pamphlet it explains our gift card, let me know if you want to purchase!" I am a local and it seems like the majority of the people were tourists. I had a good time. Thanks!

8RC4J7Vs-9YDPhxkSRJQXg.text: Oh my goodness, shrimp boaten captain extraordinary.  I can't wait to go back.  The Shrimp Heavener is heavenly.
