soXw9OQKHRnd7wQ1evk5sw.text: The food was great, we had no wait time on a Friday night and our server jayson was entertaining and kind. Other team members step in the assist servers if the restaurant gets busy and you can tell its customers are a priority. A definite must if you adore Forest Gump!

kvFiqorON7lHEIIgpPe5KA.text: The food was good, and the server got an A for effort. He was sweet, but he seemed a inexperienced. They do offer military discounts! A big plus was the bathrooms were really clean! Always good to find a clean bathroom in such a high traffic place.

I-dZTkgd-K1fB_kNFaFZfw.text: Every time I travel and there happens to be a Bubba Gump's in that city I make sure to stop in and have my favorite peel n' eat shrimp appetizer.  It was as yummy as I remembered it.  Our server Patrick was so nice and accommodating.  Due to my friend's allergies Patrick was very thoughtful and gave us alternative options.  We really appreciate him going above and beyond.  His service was prompt and seamless.    The manager Patrick also stopped by to check on us.  We always appreciate it when managers show that they care.   I highly recommend this location!  We will surely be back soon!

uDHFXgaDfzCaWvI51t0gPw.text: I went to bubba gimps expecting it to be another normal food place but they went above and beyond. I got there and the napkins were folded into little boats. I was so impressed by them I asked the server to teach me and he did. After I unfolded my napping and put it on my lap o realized how comfy it was. It felt like a blanket in disguise. I asked the server where he got the napkin from and he said Walmart so today I went to Walmart and bought 50 napkins of the same brand. Those napkins are the best I've ever used. Go there to try out there amazing blanket napkins

XS1dbOF2qgRzX1_093WKfg.text: Summary: Every time we visit Vegas we always walk by Bubba Gump but never stop in so for this trip my SO decided to drag me in. I like the setting, kind of remind me of Boiling Crab (yelp.com/biz/the-boiling...) minus the sharpies on the wall. Food: Base on yelp review, we decide to try their Hush Puppies first to see how it is before heading in to the main course. Luckily that is all we tried. The hush puppies was bland and very oily. Service: 5 STARS for the staff members, from entrance to exit, the whole staff was cheerful and friendly. Overall: We should have kept walking. We should have stick to, "hmm maybe one day we should try this place" and just never try it so it could stay mysterious. But we tried it. We didn't like it. End of story.

T8G64NHsdKvlBk3nMoK1pA.text: Well, it's worth a try considering it's Bubba Gumps.    The service was quick and friendly.  Sometimes too friendly.  We were quite hungry and quiet at our table so the nice waitress decided to come over and distract us by doing a Bubba Gump movie trivia.  Nice, but weird and could have done without.  We are anti-social.. LOL  Now, the place and the food.  If you have ever been to the Joe's Crab Shack chain, this place looks and feels exactly like it without all the crab options.  Ordered the shrimp New Orleans which was okay but nothing special.  The hubs garlic shrimp were tasty, kinda small in my opinion.  Overall, the experience was decent however I would not go out of my way to try it again.    The End

aU-U1SNs0pX9pPlVYVTj-g.text: This was our first visit to any Bubba Gumps, and we loved it. Great portions for price, perfectly seasoned!  Wish there was a larger selection of fish options, without the shrimp.  Beautiful strip view outside, we were lucky with cooler weather on our visit. Wait staff was friendly, quick, and reliable.  Will defenitely return again!

Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ya-8i88ugqFh3nKEfoNYgg.text: Stopped at this Bubba Gump location for lunch my first day in Vegas. For a table 6, we were seated quickly. We had a awesome waitress, told us little about Vegas. We had visited a Bubba Gump before so we knew what to order. Shared seafood platter, bowl of gumbo and buckets of shrimp. Drink specials was good. Nice clean restroom. Nice view of the strip, we were seated right across from Crystal Shops.

dEyQYF4KAEmYXzdK9d1vLg.text: I was some what hesitant about eating here after reading the reviews but I am glad I went. The service was good. The server was patient and answered all my questions. The wait wasn't long and I was able to sit on the patio with the wifey. The food was good and I don't have any real complaints. We didn't wait long for our food and everything was hot. I don't understand all the bad reviews. I recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FQvpQsWSypBNpuyvyGnu2A.text: I was warned that this restaurant wasn't the best, but my guy and I were hungry so we decided to try it out anyway.  Big mistake...I wasn't at all impressed!    I ordered from the menu (take-out) the "Net Catch Entree" - Beer steamed Peel 'n' Eat Shrimp, along with Carrots, Celery, Corn, Potatoes and Andouille Sausage all steamed and tossed with Garlic Spice or our Secret Cajun Spice recipe for $22.99.  I chose the Cajun spice seasoning without the Andouille sausage.  The shrimp was cooked perfectly, but it didn't have the Cajun flavor I was expecting and was use to and the corn on the cob were hard as a rock, so I couldn't eat them.    My babe ordered the "Forrest's Seafood Feast" - Hand breaded Fried Shrimp, Fish & Chips and Seafood Hush Pups. Served with Fries and dippin' sauces, Tartar, Cocktail and Remoulade for $20.99.  He said he enjoyed it, so maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.  Overall, I was disappointed.  For the price I expected WOW...but, instead got BLAH!

QRMXUMLIbGl_aK2Rz-JKSQ.text: Fabulous food and service. The environment is very fun and lots of cool memorabilia from the Forrest Gump movie. The servers also come up and do movie trivia and quizzes  while waiting makes it fun and interesting. I have the Alabama steam pot Cajun style and it was DELICIOUS. Lots of shrimp and other delicious seafood. Very reasonable prices and lots of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alabama steam pot Cajun style off the hook delicious!!

rphygfS_UApULHmYDcAPXA.text: Seafood is my weakness and to find bubba Gump shrimp was like finding treasure for me. I loved the whole concept of the place. Photos of Forrest Gump, artifacts, benches and decor is just mind blowing. This place was connected to a bubba gump giftshop too. If anyone were interested to get little something , they had that option.  We were sitted very quickly as we walked into the Restaurent. our server was nice and knowledgeable . She suggested how much bucket shrimp should we order for two people and if it was too much food for us or not. Which helped us make decision.  We got a bucket of cajun and garlic shrimp. Cajun was our favorite because of its unique flavor. Also got a shrimp scampi pasta. It was very light and tasty. Not too much added thats why it was nice to eat. I really liked the place.

BLOeh3foBlrKZFLQ4A1GHw.text: Good food but horrible service! They aren't attentive at all, once we sat waited 20 min and we had to ask for a waiter to get our drinks. For refills we also had to ask different servers that were passing by because our server wasn't really around, it seemed like they kept getting upset about us asking to be helped....

oWUcTZscg8yK9imA_3u-5w.text: We had a party of 33, so I called ahead of time. The person I spoke to on the phone didn't seemed too thrilled about a large party coming in. I was a little worried about that because we have been to restaurants where service was horrible because of large parties. However when we got there, everyone was really friendly. Our waiter we got on our end of the table provided excellent customer service. The lady I had spoke to on the phone stated that everyone on the same bill must sit together. Our waiter allowed for our kids to move around and said he will work with whatever we decide to do. He went above and beyond! The food was excellent as well! We enjoyed this location the best (we've been to three locations in California)

M0lADN7b-K1IO10Qs6Kv9w.text: I'm not a seafood person but I tried some of my friend's shrimp and fries and it was really good. Great flavor, not too bready. Good.

jVLZI2-bH4m1wxnpjkiQGw.text: Love the awesome interior design!  The service was just okay.   The food was just okay.  We orders garlic bread and fried shrimp and fries.  You cannot go wrong with fried stuffs. LOL!!    Garlic shrimp was too salt but good salty.  Garlic bread $5.99.   Fried shrimp $21.99.  And garlic shrimp $14.99

juNwS4i26qmX1QrbYayDaQ.text: Frankly, I can't rate the food because after twenty (20) minutes of waiting for someone to take a drink order, or even be welcomed, we walked out.  There were at least a dozen empty tables in the restaurant.  Do yourself a favor, go to any of the 15 restaurants nearby who want to earn your business.

P8-bhkEQk9vMmEsS7yDt_g.text: Neat atmosphere. Our server Danny was good spirited and energetic! He definitely helped make the experience fun. My fiance and I both had the Fried Seafood platter. Good food, and big portions!

yIViAJoQJBsdoeLFRGSa1A.text: oh snap. I forgot yall.  had a great trip last year. we sat on the patio and looked at the strip. The beer was cold and the shrimp were hot. I'm sorry I do not recall the server or managers name. Although both were good and gave wonderful service. We will be back soon.  Cajun shrimp and a tall brew.... cant get better than that.

MPmJ9-Ydv1pww7iReOn86A.text: The theme is fun, I do love the movie Forrest Gump.  Shrimp po boy was delicious, shrimp was crispy. Fries were good, better than usual not great. Fried shrimp was crunchy and not greasy. Coleslaw was very good.  Waitress rushed us out, I was eating my fries and she took my plate. There were empty tables around us, no reason to rush. I don't appreciate being rushed off for no reason and I wouldn't go back, even though the food was good. I can find good food and better waiters elsewhere.

PED2rW4tnZWVThq3B_h2ow.text: What can I say. I love Forest Gump and I gotta have to try this restaurant. Before I go I heard some ppl say do not dine in there for some reason but I am so glad I still choose my own feel. And I tried.   They didn't disappoint me at all and I loved this place and the food of course.   We ordered a sampler coz I would love to try everything a little bit. To my surprise The spicy chicken was above the average. I am not a chicken fan at all but their chicken my husband and I liked a lot. Bacon wrap shrimp is juicy awesome, hush puppies and dip fried shrimp were good. I also ordered the catch regular sized shrimp. The waiter asked if I would like to have jumbo shrimp but I believe the smaller shrimps are softer and has less black lines, they taste so good. Also the burgers came with very juicy thick beef I liked it too.   This place has very reasonable prices and good food. I highly recommend if you need to dine on the strip for casual occasion.

aGoLakGJsT4yEclW3yqMaQ.text: This is one of the best lunches I've had in a really long time.   Despite being on the high priced side for what we'd usually spend for a lunch, the food was fantastic. We ordered a fisherman basket and a red white and blue special shrimp basket. We had a variety of shrimp, fish and hush puppies. Everything was cooked perfectly! The breadings were crunchy and flavorful. The sauces were all great too. Even the fries were cooked hot and crispy.  The coleslaw was even a highlight. We loved everything!   We also ordered a coronaita and a spiked strawberry lemonade. Both of those were really well made and tasted great too.   The restaurant decor is fun and attractive. There's no way that you won't look around for your home state's license plate.   The staff was very friendly and attentive. We were checked on several times through our meal to make sure we were doing fine. They also have a flip chart system to get a servers attention. If you need something during your meal you flip the license plate to red, flip it to blue if all is well. Fun system!   As I said it's a little spendy. Our bill totaled over $70 for our 2 lunches with drinks. It was so good that it was worth every penny.

usROUNQXNV-WWoAWh-3zOw.text: The sampler tower is amazing! Great atmosphere and great drinks! Service a little slow, overall great place.

8xo7djmpfkrV1L2_IZ4mgQ.text: Really like the restaurant.  Visited it twice on a single trip. Like both the flounder dish and tilapia dish. The combo dish with bbq ribs, grilled shrimps, etc. was also really good. BBQ rib meat was tender and almost fell off the ribs. Very nice environment as well.

edxVGPJ_I3yFW6ey27Q04w.text: Yum! This was not my top choice to visit in Vegas but my fiance picked it and it was very good! I ordered buffalo wings and they were very good I also ordered a berry tequila drink and it was refreshing and strong! At the end of our visit the waitress asked us a trivia question about the movie forest gump and my fiance answered correctly and they gave us tickets to redeem free glass cups in their gift shop. The decor of the restaurant is fun! If you were into the movie Forest Gump I think you will get a kick out of this place

DO7cWocFQmS_lpWjyhokLw.text: Okay it's a little touristy, but a fun place with good food!  Bubba Gump Shrimp Co.  Serves lots of shrimp but plenty of other items too!  The place is decorated with tons of paraphernalia from the movie.    I should've taken a photo of Mamma Blue's Shrimp Gumbo - sorry everybody.  This was the highlight of the meal.  I would go just for the gumbo, and plan too soon!  The steamed crab legs were okay.  The fried seafood was good too - although for my personal taste, I didn't particularly for the coating they use.  Next time I plan to do something grilled instead of fried.  The wait staff was very friendly and service was very good!  They even had trivia questions from the movie - definitely a fun place.  The Las Vegas restaurant has both indoor and patio seating.  The patio is on the 3rd floor and overlooks the adjacent street and sidewalks- great people watching!  Man was that Shrimp Gumbo good!!!

Tried the spinach dip and it was good! I like to order drinks at each of the restaurants and have started a little collection of cups from the cities we've visited!

8e5KRQ5oqgkZZarN4dO_uQ.text: Edgar was a great server, the place was clean & the food was good. This place has the best & biggest mozzarella sticks I've seen. Great job!   We ordered a variety of dishes & did a family style set up so everyone could try different dishes. I was impressed with all of the food, but the chowder.   Margaritas come in cool shakers & the strawberries on the lemonade tasted fresh rather than frozen.

segAev3CCCHl0bPtpW5INQ.text: Fyi: to stop a waiter, flip the sign on the table to "stop forrest stop", you dont need anything have the sign say "run forrest run" That was not explained to us.  Walking the strip, for a mini date night, we wanted to eat somewhere that we dont have back home. So, after walking majority of the strip, Bubba Gump Shrimp it is. We came about an hour before we closed. We waited for about 20 min before our waiter came, he was very apologentic, and explained the signs on the table. We ordered the mozzarella sticks as an app, bf had the po' boy and I had the 'i am stuffed' shrimp/crab dish, very good. I had the speckled lemonade with strawberries (only a $1 for a refill). It was good, total was $55. A little high, but its on the strip lol. I would probably eat here again.

N4o3GYRcjeIY33m8sxsuXg.text: This was a very good seafood place with very tasty shrimp, fish, fries and those delicious hush puppies. We visited here late night while on the Vegas Strip and of course we wasn't disappointed, the only thing about this location, we thought that we could get the AARP discount for the night of course they said no way but even at that the food was tremendously delicious. All the staff was very nice and accommodating, even though the crowds were in the house, we still had a fun time and enjoyed our food, had fun and liked all of the thrills & frills that "was" included.

bdDx6RspSRb3Im_5ILUtWQ.text: Can't go wrong with Bubba Gump! You know what you're getting if you are familiar with this restaurant brand. Their meals are a generous portion (American style) and great family restaurant because of the large selection of dishes in each category. They also have a kids menu. At first I thought they offered only deep fried seafood but I was pleasantly surprised to find other entree options. I had Jenny's catch with Lobster Butter Sauce. It was delicious. Would have this again. The tilapia was tasty and prepared well. I would keep this restaurant as a go-to place for seafood - it offers reliable service, consistency in quality and large selection of dishes. Overall great value.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jenny&#39;s Catch

XpU-7kQWZFtx-iNRikzDmg.text: My husband and I stopped in for dinner. We belong to the Landry's Club which comes with perks, ie., priority seating, $25.00 credit after joining, $25.00 credit on my birthday, discounts, etc. Bubba Gump is owned by Landry's. I joined the club two months ago for $25. I received a $25 credit on my card and that $25 was taken off my total bill tonight. We parked in the Miracle Mile Shops parking garage-it's free to park. We walked through a small part of the mall to the outside where we went on an escalator up to the top and walked into the entry of Bubba Gump Shrimp-from there we climbed two flights of stairs to the seating and dining area of the restaurant. We were immediately greeted by two friendly hostesses and led to a booth. We were handed menus. A short time later our waiter appeared and took our drink order. I ordered ice tea and my husband-ice water.  Our waiter Bryant, was friendly and patient as we perused the menu. He answered all of our questions and checked on us often. We chose the Forrest Seafood Feast and the Shrimp MAC & Cheese. He brought the appetizer out first. The Shrimp MAC & Cheese was flavorful and cheesy. It was served in a small iron skillet-cute! The shrimp that arrived a short time later was crispy and delicious with crispy fish fillets and hush puppies on top of French fries. There were three sauces: cocktail, tartar and a thousand island style sauce.  Our waiter, Bryant asked us some movie trivia from the movie: Forrest Gump. It was an enjoyable and unique dining experience. We split our meal and for dessert we ordered the Brownie with vanilla ice cream topped with whipped cream-decadent! We enjoyed our dining experience!! It was fun and the food was good. I recommend trying Bubba Gump if you haven't already. We will be back in the future to try more of their dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced Tea and Iced Water

DWUjyB2IGFdrtEUa08w7Qw.text: My wife and I went there for our 56th birthdays (we are 30 days apart). We ordered the 5 piece fish and chips and asked for well done/crispy fries. When it came out they only brought out 4 fish pieces. We had to request the 5th. The fish was over-fried and tasted oily and burnt. The fries were limp and soggy. It's like the cook got it backward on our order. We didn't see the waitress to flag her down to let her know. We also forgot to flip the "Stop Forrest Stop" sign. The ketchup bottle was also empty I had to go get my own from another table.  When she finally came by I complained about the quality of the food. She offered new fries and to let the "chef" know. We had already finished the meal so we said no on the fries. Normally a proactive restaurant  will comp a couple of bucks on a screwed up meal. Not here! I also complained to the manager and his response was the same, I'll let the "chef" know. That does nothing to compensate the patrons to the establishment for a bad meal.  Oh, and the little scoop of ice cream for customers that are celebrating their birthdays at their restaurants... NOT HERE! What a disappointment. We won't ever go back there again. That manager needs to go back to cleaning tables and to learn what customer service really is. Thanks for a lousy birthday lunch for my wife and me.

yLNArHESXEdLMxdmnwRXRQ.text: Came here for lunch. The service was great as my server checked up on me every 15 minutes. I got the seafood gumbo and the steamed crab legs. The portion was generous and good pricing for Vegas. The crab meat was delicious and I dipped it in butter and lemon juice. The seafood gumbo was tasty as well and had shrimp, sausage and rice in it. It had a rich broth which was not too salty. I added some tobacco sauce to it as I enjoy spicy food.

MFoXMkkcbYfGnfDdw3UcgQ.text: So we adventured to Bubba Gumps Shrimp Co. I love the name of this place. Placed an order for  Forrest's SeafoodFeast $20.99 great deal ( fried shrimp,battered cod fish and seafood hush puppies) as well as fries. This is the bang for your buck and all the flavours you love. Ok service and sang my girlfriend happy bday

9MqYO19luTuDAOUZvbbsyg.text: The photos I took truly do not give the food justice but I highly recommend the shrimp Mac n cheese. It is on the appetizer section of the menu and is truly worth every penny! We were able to be sat on the balcony and it had such a great view looking down on Las Vegas Blvd. I am a local and don't understand why it took me so long to come to this location but I'm glad I did. Our waiter was very friendly and explained in depth the whole Forrest Gump correlation and how it worked with ordering, stop and go status. The food turnover time was great and I appreciated more than one server checking I on us whenever we had questions or refills. My SO had a burger with avocado, I can't think of the name, and it was great especially combined with their seasoned fries. For the price and the quality this meal was well worth it.

3tRtwHPq8eQP_IvcZE19AA.text: Trash - took 15 minutes to have our server make first contact. Daughter ordered water he brought sprite. Brought kids  drinks in adults glass. Server hustled $14 light beer - unknowingly was up-charging me for "commemorative" cup.  Food came out cold and sent it back. Manager only took off the food that I refused to eat. Better off hitting chili's down the street   1 meal and 2 kids meals 2 beers $79

jtDp1COICyZjIYWWIcrniA.text: Really good cocktails and fried shrimp. The fried fish was a little soggy and bland. Highly recommend trying the shrimp sampler. The coconut shrimp with the marmalade was mine and my wife's personal favorite.

WmWL3HieOyHH_CZ5L3Vo2g.text: great service. if you're looking for shrimp this is the spot! Po boy is a solid solid sandwich! shrimp n grits or also excellent.

5vNA3MkfPhx97E6-oxbANg.text: The service was great!  The food was very good and the drinks were delicious. The drinks are a little pricey but you get to keep the collectors glass when you are done. If it's a plastic glass they wash it and give it back to you. If it's a glass glass then you get a brand new one from the gift shop when you leave. The seafood hush puppies are amazing. We Weill return!!!

6f_gJLm9pUA1S_DCy__eGQ.text: We really enjoyed this restaurant.  We had good food and good service.  The only complaint I would give is being charged 15 dollars a beer and not letting us know the price. You get to keep the glass but what if you don't want the glass. I'm a bartender and I wouldn't just bring someone the larger size and asume they would want the glass. That's pretty rediculous.

OQkEtdrSoGL_etUG4V-3DA.text: Very mediocre food for being so pricey. A 2 person meal will run you about $90 for 2 entrees, appetizer and 1 drink each. We could've ate at a nice steak restaurant for that price. Also $15 for a cocktail that tasted watered down. I ordered the chicken. Nothing special about it. KFC style.

pQMPLWfeOIBymJED2Z9ZwA.text: Great location, glad this place is finally open.  As a single diner, I sat at the bar.  I ordered a shrimp po boy with the fries.  This sandwich was huge.  In fact, the sandwich was served open faced as it was so large. The shrimp is deep fried and good, though not great.  Could use some southern seasoning. The fries are just typical.  I figured, if I am going to get full eating this meal, I am taking down the sandwich and avoiding the fries. Glad I did, I was stuffed by the time I finished the sandwich.  My waiter/bartender was Korey. Very nice guy. Good service and friendly. After my meal, I took a walk around the restaurant.  Great decor of Forrest Gump memorabilia, as in all Bubba Gump restaurants.  Went out to the balcony and there is a nice view of the Strip.

a2e01LNKg8ZbrtCBVZ5gYQ.text: Delicious!!! Wow what an experience for a shrimp shack.  The food was awesome and fresh, had the shrimp spectacular and it was.  The waiter was super friendly and had a great personality made you feel welcome.    Really like the idea of flipping sign to show you are ready for stop or go.  Really good cocktails and you get a fee glass with purchase, it is a new one from the store:)   Atmosphere and noise level were perfect lots and lots if Forrest Gump memorabilia on the was and slogans.    Recommend to everyone who loves shrimp.

QI-ggyqKhw4s5buXP1U1EA.text: The staff was awesome and just that alone would make me come back, but the food was good too!  All of our dishes were very large so we had some to take home. I actually ordered the appetizer sampler so I could get the dip, spicy chicken, fried & chilled shrimp - all good. I split a gumbo with my husband, it had too much black pepper for my taste though. The cole slaw was really great, tasted so fresh.  I cant remember what my kids got but I do remember they were happy, they also got the light up specialty drinks which they were able to get refills for only a dollar unlike most places.  We got the little quiz on Forrest Gump (which we aced of course) & thought that little extra attention made it great as our waitress made it funny.  So if youre stuffy or serious then this isnt the place for you so go somewhere else & dont come here and whine!

vUCaqlXlLkm3dohsyh7Dsg.text: Yay i'm a fan is True. We were delighted to try this place was little taken back by the name didn't think the food would be great but it was. I am glad I loss the coin toss and ended up here.

8MqBX67g2VpxLXew7sl6iw.text: Came her on my fist visit to Vegas in February and I gotta say I expected waaaay better. I got the salmon and it was he worst. My fiance at the time now my husband, got the something (i cant remember) that was just as bad. Bad choice and wont visit again.

fGRdVujcEC0F2WPigscpfA.text: I read another review about this place, and went in with some friends. My guy ordered the fish and chips and it was absolutely the bomb. We walked around the strip with this place on the mind. So we came back and order more shrimp, fish and andouille sausage.

UIxp4uUHecJU8j1-4TZhkw.text: First time here, service was great as soon as we walked in the door. I had the Shrimp and Grits, very very good! Our server Rikki was very nice and attentive. I look forward to coming back.

qrQsac73lrYNYwuQBN3R2A.text: Got the steam crab and a bunch of other items on the menu. Service was good but meal was over cooked and barely got any crab out of it and our food was slow to arrive. When we told our server and made a complaint the manager was less than pleased to comp that portion on our $150 tab. ($30). Was very annoyed at management but servers were friendly and attentive. Probably won't go back. Joe's Crab Shack is a much better choice

0q5Ih1DWc1ZB2ndCKhrlRw.text: Me and my husband used to enjoy eating at Bubba Gump when we were in CA.  So when we find out that it's here in Vegas,  we were excited to dine in.  However,  we were disappointed coz the food is dry and the taste is not good.We felt that we didn't get what our money's worth. It's good that the server is very nice. - Ms. D Vegas

yWoRgQxf8KYvaKywFhLtvw.text: Great food and service!  Little pricey, but unique, tasty dishes.  We have always wanted to try them out and were pleasantly surprised.

9s_IW-cNfZC2rPJK4vetvA.text: We have been here a few times for food and beer. The service here has been consistently good, especially for a tourist strip place. The beer selection could be a bit broader but is satisfactory. We have tried several items on the menu, my wife likes the hush puppies, and everything has been good each time, again unusual for the casual dining places on the strip.

1kVtMQ8PG9EzvN7X1UMIlQ.text: Giving this 4 stars because my family really enjoyed the food.  We followed the server's recommendations and none of us were disappointed.  My daughter had the fish and my wife shrimp while I had the Jambalaya.  No complaints from anyone.  Service was excellent - we were actually served by a guy named 'Bubba'  :-).  A little of the pricey side though.

2foT3N15fIUCiBwkX-UCVQ.text: We went here for dinner as the sun was setting. We sat outside against the rail and had a pretty decent view of the strip as the lights were just starting to come on. I got the delicious shrimp heaven dish and I must of gotten and 30 shrimp (coconut, fried, tempura battered, shrimp cocktail, and fries)  I especially loved the coconut shrimp. We ordered the lava flow drinks in fun light up glasses which made for some fun pictures. Very good drinks, but way overpriced. The waitress even asked us some Forest Gump Trivia which just added to the experience. It's right next to the balcony of the goretorium bar and we saw some zombies taking a smoke break! Great time!

so88mwS9TGmhWk2NE3RM7Q.text: Ok so! It was my brother in laws 30th birthday and I had never been to this restaurant and was so excited to try it! It was freezing cold outside and the strip was so so busy! It took us forever to find a parking spot which is fine we grew up here in Vegas so we are used to it but then walking through the entire casino/strip in the freezing cold it took us a good 45 minutes to locate the restaurant from the car. We were so incredibly excited when we saw the sign and realized that we were so close to some yummy shrimp and I was so excited to try this restaurant that everyone raves about, although it wasn't on a pier I was still super excited. The restaurant was due to close at 1am and we got there at 12:25, we had called earlier that day and asked if getting there by 12:30 would be okay because my husbands shift was not over until 11:30. We got there and the greeters immediately. with no smile at all, said we are closed. I actually laughed because I thought she was joking when she said that they were closed. Her face did not change so I know she was serious and we had just wasted all of our time, I asked her I thought you guys don't close until 1? and we even called and whoever we spoke with said it would be fine. She said "yeah we decided to close early tonight" She literally looked satisfied with disappointing me. I work in customer service and this is not okay. You are a business, and at that a BRAND NEW business on the strip! You cant just decided to close early unless an emergency and she said nothing of the sort. I really just couldn't believe that had just happened. Disappointed and doing everything possible to keep my mouth shut and keep my anger inside, we just walked away. There was also a gentlemen there too and he said "Come back and see us again soon" and again I laughed! I had such a ad experience that I honestly would rather drive 5 hours to the one in Santa Monica then go to this one!

vEn7EM37EhgWXbrEpAwiRw.text: The food, service, and drinks were great! I loved the dish, Jenny's catch- the lobster sauce was out of this world and tilapia didn't taste fishy at all! The dish was recommended by the waitress whom was really nice to us as well! Great place on the strip! Has outdoor eating as well.

viVx7Zfr3pD2jm4IjjWqFA.text: Had a terrible experience at this place.  Prices are expected for strip... not extremely high.   First of all, I am the Front Office Manager of a major hotel.  I know service.  Our server was pretty good although our water stayed empty once we consumed.  Our issue was that someone from the kitchen delivered our two appetizers to the wrong table.  40 minutes later we asked where they were and they put this information together.   The manager came over and apologized for the delay and said he would personally bring them out when they were ready.  Not sure what that was supposed to do for us but he didn't personally bring them out anyway.   We decided not to order entrees after that debacle.  Our total bill was $74 (had 3 drinks, no biggie).  Asked manager to comp part of the bill for having to wait so long.  He told me, "I really can't do much for you, maybe a buck or two."  A buck or two?   Good service, bud.  Why would I go back to Bubba Gump?

V8UHinKqYta2MRyvCErjoA.text: The service was AWESOME!!!  The food was superb!!! We had the shrimp scampi, dumb luck coconut shrimp, and shrimp mac & cheese. Everything arrived promptly and tasted perfectly. I really recommend this place.  Our server was Lydia and she was extremely pleasant.

SUbrJVWva6OGA21iMD_F_w.text: The theme of Bubba Gump is from the Forrest Gump movie - our server told us to flip the sign to get other waiters/waitresses' attention, cute concept. Speaking of our server, BIG shout out to you, Shan! He gave us great recommendations for places to go, things to do in LV - so helpful, thank you! :)  MANGO SHAKER [No-alchy] So yummy! Since it was like a sauna outside, this drink was thrist-quenching. Tasted like a mango soda.  FORREST'S SEAFOOD FEAST (Hand Breaded Southern Fried Shrimp, Seafood Hush Pups, Fish & Chips) Loved the shrimp.. was very delicious - especially if you add the tartar sauce with it! (sauce boss here..)  SHRIMP + FISH + SKEWER [I can't remember the name they had on the menu -_-] The title says it all. The shrimps were once again marinated deliciously! Comparing the two mains that we've ordered, I'd prefer the fried foods :P

0kbsErVM90NXhcSeTiD8ww.text: Ok this review is based on dining by the bar and on one meal.  One meal we have each year and have tried at most Gump Restaurants in the US: the netcatch with Cajun and garlic.  There is only one way to have that dish- with garlic bread on the side. Peel em and layer them carefully on the bread.  Then dig in. It is the only way as I said and it is the Monica and Jonni way!   The waiter we had saw us doing this last year,  and he has adopted our style too! We met him this year too.   And those shrimps taste wonderfully. My favorite is garlic but always need a tasting of both.  So- two netcatch and garlic bread alla Monica and Jonni,  please!

PYF9FEc-7WYwf2zsBI0X6A.text: We came here for dinner since we wanted some seafood for dinner.  Parking was hard to find but that's everywhere along the strip.  The restaurant was easy to find thanks to Yelp.  Upon arriving at the restaurant the line was fairly long.  We just sat at the bar so we didn't have to wait to be seated.    Upon sitting the bartender was very knowledgeable of the menu and drinks came fairly quickly.  We ordered the Run Across America Sampler for our appetizer which included the Bubba's Far Out Dip and Chips, Chilled Peel 'n' Eat Shrimp, Spicy Chicken Strips, Seafood Hush Pups and Mama Blue's Fried Shrimp.  The Spicy Chicken Strips were great.  My girl liked the shrimp on the appetizer.  Overall, being from New Orleans I have had better fried shrimp.  For our entree, we ordered the Soup & Salad Combo which was a house salad with Gumbo and the Shrimp Po' Boy which consisted of a Fresh Toasted Baguette stuffed with warm, hand breaded  Shrimp, Tomatoes, Lettuce, Pickles & Mayo, Served with Fries.  The food came out quick and that was a huge plus saying that it was packed.   The food was ok.  The shrimp Po-Boy could have had more seasoning to make the food more enjoyable.  I have had better.  My lady didn't like her salad and she said the gumbo wasn't good.  Overall, this restaurant was ok.  Would have gave them a 1 if it wasn't for the service.  Probably wont be attending this restaurant again.

eMzjizc-9QX7CEIprvGRww.text: My partner is a huge Forrest Gump fan so I knew I had to take him to this place! I was a little worried looking at the reviews, but I had nothing to worry about!   The service was great and fast. We ordered the popcorn shrimp, shrimp salad and the shrimpers heaven. Everything was cooked to absolute perfection!   Next time we'll definitely just order a heap of the coconut shrimp and we done with it!   Expensive but tasty, not a complaint of the entire meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nYtcBfpiSpOvcNDkrESzcw.text: Worst service. Never greeted by any server. The manager was completely incompetent. I told the manager and the person who wasn't our server but helped us that we did not receive the same service as everyone else and nothing was done about it. The manager continued to make up things about his servers and food when we told him we were told completely different. Very disappointed if on the strip don't go here. I have been to ones in South Padre and Florida and they are great.

CAvUBPYCNPTZxHtylg3NEQ.text: Had Shandi as our server and  she was great! We did the trivia game which was actually fun. We never went without drinks and our food was actually really delicious. I got my usual Shrimp New Orleans and the spice to it was perfect.   We got a chance to talk with one of the managers. His name was Matt. He was very personable and gave us great tips for shows and places to get massages. Overall we enjoyed our visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The go to sign!

nLIAAaBdrM4kv61kAQ_MkQ.text: We came here4 for lunch & just love Bubba Gump's.  Our waitress, Eva, was very friendly & attentive.  I had the appetizer sampler with chicken strips, hush puppies, cajon shrimp, spinach dip, & tortilla chips.  The chicken strips are tender with a lite badder, the hush puppies have the right corn meel badder to shrimp ratio, the cajon shrimp have a kick, & the spinach dip is cheesy spinachy goodness with fresh tortilla chips.  For dessert, the bread pudding is a great way yo go with soft bread & a warm filling.  Round it off with a Long Island & you will not be disappointed.  My mother, aunt, & uncle enjoyed their food & drinks alike.  My uncle even got a free glass which he loved.  I loved the upbeat atmosphere & mix of pop music going.  So, for wonderfulo southern fare with friendly service in a casual upbeat atmosphere, Bubba Gump's cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.

df4h-M-eBQJN52d1k1xphA.text: First time for me and my dining partner. No waiting for a table at 6 pm on a Tuesday evening. Service was prompt and the waitress was patient with our orders. She offered a few drink suggestions to my partner, one of which was taken. Turned out to be a good choice. We both had the gumbo shrimp soup and shared an cheese dip with shrimp as an appetizer. The dip was very good with lots of shrimp pieces. The soup was appropriately spicy and filling. A good meal for $63.

cfhXgU72vSGbDiOAYXyneQ.text: Came here for dinner and ordered the heavenly shrimp and it was just okay nothing to really write home about! The service was okay, our waiter had a really thick accent so it was hard to understand what she was saying at times. The food was okay it was just your normal fried shrimp and fries. I wasn't all that impressed!

zhFUUx6vim0BXiwcW9bBug.text: We are celiac, there was not a large list of options. We ordered the salmon and the shrimp and flounder over rice. Let me tell you.. it was amazing!.. good portions and tasty. Was pleasantly suprised !.. would definitely recommend !

ienAdM_URvd-8lk9yF8X2w.text: We've eaten here a couple times when in Vegas and this last time was the best.  We had Forrest's Seafood Feast and the New Orleans Shrimp.  The New Orleans Shrimp is best if you mix everything up into the sauce when you get it.  The pineapple margarita was great and they give you a shaker to keep re-filling so it makes 3 margaritas total.  Service was great and we were seated right away for a Thursday evening dinner.

h20-o3E5y1o7TU8jtT0ROg.text: I am giving them 1 star because I have to give a star. This was the WORST service I have ever experienced at a restaurant. The service started out good but was progressively slower and slower and one of party didn't get his food for 20 minutes after the rest of us were served (we had to wait 5 minutes after we were served for someone to "stop, forest, stop" at the table so we could inquire. The appetizers were good and my garden salad was fresh and very tasty. I had the coconut shrimp and I enjoyed it very much. 3 of the others in our party had a sampler of shrimp (I don't know the name of the exact dish). The tempura battered shrimp was soggy and tasteless and went uneaten. They reported (I didn't taste it) the seasoned shrimp was over seasoned and cold but the grilled shrimp in the plate was excellent.   Drinks were VERY SLOW to come out from the bar. One of our party ordered a whiskey based drink and felt the whiskey taste was too strong. Several of us ordered top shelf margaritas and they were okay, but didn't taste too shelf. The plastic shaker they were in leaked and our hands were sticky, so the design wasn't good. 2 members got a "free" cup with their drink, but it wasn't explained they had to take their receipt to the lobby to get it, so that took time waiting for the cup that wasn't coming (check your bag they hand you if you get this because one of the gals only got the shaker lid and not the actual cup.   Our main complaint was that management didn't seem to care about the "missing in action" food and wasn't proactive in letting us know it was being taken care of. When we complained, management (?) sent us a beautiful complimentary dessert tray. Unfortunately we had already said we did not want dessert. We really wanted our check and to leave because we had been there for so long. It took forever to get the checks (the checks were split. I honestly don't know if the server was told when we placed orders we wanted to split the checks and I understand it takes longer to do that after the fact, but 30 minutes? We were sitting outside freezing. It took a good 40-45 minutes from the time we said no dessert to the time we got our checks and got out of there. I believe they took an appetizer off of someone's bill and took something else off another persons bill (I don't know what).  The "missing meal" should have been free and a free appetizer and no dessert should have been sent (a nice gesture but we honestly wanted to leave and it just extended the time we were sitting there waiting for the checks, so it wasn't something that made the situation better, unfortunately).  Food was generally decent, drinks were overpriced for what you got but the service killed the experience. The "run forest run/stop forest stop" plaques sitting at the table that indicate to servers and management something is needed did NOT seem to help in getting service. The concept that if ANY team member sees the "stop forest stop" at ANY table, they stop and ask what is needed is a great concept and I have eaten at other locations where the service was excellent using this model. Perhaps it was an off night or they were short staffed, but the service failed miserably as did managements handling of the situation.

Z-GGnphld-oFP0V6GkZJ9Q.text: First time trying this place, was kind of skeptical at first but I had such a good time! From the trivia game to the "free" cup, I can say that I will be going back! We had Charles & Rey as our servers and we couldn't be any happier! They were attentive and they answered all our questions. Will be going back for the food and the staff!

BtLqf-9W5XBUByl6hxTY7g.text: Food was pretty good.    Service was okay.    My 20oz Bud Light was $13.72???????? WTF?!?!?

UmIuP6XPb_uk17n4kQF69A.text: If I could give ZERO STARS, I would. If you absolutely love seasoned salt (I mean not being able to discern fries from seafood by the taste), this is the place for you. I was wondering why this place had no line/no wait on New Years Eve! I found out after the first bite. This place is the worst. The service is really sad as well. You literally have to wave down people to get their attention. This place can be compared to a franchise Applebee's at best! Save your time and money and stay away from here!

askZjAMkDZ-GPHGqcIPWLg.text: Seafood is pretty fresh.  Food here is just as delicious as the one in the bay area. Drinks are yummy and with enough alcohol.  The thing that I loved the best was that we were able to keep the cool glasses that our drinks came in.  They were replaced by brand new ones of course.  Service was very good as well.

WNw9mBuqcBkfhwnSTOaMLg.text: I had the best experience at Bubba Gumps with some of my friends!!! The food was amazing and the drinks were great!!! It's not cheap but the experience makes up for it!   We had an amazing server (Lexi PLEASE request her!!!) and she made us feel so welcomed!!! I'm living in Vegas and this place was very comforting!!! The view of you are by the window is great and the Forrest Gump trivia is hilarious!!! I loved it here and will definitely go here again!! Especially if Lexi is there!!! :-D

O3ej1htB5vzQ_3UkciBndg.text: Food is just so, so. Service was good. Chain restaurant food that is just nothing special. It tastes and looks the same wherever you find this restaurant.

-Tia20lFHPwuLgB4tQgicQ.text: This is our 3rd time going to this place and it never lets us down. The food is good, the drinks are little pricey but you get a souvenir cup with most of them. Love the atmosphere and the staff. On our firs trip the manager himself came and helped us when we had a question. This most recent time we went, we seen the manager actually pick up the broom help really quick. great place!

pHmg09ycvy6tNt0DAp01UA.text: Excellent food, quick and friendly service! Those combinations always make for a great lunch stop.

yQDVDlQ6y-f8Go2CLut7vQ.text: We had two very good meals here.  Yes it is a Landry's chain and as you would expect chain restaurant food but its still good.  We had one rather rude server the first night but everyone else was outstanding.   The bucket of Boat Trash with crab clusters, shrimp and fish with cajun seasoning was amazing..  Nothing tasted fishy.  Service was fast and the food came out hot.  Only other glitch was food runners brought out the food and apparently did not look at the ticket as we had to ask our waiter about my meal but he got it for us right away and it was still hot and fresh.

wHNv7Yx1-cHX7gn35TvS-g.text: Pricing wasn't bad at all for a strip side seat watching above the blvd. Shrimp (of course) was great, Sampled all of them (I think)...Good mixed drinks, with a lot of their creations. On the sweet side, but alcohol that tastes like candy is really good when you've been drinking ETOH like H2O...Calamari was unique with fried peppers, jalapeno, and some other stuff in it. Super service, great ambience, and everything was a la Forrest Gump...Fun place that wont brake ya!

GJab5cC1KiSbfrIyrJGT2w.text: What can I say about "Bubba Shrimp Co", we had a good time but the food was just okay, I had never eaten there before and wanted to try it out, it was just okay, nothing to write home about...  I know its a big chain restaurant but I was expecting a little more out of the food...

WAZtpM-tL3DeAWWy--2ZeA.text: Had it not been for the amazing customer service, this place would have had three or four stars. However, our server Carlos earned them a top rating.   I don't eat shellfish of any kind. But my husband was craving shrimp and we'd been wanting to check this place out since the "coming soon" sign first appeared. I wish they had more variety to choose from for non-shellfish eaters. But our server not only made suggestions of what I could eat, he went out of his way to modify one of the dishes for me, making sure to substitute the sauce for one that wasn't shellfish-based. The food itself was pretty tasty, but nothing extraordinary. If it wasn't for the best customer service Vegas has to offer, we would keep this on our "maybe return to" list. But it will definitely be one of our go-to spots now.

R5hddE1TmzvXfVeXtQvMgA.text: Average food. Average presentation.  Good service. No wow factor. And overpriced. I would consider this a strip tourist destination. No return trip for me.

sMHFWxDfQ8lxRTtBc0z9xg.text: the food is good, & the service is EXCELLENT! our server stephen went above and beyond his job!! HE kept us entertain while waiting for our food to arrive...(which didn't take that long)   it's my mom's birthday.. aside from the desert we ordered, they gave us something on the house too as well!!   the manager checked in on us if we are having  a good time. I'm telling you guys, if you want a good food, and service matters to you. check this place out! it's awesome!

7nA9s4N8uSzj6ckVaO4XSA.text: I was disappointed.   My shrimp showed signs of freezer burn.  Not up to the standard i expect from Bubba Gump.

xGNxGv35tacTIWdz0kodww.text: The badest Bubba restaurant I were.  Dry and tasteless fish and shrimp were which too much lemon. The garlic bread was not crunchy. It was just soft.

d89vfIJwaV9O5lc7jIy_lg.text: 2.5 stars. Similar to the Orlando location but more spacious which gives it more of a cafeteria look and feel. While their food can be fun to eat, they fall short on healthy choices at all locations, so not unique to this one. Doubt we will be going back because of that. But if you like fried stuff and are looking for a low key place, it's not bad.

GTxgocOfr5-WgtA3wnRjRQ.text: I try to avoid eating at chains while on vacation, but I was in the mood for shrimp for some reason.  No wait. Awesome server who also worked in the bar. Ordered the Coronita Rita. It was so good. Not a fan of the sweetness of margaritas, but the mini Corona really balances out the sweetness. I ended up having 2 of them. Ordered the shrimp New Orleans. Thought it was delicious. Almost went back again during the trip

M0CwxpHojUyV9tmGcv055g.text: I really like the SF one, the service was boring and the salads were bland. Won't be coming back

cEoQDndlzwkrncr_zErpjg.text: Can I say delicious?? I love bubba gumps got to treat my fiance out last night. I'm the beginning the service was a tad bit slow. But we had a certain waiter that would talk with us and ask trivia questions about the movie. Kinda pricey but still worth it

may9IJe9q1PwkUu9uVcEcQ.text: I would give this place zero stars if possible. Very first night in Vegas we stopped in this place. Hostess was incredibly rude, just dumped us off at a table without saying anything at all. Apparently she never told anyone she seated us. No one came to get our order for 15 minutes. Then a waiter who was not ours finally came up and said he saw us just sitting there so he came to take our order. We told him how long we had been waiting and he said he would get the manager. Waited 10 more minutes and still no one showed up. No manager. No drinks. Nothing. They were not even busy. We left without anyone ever acknowledging we were there. Worst restaurant experience of my life. Would not recommend to anyone.

HlvdDq9aA69RCBMfz2rAew.text: Before going to Bubba Gump, we read reviews to see how the food and service was. There were all sorts of reviews from five stars to one. We decided to go for it and we went. We sat on the balcony over looking the Las Vegas strip. Our server Charles attended to us. We had a great time and the food was delicious. We plan to go again in the near future. Don't forget to ask for Charles

MNImpfPYXFzej50rJx0GfQ.text: This place gets a one star and the number 1 reason is because the hostes/manager Sarah. She was extremely rude and disrespectful. She did no care about our service and basically denied our service into this restaurant. I am a visitor here and I never dealt with such foolishness and disrespect. Beware of her. As the face of this restaurant she is awful and mean.

FRj4lqnphAMhw4lpWwUH-A.text: Ate at this location for the second time last night. This time we sat on the patio overlooking the Strip and City Center. Terrific view, perfect weather. Our server, Bobby?, was very friendly, attentive and helpful as well as being very knowledgeable with the menu. My wife wanted to upgrade part of her entree to crab legs and Bobby didn't know what the upcharge would be so he checked with the manager. In a few minutes the manager, Bud, came personally to let us know that the upcharge for that would bring the dish to almost $40 and asked if we she still wanted to upgrade it.  We thought it was very thoughtful and considerate of him to come over and let us know personally.

XQW7DBtOkolBaGDQ3hjJjQ.text: Chains aren't my favorite travel experience, but my SO lives Forrest Gump. The food is always good, not life changing, but reliably decent. Our service in Vegas was perfect, the food was fast, and the decor keeps fans amused.

JiYwTXgBz37Q__tEREFJqQ.text: The food was just what you expect from a Bubba Gumps, but what was really great about this location was the service. I had one of the best waiters I have ever had! Hopefully all the staff is like him. Quick service as well.

1ZmtGFVgq4WslQ-nLMLE_Q.text: I have experienced better but it was at the Chicago location..maybe because this one is located on the strip they assume people are just drunk and hungover so they will eat anything.. for the most part that is accurate. Especially if they have been smoking cigarettes butt to butt ("butt to butt" sounds funnier than "chain smoking") all night..  I ordered the Cajun shrimp with Garlic toast..super buttery and garlicky and you could tell the shrimp was frozen. My mom got the grilled fish sandwich.. and frowned the WHOLE TIME.. I knew it was over when she asked for tartar sauce..  The server was great.. she kept calling me "baby" though and I don't know how I feel about that.. I'M A GROWN A** WOMAN.. just kidding..but it did get a little annoying..She was prompt and courteous though.

oH5ZdHWVhEfxcTsw44fBVQ.text: Terrible. Terrible. Terrible.   My friends and I went here on our first night in Vegas and were starved for just about anything. We got seated quickly, which was nice but that was probably the only pleasant part of this dining experience.   My friend is on a pretty strict diet and asked if a certain dish could be made without butter, the server said she would go and ask and that was the last we saw of her. The next thing we know the runners were bringing us our food and the dish that she asked for without butter looked like it was drenched in it. We asked if we could ask the manager or anyone if there was butter on it and it took about 30 minutes before we got any kind of answer.  Finally, the manager came over and assured us it wasn't so she began to eat it. About 10 minutes later she came back and said it actually was made with butter.  By this time everyone else was done with their meals. All in all it was a headache of an experience and was handled terribly by the staff.

GjFfkzrnT9M8AEPkUknLWA.text: Great location, great shrimp, horrible service, and horrible management. We waited 15 minutes after being sat then asked to be waited on. The food was served fast after it was ordered. The waitress never came back. After 45 minutes and asking 3 different wait staff, we asked to speak to a manager.  He couldn't find our bill. Finally the waitress came with a $250 check.  Our bill should have been $70. Finally they fixed it with no apologies or even discount. It totally ruined our night!

9selbqUl2hsQ3xcalfFYKA.text: Had a wonderful time. We were seated right away, my son picked outside. Nice view of the strip. Our waiter was very attentive and the food was amazing! Very family friendly.

9WfVnkrvAUVbhzgkrLC5HA.text: This place has a great atmosphere and when you sit outside you have a nice view of the strip. The food isnt anything spectacular and the service was lacking. I probably wouldnt return but I am glad i checked the place out.

k-VEggFYv2XWG6-MDy-JUw.text: Honestly not good at all. Was cold when I got it and didn't taste good at all. Everything is fried and the batter isn't even good. Won't be going to Bubba Gump's again any time soon.

4rIcuV7X9EX5E1-wG18cMQ.text: Today I have to give it 2 stars due to our rude waitress. When we first got there our menus were just dropped off at the table and told our waitress would be with us. Once the waitress arrived she attempted to rush us on our drink order we stated we were not ready she walked away came back asking are you ready now? Drinks were ordered and appetizers too I ordered a dip and my friend did too. Drinks come and appetizers too by a different server who brings us out two of the same appetizers. So we stated that we didn't order two of the same things. She states that ok no problem and then our waitress comes up to us and says rudely "Didn't you order the dip that you sent back" We attempted to tell her that we didn't want two of the same appetizers and she walked off with a attitude and service went down from there. We had to ask for togo boxes and the check from someone else due to the fact we couldn't find her again. Once the the check came she split the tab which was not asked if we wanted it that way. So now we had to wait for another receipt to be printed before leaving. I love this place but today was not the best.

VnCwfabzNUir1I9zJwUtRQ.text: I had the stuffed shrimp and my mom had the New Orleans shrimp. Our meal was fabulous with a great view of the strip outside. Got the Raspberry smoothie and it was delightful! Great meal and service!

UKEdHCkeHsUGEWMH7mNjug.text: Tonight's visit was a 10+ our server Jessie L was definitely on it he checked on us so many times during the meal I almost offered him a seat at the table. Waters and drinks were refilled quickly. The food came quick and everything was prepared perfect. Without a doubt one of the best dining experiences I've ever had at Bubba Gump.

WJ2QwJ6485zDDFAVI6P--A.text: Messed up our appetizer, messed up my husband's meal then they got my meal wrong too. We are easy to please folks who just wanted some lunch. After waiting 2 hours, we left w a bag of to-go food as we couldn't wait any longer. $50 for 2 lunch entrees (we had an appetizer coupon). The manager was trying to calm down the table of 9 next to us who had gotten their orders screwed up too. I'd pick somewhere else next time.

TBQC1xvUS-Yc7clRgUi3Mw.text: This was my first and will very likely be the last time to Bubba Gump Shrimp. This chain restaurant was so well-known that some friends and I stopped here for dinner as soon as we found it without a second thought. But it turned out to be a great disappointment, as the food was not that delicious and was unreasonably expensive. It was so ridiculous that the Shrimper's Heaven only had a few shrimps on the top with the rest of the boxes filled with french fries! If you're a big fan of Forrest Gump, then this would be an interesting restaurant for you. But if you're not, then perhaps it's better to make another wise choice.

ZTIASwjM4cxAy9lVfKGgXg.text: I went in with family on Thursday. We parked at Planet Hollywood, took about 10 minutes to walk to the restaurant. The lower level is the gift shop which you have to walk thru to get up to the restaurant (of course). There's a patio with the view of the strip which was pretty nice and the waiter was good. The appetizer was awesome, we ordered the bubba far out dip (tortilla chips & spinach roasted bell pepper, artichoke and jack cheese). We had the seafood trio and surf & turf entrees, both dishes were too salty and the steak was a little overcooked. The fizzy fun and frozen lemon-ups beverages were awesome and we got to keep the glass. Overall, for the price we paid, we were disappointed and expected more. Will I go back? Probably not!

zK1n2Ibh4NNiZ-5PzqjUGQ.text: If you love shrimp you have to come to bubba Gump it is tender the calamri isn't chewy the seasoning is perfect and dipping sauce to die for all the flavors work so well together and service is awesome had the shriper's heaven and for appetizer the fried calamari and popcorn shrimp spices are great and the coconut shrimp red lobster could definitely learn a thing or two a must go when I come back to Vegas again

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimpers heaven and appetizers
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bubbas blue hawaiian is a must! So good it reminds me of a refreshing walk on the beach

MJwerTeAetAcXeQZiUZT9Q.text: There are a ton of places to eat in Vegas, Bubba Gump happened to be on our list because they have an outside balcony patio that we could sit at and look over the strip and my sister has never been here before. When we first got here the customer service was fantastic, everyone is smiling as they greet you and show you the way to be seated. After hiking up some stairs and walking for a bit, alas the hostess to seat us! We were sat within 5 minutes and greeted by our waiter. The drinks here are WAY over priced and the food was bleh....... the drinks were very weak and cost us about $16 each for one regular mixed drink in a regular sized glass, a beer was $13...... ouch! The food was very bland and just...... well bleh. No taste, no flavor, no yummy to it at all. I remembered the Bubba Gump in SF being WAY BETTER! Definitely disappointed in this visit. Along with the cheap food and expensive drinks came panic at the end of our meal. I paid with a $100 bill and made sure I told the waitress it was a $100 bill, she brought be back change as if I paid with a $50, then disappeared. After talking to 2 other waiters, they finally found my original waitress and she pulled the rest of my change out of her coin purse, her actual personal coin purse and said "oh im sorry I must have counted that wrong, let me get you change from my tips" its ok to miscount money I understand, but why would you have put it in your personal bag and not in the cash register, and why would you be paying me back in your tips!??? I didn't say keep the change and leave you a large tip..... so why wasn't I given exact change? So that was weird and not fun, the whole dinner was just disappointing, time consuming (for service was super slow) and having to hunt for my money back is just a pain.  Spend your money and time somewhere else!

kkADbRxw_2GkxVeYkUFT2g.text: Drowsy.com . . . Nothing to brag about here folks. This is your sub standard chain restaurant. The hostess was rude. I had to speak to him twice before he acknowledged our party of 6 standing at the hostess stand. I ordered the Alabama steampot. My potatoes we undercooked, shrimp was over cooked, and apparently Cajun means dump paprika all over the food but no salt. Blah. Save your time, money and calories. Not worth it.

LHK7Ov6-sQxM_MojcFGEAQ.text: Stopped by here for dinner after a long flight. Have heard about it but never been. I ordered the dish with 4 different shrimps and a margarita. Enjoyed the shrimps and like the concept. They have nice belcony seating overlooking the Strip. Service was fast and they dont hassle you. They come when you want them to. A bit pricey. Food - 5 Service - 5 Atmosphere - 5 Value/Price - 3

fujn9YynSY-edL3s1Iac3g.text: My wife and I hag dinner on Sunday night. Food was good. We sat outside on the balcony facing Las Vegas boulevard and the view was amazing. Service was fast and courteous. It's a good place to eat. Nothing different from other Bubba Gump restaurants. Same menu. I order a burger I was so hungry after running a. Half marathon and it was very good. Will come back mostly for the view.

sJYoKL1JwGO_OUHPClm8yg.text: Great place to eat while in Vegas! It's affordable, service is fun, and the food is pretty good for what it is!  I recommend coming here before the turn up! Go for their popular sampler which has fries, shrimp, and these hush puppy type fried balls. It's legit for $18.

kpHW4WElfIxTZHYdTy7Csg.text: I've been a big fan of Bubba Gump's ever since I was introduced to their location in San Francisco and ate there a few times. So when my hubby brought me to Las Vegas for our first wedding Anniversary, and for my first time ever in Las Vegas, we debated a TON on what to have for dinner. As we ventured out on our night which he had decided on walking around and eating to wherever calls us...he said..."Hey, there's a Bubba Gump's here!" I look over to see he's on Yelp!  I said, "You know what, I could go for some Gump's!" And away we went! The line was non existent and the restaurant had some open tables. We were behind a larger group, both of us asking for outdoor seating... Without asking if we wanted to wait, we were immediately sat in the dining room while the larger group was taken outside. When we arrived at our table I asked the host, "Um, was there no seats outside?"  He said "There's a ten minute wait."  Ok whatever... We just took the booth.  Our waitress came quickly and was great the entire night! My hubby ordered the Burger and I ordered the bucket of seafood at Market Price. Food came fast and my bucket of seafood was amazing and so was the extra garlic bread we ordered. We love this place so I know we'll be back.

5zlB0RnbT-7N-6Usgf2kdg.text: Always has great shrimp but the reason I'm giving this 5 stars is our waiter. I believe his name was Charles or Charlie? He was an Asian guy. I want to be specific because he was absolutely fantastic. I wish I remembered his name because it was some of the best customer service. He checked in frequently, very nice, seemed nervous, and very apologetic when he forgot something or the wait. I payed with a gift card from my work that covered my meal but I wasn't able to tip. I didn't have cash and he didn't take my card. We tried waiting there for at least 15-20 min, we asked someone if they could find him, but after a while we left. If anyone sees this and knows who I'm talking about, I'm so sorry. You deserved the best tip. Thank you so much. You were fantastic. If we ever come back I hope you're our waiter again.

mZOZpDDYDShThLPLdcMFtw.text: If you ever wonder what Forest Gump did after his military tour you need to check this place out. Interestingly quirky with license plates with "Run Forrest Run" or "Stop Forrest!" that you show to get the waiter's attention.   Gulf coast style cuisine with more types of shrimp than I knew existed. Tasty food with eye appeal that is served hot. Large assortment of alcoholic drinks to chose from.

uRYwOOiHmVk1HPNds82G4w.text: Should have known better and to eat at a bad chain when surrounded by all the great restaurants on the strip. Food basically had no flavor and was over cooked. I didn't even finish half of the plate. Server we had was a very nice guy and they all seemed to be working hard and trying to satisfy customers. Not sure what the issue is with the food but do your self a favor and if you go, know the history of the Tom Hanks movie so you can answer questions in their trivia. Just order drinks as they were good.

fIZNOlMsWzZFc9rXf5KIfA.text: Forrest Gump is one of my favorite movies so I was so excited to come here!   To sum up in a word: disappointed. The food had no flavor whatsoever. I think I added the entire salt shaker to the bucket of shrimp we got. It's "spiciness" is comparable to celery. Also, my brother got the seafood pasta. Waaay too overpriced. The wait was pretty long too.  One star because our waitress was nice.

Ed7zjp_00KmuxjwrLJLvCQ.text: My family and I were greeted by the hostess and seated immediately (there was no wait, which was a plus because we were very hungry after a long morning exploring the Strip). Our waiter was very friendly. He took our orders and our food came quickly. We ordered the Accidental Fish & Shrimp, Net Catch Entree, and an extra order of fries. The food was tasty but the portions were a bit light for the amount of money you pay. As we were leaving the employee in the gift shop was also very nice. He asked us how we enjoyed our meal and made small talk with our family. So great customer service there as well.  As far as the establishment, the  it was clean, including the restrooms. Overall we had a great experience here and look forward to returning.

ud0_7v5q8Nw5Hf9RuUSynw.text: OK Just We had a very mediocre meal, maybe we expected too much! Staff friendly. Unfortunately would not be returning! June 2016

z_bx63LDXxF9l-bWUzNxMw.text: Went during lunch so it wasn't crowded at all. The food was fresh but the service was slow and terrible.

-nuVBm5IMpJyU8Da11rIrg.text: Came here after getting in late on a delayed flight. Talk about somebody being hungry. My friend wanted seafood and Bubba Gump Shrimp takes their last guest at 10 pm. So it was late when we went around 8:30-ish pm. Patrick our server was very nice and informative. I ordered the gumbo which was very good but has a nice spicy kick to it. Next, I ordered the coconut shrimp meal. Shrimp was very good, but honestly, I was full off the gumbo. So most of the shrimp back to the room with me. The leftover shrimp made for a good breakfast the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dr0wMG7k0TG8gV72CG_0Tw.text: We were nearby and decided to try out Bubba Gump's for dinner.    The dining area is located one level up from the entrance filled with memorabilia and gift items.  We were luckily seated in Chad's section for our meal.   He definitely provided great service throughout the evening.  He was fun and very friendly.    We started off with the Seafood hush pups that are filled with shrimp and fish.  Since we love hush puppies, this was right up our alley.   Very good with the remoulade dipping sauce.  For my entree I chose Jenny's catch.  This was seared tilapia over mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach covered with a lobster butter sauce.   Sounds good right? But it really lacked flavor.  The sauce was very mediocre.      I tried my husbands meal which was Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp.  This was lots of shrimp mixed in with andouille sausage in a bourbon sauce.  This was fantastic.  Spicy and so delicious!  If it wasn't for Chad, this would probably be rated 3 stars.  But I was so impressed with the service and most of our food, I had to go with 4.  If you are in the area...  try it out!

QPxr4QgWxqBENxpg6BlPRA.text: Stop Forrest, stop. I have somehow amassed a ridiculous amount of Bubba Gump glassware over the years. My one goal going in here was to leave without another one.   If they can train a bit more and improve on their accuracy, I know this place could move up to a 4 or 5 star.  My daughter insisted that we dine here, so she could get their hush pups. We were seated instantly. Most importantly and first thing, my daughter excitedly requested hush pups.  I selected a glass of Pinot Grigio for $8 and my daughter wanted to try the Blue Hawaiian at $15. Average drink prices for the strip.   After our drinks arrived, we made our dinner selections. We were told our hush pups would be out shortly.   Our food was served after awhile, still no hush pups.  Our server apologized and said our pups went to the wrong table and they would make some more. At that point, I wanted to cancel them but my daughters puppy dog eyes wouldn't let me.   My clam chowder was pretty good, served with a very basic green salad. My daughter said her shrimp po boy was average.   A server tried to deliver some sort of shrimp tower to our table that we didn't order.   Stop Forrest, stop.  Then, after another 10 minutes or so, our hush pups landed. My daughter was full from her drink + dinner, she ate...  one. It was gummy inside. Sigh.  No offer to take it off the bill for us.   We were handed a receipt and told to turn it in downstairs for a souvenir glass. Oi

xJ0Ir0lS6F39Qqcw9IPNZA.text: If you want a good experience, avoid Bubba Gump Shrimp. Terrible experience with a poor management team. Our server Jon was wonderful and did as much as he could possibly do within his authority. Unfortunately, the managers Bud and Dennis were awful. I'm writing corporate tomorrow.

fEbKMYdVHbXzKJjArQsj0A.text: This is my favorite seafood restaurant! Good service good food and a friendly atmosphere. Highly recommend this place for the family. And shrimp Louie is amazing!

67xvx9ujkwPm6_7nwCb1sQ.text: This is not a great local business. I don't even know where to start. Let me see was it the 2 hour wait just to get water? Or the waiter that was in a super rush to EVERYWHERE he went (except our table), or was it the fact that he yelled in my daughter's ear with disgust "IS EVERYONE READY TO ORDER"...um excuse me dude we've been sitting here for 2.5 hours really you are lucky we were actually hungry and didn't get up and walk out!!! I am such a hopeful when it comes to dining out. I wait for the opportunity for the staff to help turn the experience around...which didn't happen. I ordered a Mahi plate and my food was cold. We never got refills on our drinks until we were about to pack up and leave and not one apology for the wait. Not a place for locals (which I am). Parking sucks and my handicapped father, who can't walk extremely long distances, wanted to eat at Joe's Crab Shack, that is no longer in business so we thought Bubba Gump would be an awesome replacement. Wrong again. Won't be going here ever in life...oh and did I mention that parking sucks and you have to walk dang near a mile to get to the restaurant from the parking garage. Ridiculous

eIPg3n81N72EZ8MI4IjsCg.text: We decided to stop by becuz we were craving seafood. Since we were walking around the strip, we had our drinks with us (just like everyone else lol) When we walked in the bubba gumps, the hostess told us we couldn't walk in with our drinks. We told her "really? But we're in Vegas & everyone has drinks!" She said that's policy. We asked to speak to a manager & when he came out he right away said sorry we can't let you in with drinks. I said it was ridiculous & i guess we'll take our business elsewhere. He just said...ok thank you! The customer service  (or the lack of) is the worst ever! We are in Vegas after all & the fact that they wouldn't accommodate us was unacceptable! We will definitely not ever go back to any Bubba Gumps again! I wanted to rate them with zero stars but had to give them at least one. Soo disappointed!

6vuUGmYEdIeEmv_2Tb9x4g.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!  We were out one night on the strip and needed some place to eat. In our family we are all fans of seafood. I am personally a fan of Forrest Gump so this was a natural choice. As you walk in there is movie memorabilia everywhere. It makes you feel as though the events, and characters in the movie are real. It's a lot of fun. They have an awesome balcony area that overlooks the strip, or you can dine inside. Everything as far as food is fantastic. I can't elaborate on it too much because their really isn't any other way to put it. We were very pleased with everything. The service was awesome. Everyone involved was super friendly and attentive. One thing that we loved about this restaurant was that they have a little sign that you can flip when you need service. Then anyone walking by will stop and help you. It's awesome and super efficient.

Zdp8nltHGv80FrvPE24_wg.text: The bartender served us a hard as a brick bun (you can hear the hardness when you tap it with a knife and when you run your fork over the inside of the bun) for the mushroom burger. I demonstrated how hard the bun was since the bartender didn't know what to say or do. I stated I'm hungry now and she wanted to take the burger back versus having the manager come over or put in another order.  Given my condition, I need to eat now not later. I told the bartender I'll just got somewhere else to eat.   Well my partner stopped eating so we can get something else to eat. I wanted to leave (and did leave) everything else unfinished so I can go. Our entire order was this awful mushroom burger, water (for 1 person although we asked for water for starters), an adult beverage (the bartender had to make two different once but they still wasn't good) and calamari. We asked to speak to the manager and Bud, shift manager or whatever he is, waltzed over and with a nasty attitude and said we have to pay for the unfinished items versus offer a solution. Bud claimed him and the chef were sitting and watching us. They didn't proactively intervene.   Forget customer satisfaction or service, we paid for the unfinished items cash (surprise surprise Bud we had money for our meal and then some) and walked out. Matt Stensrude, general manager, needs to work with their poorly trained chef, unskilled/inexperienced bartender and definitely Bud with his customer service, managerial skills. I hope they are happy with this $23.56 cash they got for poor service and awful food; I knew Bubba Gump restaurants to be so hard up for cash to treat us as such. No tip for poor service and food!   This location will not receive another penny from me and I generally love Bubba Gump restaurants; I have been to several from Hawaii, NYC to Miami plus a few in between. This place and the management sucks to no end!

BJiisYZ3aQ5mq6mGTLPBjQ.text: No bueno.  A waitress put her finger in my daughters drink to get something out of it.  Then a customer complained about it.  Caused a scene.  Yet I was still charge for BOTH soft drinks.  The table next to us were so disgusted by what they saw that they wouldn't eat.    I heart bubba Gump and what it stands for.  But this was awful.
