-4xr0KqtwFIogE4SNv7oHg.text: There is a True lack of customer service and tact at this restaurant.   We had an issue and asked to speak to a manager. Bud Koelle came to our table. We were using our golden nugget comps from Atlantic City. He said the system was unable to process the transaction.   I asked if he could call the property.  His comment was "I can't and won't call Atlantic City" I said you don't need to be rude. He said I'm not being rude you are rude.  I said wow so you insult your guest also. I handed him my credit card.   I noticed Bud Koelle copying information from my credit card.  I confronted him about this he said he was writing my name down I asked for my card back and he said he had not run the card yet.  It seems to be a security risk when an employee copies information from your credit card.   I have no clue what he was writing down.     I received a one question survey and comment box about my visit in an email.  I was truthful in my survey and received a phone call from the restaurant Asking me to change my score.  I was told that my score was based on my server and not management.   I was told that if I didn't change my score my survey would go into the servers file even though I had no issue with the server.

9SVq4UX6wa_C7G-9Y3nHAw.text: The service was rather slow and I saw several employees talking in a corner and on their phones.while we waited for water.  The food was delicious and the drinks were pretty good.

0iuUddrM1cZ1NMC70pm3rQ.text: Really can't comment on the food here... But I can comment on the service around 4:30 pm on 7/16/16... Would give a half star if I could and that would be only for the girl that greeted us...  It was FUC'n horrible!!! We walked up, we were sat down next to the windows on the strip, and handed menus. And we sat. And then we sat some more. And then even more. Damn near 20 minutes of this $hit went on. Servers, (and when I say servers, I mean 4-5 at a minimum), walked by us, more than once, clearly saw our menus, (either open or after we had "made our choices", closed on the table top), without glasses of water in 105 degree heat. And not even a single one of them said absolutely anything to us like "Oh have you been helped"? "Would you like a glass of water"? "You're butt FUC'n ugly"... Something... Anything!!! THE only reason we waited as long as we did was because we were famished and felt like some Bubba Gump... We love the Shoreline Village location in the LBC.  Now, I have never been in the business of serving folks in a restaurant, or waiting tables for that matter, (unless you want to count working at Jack-in-the-Box as a teen), BUT I will say one thing... If I DID work in a joint like Bubba Gump AND saw patrons sitting for even 5 minutes without water, I would do one of two things:  1). Either offer them water, and get it to them myself, (even if it wasn't my table), or; 2). Tell the lame ass who WAS responsible for that table / area to get their $hit together and tend to their customers.  The place wasn't really even that busy.  Will never, EVER, waste my time and give that Hell Hole a shot at my dolla again.

1dZpRqOOaTx5bMD1R4zYmA.text: Today my friends and I decided to eat here as it was my friends first time to Vegas.. unfortunately my first five minutes in this establishment were completely ruined by the hostess or manager Sarah. Before arriving I had purchased a Slushy type drink at the Paris hotel.  As my friends and I started to walk up the stairs to enter the restaurant Sarah just pointed at me and basically says I can't come in with an open container. I understand that this is the restaurants policy but her entire approach made me not even want to come back. She was very rude and dismissive. As a former manager I wouldn't dream of speaking to anyone like how she did today.  First impressions are everything , especially if the first person you are interacting with is rude as hell. Won't be visiting this establishment, I'll go to one back home Thanks.

gUBKxo_qWQVEg6ckceeJJw.text: Las Vegas! Great service I had the fish and chips it was excellent the waiter was great, very courteous.  I also had the bread pudding it was outstanding!!! I had the blueberry lemonade......very good!!! Everything was good , very delicious.  So I will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Lemonade

8v0thWCc6bG7yvQJ4cYK5A.text: As a local, I was excited when we finally got one but my recent visit will cause me to never visit again. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich & my friend ordered the mahi. Both meals came out really fast and as we started eating, we realized that neither piece of our meat was cooked. I am not one to ever complain at restaurants but the chicken was pink and raw. The fish was gummy and uncooked. After informing our waiter he talked to the manager who did nothing for us. We decided to order dessert to make up for our awful meal. The cookie in the dessert was so hard we couldn't eat it. We had to finally ask for a manager.. who went on to tell us he wasn't sure why we would be on the strip during Memorial Day weekend and that he would have a talk with the chef. I'm not sure why we ended up paying full price for everything. I am extremely disappointed.. I love this restaurant but won't go on to recommend this food or service to anyone.

PSrBOVxHKCYTlR4CjDkIbw.text: I've been to this particular restaurant before, and enjoyed it. This time was no exception. The hosting staff quickly and easily sat us at a wheelchair accessible table.  Our server, Rafi, was an absolute delight and fun. She and her team were attentive without being obtrusive, and her playful banter just added to a very enjoyable late lunch.   We look forward to coming again soon.

YoOhViEfg1PLXNEo9iNGBA.text: Service was exceptional. Takes them awhile to get the food ready but it tastes decent. Kinda pricey for the portions we got. Rowdy environment. Nice view inside and out. I'd recommend the lobster salad. Burger was not worth it. Bubba gump bubba bubba bubba gump!

xw_15VpQGg427WGMyznIEA.text: The food was delicious and the service was excellent! Jessica is an awesome server and Jenny's Catch was superb! The crab legs were seasoned to perfection I was well pleased with my experience !

gFcBF0S9xv-Wm6dzYTz6HA.text: The manager, Sarah, had attitude and a fake smile... She was very concerned about respecting restaurant policy. We were two who arrived early out of a party of 6 and everyone was on their way. She would not seat us even if the restaurant was EMPTY. I pointed out to her that the rest of the group was minutes away, that the restaurant was empty and that we had come early because my mom wanted to eat right away. She said no because of POLICY. At this point, I would have left but the rest of the group were almost here. Terrible customer service... Please note I rarely complain about service, but this was unacceptable... To be left waiting in an empty restaurant on a weekday afternoon!  As for the food, bad tasteless greasy chain food. And they charge for bread. Please stay away... So many better options on the Strip. On a positive note, the staff in their store was very nice and helpful.

8KM2VlSYOAkuoMnrlDdlKw.text: This was my first time eating at Bubba Gumps and I was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was and at how great the service was.  Our servers name was Bryant and he was extremely chill and knew the menu pretty well. He made some menu recommendations and provided great conversation. Interacting with him makes me want to go back to Bubba Gumps Las Vegas.  WE NEED MORE SERVERS LIKE HIM!

JHDINU_i1V7NobRFmomLcg.text: The restaurant has good tasting seafood the price is a bit high for the portions you receive great view  a good atmosphere service is friendly food is like I said good but small portions the wait sometimes takes a while depending on what time of the day you go and what day of the week

YpMpI0Yp1euGC8d2Ma8blA.text: We stopped here for dinner on our last night in Vegas during our last trip. We just wanted to sit down and relax, we had had a LONG day. So when we saw Bubba Gumps we just said what the heck and got in line! We had a wait of maybe 30 minutes or so, not too bad. We were seated at a table and our server immediately took our drink orders. Our waiter was very nice, we liked him a lot.   We both ordered massive amounts of food haha, we were so hungry! We started with the popcorn shrimp appetizer which was surprisingly great. I had some huge platter of fried seafood, I loved it all. And my boyfriend had something similar which he also liked.   This place is a lot of fun, I bet kids would really like it. They also have these awesome special cups that you can take home.. They light up! Of course I had to get one:)  I would absolutely come here again because it was great and we had a fun time!

uYTRwYXncp8tLAW3QVT_aw.text: Ate at Bubba Gumps last night on the Strip.  Food was good enough but wait staff lacked enthusiasm and the elements of fun that I have experienced at other Bubba Gumps throughout the country.  I would try a different restaurant next time.

wSXaR3fMLxSSULahYOJ-MA.text: The view outside is cool, but overall im not really impressed with this place. I just had a grilled chicken sandwhich. The lobster mac in cheese my friend got was sent back. She probably couldve added salt and been fine, but as is it's pretty bland. Their drinks are decent though. Get the one that comes with the souvenior cup. It's pretty strong.

6EsqFOAx7p3gel-OP7n9eg.text: I have been to Bubba Gump a few times in other states and have always been pleased. This visit was the same. We had a long day of travel and preferred a casual meal over the Vegas glitz.  We wanted seafood, so even though we don't typically do chains we gave it a try. The food was really good. I had Mahi with vegetables and rice.  I was hungry and it hit the spot. The wait staff was fun as usual. They were efficient and friendly. One of my favorite things about this place is the Forest Gump Trivia. So if you are going brush up on your movie knowledge. The prices for food is what is expected in Vegas, really not too bad. Located on The Strip about midway down makes it an easy stop in if you are out walking.

yJkuuJ57e4KV91ltxf3IpQ.text: I've been here 3 times and I love it! The staff is great they know good customer service! I love how they ask you quick trivia questions about the Forrest Gump movie it's pretty fun. The food is great I ordered Mommas fried chicken and it is delicious, especially the mashed potatoes they tasted homemade. This is one of my go to places when I visit Vegas!

wJaeo7Oii2NX7Fl5U6oH3w.text: Love this place. Been here a few times now I am a local here in vegas. More locals should visit. The first time the homie Carlos was a great waiter and then Amanda was awesome the next time around. Still Carlos was more awesome not that Amanda was bad or anything. Then Q from down stairs acted like a fairy and made our experienced incredible. Will be back for sure!

lpF8QTw0QyzKe1YLrZ4oWg.text: Always a full house. If you utilize the "Run Forrest" or "Stop" signs, it can be hit or miss depending on the servers. I've noticed service is getting better at this location which I totally appreciate. The food is flavorful. Not too many healthy options, mostly fried options, so if you're watching what you eat or on a diet, be prepared to be let down or tempted. There are a lot of fun drink options if you want to hang out at the bar.

zcV-hQ9zJV5FUDtqD5RAIQ.text: Food was ok, not as great as the one in Anaheim. Service was ok, nothing great. Went unnoticed for about 10mins until someone approached us to take out order. Food was dry and salty but eatable again nothing spectacular. Probably won't come here again.

gDgVdwlGHabU4Z0PWnmkoA.text: I've heard so much about this place but was not impressed at all. Perhaps it's what I ordered ( stuffed shrimp) very mediocre served with white plain bland rice. Pear strawberry salad was better. Very meh. Waitperson was very nice and upbeat.

RajU7bQ_t-uukXrq9WDtkA.text: I live in the SF bay area but oddly enough I've never been to Bubba Gumps in our area. We were getting desperate and everything had a pretty long wait so we peeked in and there was no wait. The elevator was broken but one of their staff members helped us carry our stroller up the stairs. I got a seafood entre and the honey got ribs. He said the ribs were amazing. Mine was tasty but small portions. Our waiter was sweet. He checked on us constantly to ensure we were happy.

64DoL1a_pjaJ8xp7ziteiw.text: The bf and I were craving seafood on our last night in Vegas. Walking around the Miracle Mile shops, all the restaurants wanted to charge an obscene amount for seafood. In the end we found ourselves at Bubba Gump-- seafood craving satisfied, no wait time, wallet happy, and definitely buzzed.  I have to say Carlos really deserves this review. He was a great server, honest and to the point. For people like me who've never been to Bubba Gump, their menu is extensive and therefore a bit overwhelming. Carlos made some good suggestions based on customer favorites, as well as help us make a decision of Gumbo vs. Jambalaya. We went with the jambalaya. Best. Decision. Ever.  FOOD: - Deep Fried Calamari w/ Red Bell Peppers and Pepperoncinis. Served with Dippin' Sauces. ($10.29) : The Calamari was good. Could do without the additional veggies, and they need to give more tartar sauce! [3.5/5]  - Jambalaya (Blackened Chicken, Shrimp and Andouille Sausage, sauteed with Bell Pepper, Onions, and Rice in Bubba's own Spicy Sauce. Topped with Tomatoes and Green Onions. $17.99): The portion is deceptively a fair amount. Initially we thought it was a bit small on the platter, but even my hungry boyfriend couldn't finish it. And it made the best drunken munchies later that night. The rice was spicy and creamy, all it needed was some baby scallops! [4.7/5]  -Jenny's Catch with Lobster Butter Sauce (Pan seared Tilapia laid over Mashed Potatoes with sauteed Spinach and a creamy Lobster Butter Sauce. 19.99) : SO GOOD. The fish was cooked beautifully and not overcooked like in most restaurants. There were two good sized fillets served with this dish. My only complaint was the mashed potatoes were a bit lukewarm/cold. The lobster butter sauce was fantastic. [4.5/5]  Trust me, if you're looking for seafood this place has it at the best prices (unless you're doing buffets). The restaurants in the Miracle Mile Shops next door in Planet Hollywood were charging anywhere from $28-$50 for seafood, not to mention tiny portions.  If I'm ever in Vegas and craving seafood, I'll be back.

YDKxWInx8eVDAD3MUfT43Q.text: They don't make the clam chowder in the house anymore but the gumbo was made in house and it's quite delicious as always the coconut shrimp as always my favorite. Because the clam chowder is not made in house anymore I give it a four star rating but my coconut shrimp and the great service were provided really deserve a five.

lxZk6qfOSXD29edwhBMxMg.text: After posting my review the manager of this establishment did contact me and apologize for the service I received. He stated he would add credits to my loyalty card. That was 5 months ago. He never added anything or followed up with me. Way to go Landry's Bubba Gump - Vegas. Still love Saltgrass. Bubba Gump is horrible from bottom to top management. Hard to believe an establishment under the Landry's brand operates like this.

BhWFxh9zd-GaZzwgaq_onw.text: First time at Bubba Gumps and it was quite an experience. I really enjoyed it, surprisingly. They have a ton of chachski on the walls.. You never know quite where to look but the staff is exceptional. We had a small wait and to keep the patrons from getting antsy they quiz you on Forrest Gump trivia. I'm a quiz/puzzle person so personally I had a bunch of fun.  I felt their pricing was a bit over charged but its on the heart of the strip so its too be expected but otherwise.. all was good.. If they had a more convenient location I could see myself as a local going more. The food wasn't bad not was it exceptional so it isn't a restaurant I would go out of my way for but if im in the area again, i'd go back...

t1ztAaLcCEOevxPnY7yxBg.text: Very good shrimp and crab legs.  Staff was very nice and accompanying.  We were able to get right in no wait and food came out shortly after we ordered.

vyahX7g_D4Nht3zxNcL3AQ.text: We have been to several other bubba gump's in the past and found the food and service to be great. The las vegas one on the other hand not so much. Our server was okay but the food wasn't that great. I had the (i think it was called) the seafood feast. Twenty two dollars for 4 small shrimp 4 hush puppys and supposedly fish sticks. Which where some deep fried breading with a sliver of fish inside. Would have been better off at fast food

V1KUJRYOcTPNmWXh-mdPUQ.text: I stopped by this relatively new place on The Strip today after lunch because I had a business meeting nearby. I was shocked at how the interior space is utilized so well on The Strip in this location at the corner of Harmon Avenue. The entire place conveys a fun and engaging theme.   The view of The Strip from the outdoor balcony is sufficiently impressive to warrant your dining or drinking here just for that experience.  I had New Orleans Shrimp and a dark beer I'd never heard of with a marketing nightmare of a name, Moose Drool Brown Ale. Turns out the beer is excellent in spite of the crazy name, and I will order it again.   And oh yes, the New Orleans Shrimp was delicious and, to be honest, this dish exceeded my expectations because of the seasoning and presentation. This place comes across as well conceived and executed with smart management and an excellent staff.

Yx8mqcGUTsdjTYgerY344g.text: This review is about a month old. But anyways, I went to Vegas on a Monday and really didn't know what to eat so I pulled out my phone and started yelping. Bubba Gump came up so I told myself thats what i will have for dinner. I walked in and noticed this place is very big and very clean. I was seated right away. I ordered Forrest Seafood Feast! AND DAMN WHAT IT GOOD! It didn't look like a whole lot of food but it filled me up, The service is very good as well. All n all when i'm in Vegas again I would most definitely be back.

Esg_QzCNLoqxs_BdbtE9AA.text: It was our first time in Vegas, and we accidentally stumbled over this place. We did not have any idea about its food offering and how it rated with the gastronomic crowd. I'd say it was a pleasant experience for my group. Their clam chowder was good! I also liked their mahi mahi. More than anything else, our waitress named Amanda was simply amazing. I would recommend this place.

glwlJJlKvAX4oVNQ_tEUbQ.text: First let me say shrimp is everything baby !!! Came here for lunch I had the "I'm stuffed!" Shrimp which was large shrimp, crab stuffing, jasmine rice with garlic butter topped with Monterey Jack cheese and my best friend had the "Shrimpers Heaven" which was coconut shrimp, chilly shrimp, fried shrimp and Japanese style tempura shrimp all with fries and dipping sauces. Let me just say they totally delivered we shared our meal and everything tastes good!!! Since it was our first time there the sign system was one of the first things we learned and it totally was the best thing as far as getting your servers attention or any server at all. Dominick was our server and he was the best! He even shared a convo with us about Vegas and living out there and different things about the city. He was a really nice guy and he loved the Patriots so that was a bonus since we were from Boston. They service and food were definitely 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The after !!! Lol we tore it up ! Thank you staff at Bubba Gump!
Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m stuffed + shrimpers heaven mango lemonade and strawberry lemonade (Before)

G_uj3ln8Mq2doLXXA-gXeA.text: Fist time at Bubba Gump's even though there is one near Houston. Bianca was our server and she was very polite and informative since it was our first visit. The food was great, try the jambalaya. A little pricy, but worth it in my opinion. The drinks are tasty as well, plus you get to keep the glass with most of them. Landry's does it again!

HFT_qE7vSQ4RAv0DJVDA_A.text: First time with my sweetie in Vegas without the kids and we choose this restaurant because of its location and we were not disappointed!  It was beautiful!  Our waitress rocked it and took great care of us.  Food was to die for!  We will be going back on our next get away!

jkUmpEbh1kjDc1OsuW-iRw.text: Ok... The shrimp and fries were ok but the fish was not cooked all the way. The batter that they used wasn't even done all the way. The hush puppies were rather Interesting because they had corn and shrimp in the middle of them. It's was new for me and it was great. The service was outstanding because they had a License plate on the table that indicated run forest run, for the waiter to know that we didn't need anything. The other plate indicated stop forest stop for the waiter to stop at the table to see what we wanted.  Overall, I should of found a chicken joint to go to in Vegas. I would of spent less and and been  more happier. That meal I got with two soft drink was 30 bucks. I  Took a financial hit going here.

fQ0asnObw2xOgJiD5AsTkQ.text: Tried the shrimp New Orleans and the stuffed shrimp both were delish!!! Wanted to try some of the drinks but it's 113 degrees and I want to see/do more

yWPorZXXdNmNgD7-WHoMwA.text: Go for the food and service...stay and drink looking at the incredible view.  Bubba's is a casual dinning experience with a Five Star view adding the feel of a very special experience.  My Cocount Shrimp could not have been better and my husband ate every piece of his Gumbo.  He said the spice kick was just the right amount.  When the dish came and he saw how much was there he thought he could never finish -- but kept playing the "just one more taste" until it was all gone!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bubba Gump Shrimp View and patio

2u09zbSPNUorMt20JxKPDw.text: Amazing time!! Service was great. I don't remember our servers name, but he was so courteous and personable. He asked my friends and I trivia questions about the movie while we waited on our food. That definitely helped the time pass. Which wasn't long, because the kitchen was very fast. When the food did arrive, we didn't talk AT ALL. The seafood gumbo was melt-in-your-mouth delicious!! I was just very curious as to why there are no pictures of Bubba in the areas of the restaurant that caught my visual field (and I saw the whole place).

KxIOG3PnpHd6ao26teVtGw.text: From the outside it looks like is a great place to eat and dine at but in reality it was not all that great, overrated. Horrible customer service took about 20 minutes to get our table some drinks. Many employees walking around and was never asked if everything was ok or to take our order and took about another 30- 45 minutes to finally get our food. Definitely not going back to Bubbas when I go to Vegas again.  Oh and did I mention the forks were dirty?. had to ask for CLEAN set of utensils smh

-580GYNeSgFxklO9SakMFA.text: We enjoyed this location a lot. You can request to be seated on the balcony (if weather is nice) and watch the craziness of the Las Vegas Strip. Our food was pretty good, the clam chowder and the shrimp pasta. The chowder has nice flavor and plenty of chunks of clam. The pasta was done perfectly with lots of wonderful capers for every bite. Prices were not too bad considering it is on the Strip where they want to charge you $20+ for a hamburger. The real treasure of our visit to this restaurant was the service. From the time we were greeted until we left the staff treated us like friends. Our server, Zuri, might be one of the nicest people in the world. I would go here again, absolutely. Menu has a lot of fried and high carb dishes but also some more sensible fare.

ExUpmig7p-PJOV861O4wPA.text: Roach showed up on the booth I was sitting at right before our meal showed up. It was literally next to my shoulder. The Waitress saw it exactly at the same time my husband pointed it out and she killed it with a napkin. Manager offered the free meal but we just couldn't get ourselves to stay to eat after experiencing that. They also gave my husband a free glass that came with the beer he ordered.. So that was nice of them.

RxK4wIcJPsjpopLK_5cUtQ.text: Family with teens ate here.  Food was great.  Server, Cat, was super.  Each of us picked a different dessert and tried each of them.  They were amazing.   Wish we had a Bubba Gump near where we live.  We try to eat at Bubba Gump when on vacation where one is near.

k93zZXw0R1jhNKanxh7atA.text: Love the food and the sexy service, i will total be eatting here again when i come back to Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. - Las Vegas, NV, United States. so good

hIIk9ATnMNEOYSE2lvShEw.text: I love this place.  It's fun and quirky and if you're a Forrest Gump movie fan like I am, this is a must stop!  The waitresses will come and play trivia with you and test your movie IQ.  I love all the  movie memorabilia and I always check the clearance section in the store downstairs, you never know what cha gonna get! lol   the only thing is the food is just ok, I don't think I've ever eaten here and wanted more.  but I love the experience! and they do honor the troops by doing events and offering a discount in the store & restaurant.  Gotta love that!
